name: Comfortable  - and a great value!
neighborhood_overview: I love the diversity of my neighborhood and its proximity to shopping and restaurants.  I live on a beautiful parkway.
transit: The number 20 RTD bus is 2 blocks away to go downtown, or the other direction to the Anschutz Medical campus.   Easy transportation from the airport via RTD commuter rail, the University of Colorado A Line (nothing to do with the university - they just paid for the naming rights for the A Line)-$9 regular fare, $4.50 seniors (and some others who qualify for discounted fare, such as military I think)   From Central Park stop, take a 65 bus to right across from my house - the 26th and Monaco stop.  Or, I often am available and happy to pick you up from Central Park.  There is ample free street parking and also some space in my driveway.
house_rules: No Smoking!

name: Baker Studio Close to EVERYTHING
neighborhood_overview: Walking through the Baker historical neighborhood you will find a little bit of everything -- grand Victorian houses, quaint duplexes, small single-story homes, and newly-built condos.  It's an easy walk to restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, the shops and Mayan theater on Broadway, and the Santa Fe Arts District with gallery openings the first Friday of each month.
transit: RTD bus stop is within two blocks.  The #1 bus goes downtown.  Alameda Light Rail Station is about 1 mile south.  It's about a 15-minute walk to Denver Health Medical Center.  Very convenient to 6th Avenue and I-25 thoroughfares.
house_rules: - Absolutely no smoking of any kind (NOT 420 friendly). - No firearms. -Bookings less than 30 days must be charged Denver Occupancy/Lodger's tax of 10.75%, collected through Airbnb.   - Pets may be considered on a case by case basis. -The studio really cannot accommodate more than 2 people, hence the high charge for extra people. -Basics (2 rolls toilet paper, bag of coffee, tea bags) provided at check-in.  Products are not resupplied during the length of stay.

name: Spacious Cap Hill Condo (built in 1889) with yards
neighborhood_overview: Pleasant Neighbourhood
transit: Denver was rated one of the two worst cities *in the world* for accessibility of mass transit from the airport to the city. That said, we just got an airport train this year. And my neighborhood is one of the best for multi-modal transportation options. Bus. Bike share. Car share. As good as it is for this sharing stuff, it's pretty bad for parking. If you're bringing a car with you let me know and I'll tell you my strategy for finding parking, as well as the last-ditch-backup-secret-parking lot I've only had to use once in my five years here.
house_rules: No smoking tobacco.

name: Affordable S. Denver Guest House
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is eclectic and diverse. We have retirees, college students, families with young children, urban farmers, and even bee-keepers. You can walk to several great restaurants, ride your bike to the river trail, or just hop in your car and head to the mountains!
transit: Light rail is about a mile. From there you can head to downtown and beyond. The bus is about 3 blocks away. A car is preferred for most folks. But the adventurous enjoy the alternative transit, too. Lyft and Uber are always available. In the winter we recommend having a car.
house_rules: Check in time is after 3pm, please. Our neighborhood is very safe. But please use good judgment and always lock your car and the apartment when you are away. Please,  no smoking (of any kind) indoors. (420 edibles and vaporizer OK) Smoking outside is permitted but please dispose of butts in your own receptacle – not the yard. Remember that the smell is not everyone's favorite so be mindful of open windows in the main house and wind blowing smoke, etc. Thank you!  Pet owners, please be mindful of your pups and kitties. We recommend leaving them in the living room vs bedroom for the day if you're out as if they cry or whine they are less likely to be heard by the neighbor dogs in the living room. You are welcome to let your dog use the front yard. But, please remember to scoop those poops!  Linens are laundered with sterilizing temperature water and changed prior to your arrival. name: Highland Snug
neighborhood_overview: The Lower Highland (LoHi) section of the Highland neighborhood lies just west of downtown Denver, next to Coors Field, Pepsi Center, Confluence park and the newly renovated Union Station transportation hub.  Many exciting and innovative restaurants are located in Highland, including Root Down, Lola, Linger, Old Major and Littleman Ice Cream.
transit: New! Plane to Train to Snug.  There is a new light rail train from the airport to Union Station.  It takes about 37 minutes and cost $9.  We will pick you up at the train station making your arrival to Denver and the Snug easy and worry-free.  We have a local Enterprise car rental office close by the Snug in case you decide you need to rent a car.  But, with bikes, Car2Go, ZipCar and Uber, there are many inter-city transportation alternatives to renting a car.

house_rules: Please No Pets and NO smoking of ANY substance  See the Pot info below.. Because of the large number of visitors coming to partake in the new marijuana legalization please note my loft and all its common areas are NON SMOKING - ALL SUBSTANCES    Here are some FAQs regarding the new "POT" Laws   Where am I allowed to consume retail marijuana?  Answer - Retail marijuana is intended for private, personal use. Such use is only legal in certain locations not open or accessible to the public. Marijuana may not be consumed openly or publicly. Can I consume marijuana in public? Answer - No, it is illegal to consume marijuana in public.  This includes but is not limited to areas accessible to the public such as transportation facilities, schools, amusement/sporting/music venues, parks, playgrounds, sidewalks and roads and outdoor and rooftop cafes. It is also illegal to smoke at indoor-but-public locations like bars, restaurants and common areas in buildings.

name: Washington Park Stunning Townhouse
neighborhood_overview: ABOUT THE NEIGHBORHOOD/LOCATION: - Its Wash Park – just look up wash park and Denver and you will get lot of information for this location. - It is a premier location for the city, with great access to Denver’s most highly rated park, easy access to downtown and Cherry Creek.   - Restaurants, bars and other stores very close, but not close enough to affect noise or any level of inconvenience or crime. name: Private room in the nest - w/bathroom
neighborhood_overview: The place is in Baker District, within walking distance of the place is the Santa Fe Arts district and the south Broadway district.  The Santa Fe arts  district to the west has 1st Friday events, many many galleries, several breweries and a few very good Mexican Restaurants, one of which has one of the best patios in Denver.  To the east is the South Broadway area which is filled with shopping, restaurants, bars, a vintage movie theater, ice cream, salons, Walgreens, a yoga studio, thrift stores, coffee shops, book stores & several breweries. Restaurants range from pizza by the slice to a few notable dining establishments that won’t disappoint.  There is also a rec center 1 block away with a swimming pool, weight machines and basket ball courts that one can purchase limited use passes to. Across the street is  a city park with a playground and basketball courts and lots of grass to lay down in and stare at the sky.
transit: If  you really need to leave the neighborhood we are super close to local transportation. 1 block to the Bus line #1, and an 8min walk to the lightrail. There is also a BCycle station just a few blocks away. (our bike share system) Lyft & Uber are usually circling the neighborhood and if you want your own ride, Denver has a great Car2Go system with little rides not too far away usually.
house_rules: No smoking in the house, back deck is fine. No hassling the pup. It's his house. Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen.

name: ☆Charming Studio☆ Close to Everything/Free Parking
neighborhood_overview: Wash Park is one of the best neighborhoods in Denver. It is located in South Central Denver, close enough to enjoy downtown, Capital Hill, and trendy Cherry Creek. The neighborhood is known for the amazing park just two blocks away. Covering 165 acres, it is one of the largest parks in Denver. Joggers, cyclists, and dog-walkers all flock here and in nice weather, volleyball nets are set for everyone to use. For nightlife, we recommend heading up to the shops and restaurants on Old South Gaylord street (about a 10 minute walk) or if you are looking for something a little more trendy, you can head to Cherry Creek.
transit: We have ample street parking if you are bringing a car. The closest bus stops are about a 10 minute walk (either across the park or on University Blvd). Also, we are located just 5 minutes from the highway for easy access to the mountains to experience Colorado's world class skiing (the slopes are about an hour and half out).

name: Urban Retreat with Private Bath
neighborhood_overview: Developed in recent years on a former Air Force base, the Lowry neighborhood is a mixed-use community that retains many historic buildings. Sidewalks and pedestrian paths connect several parks. Spruce House, as I call the place, is located about a one-quarter-mile walk (or drive) from the town center, which includes restaurants, coffee houses, a grocery store, shops and other commercial outlets, as well as a bus stop. The Wings Over the Rockies museum is also nearby, as are a public library, post office and gyms. The Eating Recovery Center is just steps away. Lowry is less than 10 minutes by car from the Cherry Creek shopping area and the United Airlines Flight Training Center, less than 15 minutes from the Anschutz medical campus, less than 20 minutes from downtown and approximately one-half hour from Denver International Airport. With its proximity to the airport and to I-70, Spruce House is a great place to stay for travelers who are bookending a drive into the mountains by flying i
transit: Private vehicles, urban hiking and bicycling are good ways to get around from Lowry's convenient location. Otherwise, cabs, ride-sharing services and buses are available.
house_rules: Quiet time is observed from about 10:30 p.m. to 6 a.m. The house is not child-proofed. No overnight unregistered guests or large parties. No smoking inside and no excessive use of alcohol or other substances. No illegal activities.

If there is anything else you need, can't find, something is bugging you, please do not hesitate to let us know so we can try to remedy it. NO UNREGISTERED GUESTS AT ANY TIME. Thank you.

name: ZEN! Best Location In Denver! Clean and Quiet.
neighborhood_overview: THIS IS THE BEST LOCATION IN DENVER:  My house is in a quiet tree lined neighborhood, with free parking.  It is also a short 1 mile walk to the center of Downtown.  There is no car needed for a full vacation with a huge variety of entertainment, food, parks... Walk out the front door and two doors down and you are at restaurant row.  At your feet are seven restaurants and a casual bar. Within one block distance is Humboldt Farm Fish Table (a top-rated restaurant in Denver),  7-11, and Qdoba.  Walk another block and you will find Starbucks, coffee shops, fast food, bars, restaurants, sushi, and shops. Our neighborhood is officially City Park West, but is also called North Capitol Hill, Uptown, and Whittier Heights.  We are adjacent to Downtown, Capitol Hill, the Central Business District CBD, Five Points, Central, Cheesman Park, Congress Park, Curtis Park, Baker, Lincoln Park, and LoDo.
transit: B-Cycles are available across the street.  There are buses that pick up and drop off one block from my house and run every 15 minutes into downtown. St. Joseph’s Hospital, St. Luke’s Hospital, and Children's Hospital are two blocks down. Denver's premier music scene is 5-7 blocks down, close enough to walk, but far enough for quiet tranquility. City Park and Chessman Park are a few blocks away Downtown, Botanic Gardens, Museums, and the Civic Center are a one mile walk. Walk a few more blocks to the Colorado Convention Center, Denver Center of Performing Arts, the Rockies, 16th Street Mall and many other attractions.

name: Queen en suite in lovely Victorian
neighborhood_overview: We’re located in central Denver, one block from the Denver Botanic Gardens.  It’s a neighborhood full of trees and old houses from the 1800’s, like our house. But it also has quick and easy access to downtown Denver. What we love about our neighborhood: Restaurants and shops within walking/biking distance.   4 parks and the Denver Botanic Garden very nearby.  City Park, 6 blocks away, has the zoo, the museum of nature and science, a lake to paddle-boat on.  Jazz in the Park every Sunday evening in the summer. Bike paths close to us.
transit: The Route 10 bus to downtown Denver stops a block from our house.  B-cycle bike rentals also a block away.  And we have Car2go, Uber and Lyft here. Also, Denver recently added cute little scooters with Lime and Bird. We still recommend renting a car if you want to go into the mountains.   The trip from DIA is about 35-40 minutes.  You can take the Supershuttle or a taxi if you want to be dropped at our door.  The A-train goes from the airport to Union Station and you can take Uber or Lyft the remaining 3.5 miles to our house. (Or you can catch the Route 10 bus, which will take you to a stop 1 block from our house, but the bus can be a pain with luggage. Route 10 bus will always get you downtown later, though, to avoid parking!) Speaking of Parking:   We have free on-street parking Remember to check with us before parking on the street in the summer, because on some concert dates at the Denver Botanic Gardens, the year-round free parking becomes high-ticketed parking! name: Sunny Home in Historic Curtis Park
neighborhood_overview: 5 Points is Denver's historic African American downtown. Once upon a time, Welton Street was home to some of the greatest jazz clubs in the country. The famous Rossonian is in the process of being restored to it's former glory and many music venues have sprung up around the neighborhood. Though the gentrification of 5 Points is well underway, it's residents are hoping to preserve it's diversity and sense of community.   This part of Denver is growing and changing rapidly! There are tons of galleries, street art, breweries, restaurants and bars nearby. We are close to Downtown but still quiet and neighborhood-y. please checkout our guide book to see our recommendations. *This is an Urban environment. If you are uncomfortable being around folks of different cultures, classes, or colors, please find a different neighborhood to stay in.
transit: From the airport, take the train from to the 38th and Blake station and our house is a short taxi or Uber from there. You could also take the light rail but there are multiple transfers involved. Once you've arrived, our house is just steps away from the Light Rail (which goes directly to the convention center and connects to the entire Denver system).  B-cycle station is a short walk, as is the 30th and downing bus station.
house_rules: Our home is in close proximity to our neighbors so please be quiet and respect their space.

name: Clean & comfortable in heart of Denver
neighborhood_overview: Baker is a historic neighborhood in the heart of Denver. Our place is just four blocks to South Broadway and five blocks to Santa Fe, both are filled with restaurants, bars, art galleries and so much more. Less than two miles from downtown, convention center, cap hill, and wash park ($5 uber ride, 10 minute bike, 30 minute walk).  Light rail station, bus stops and bike share all within a few blocks of our front door.  We are on a quiet, safe street with ample parking. Santa Fe Art District is definitely worth checking out (especially on first Friday!) and places like Lena, The Historians, Beatrice & Wodsley and Punch Bowl Social on South Broadway are great for a fun night out.
transit: We are in a very walkable neighborhood and a five minute drive from downtown. A light rail station and several bus stops are an easy walk from our place. I definitely suggest the new train from DIA if you're flying in! There is also a bike share location at 1st and Broadway which is an affordable and fun way to get around Denver.  Walkability score: 85! We have plenty of parking (and an off-street spot in our driveway) if you bring a car. We definitely suggest ditching your rental and utilizing uber, bikes and public transportation instead. You'll save money and see more of Denver that way.
house_rules: All smoking outside only please. 420 friendly back yard!

name: Cozy BUNGALOW-Loft & Studio 5 Mins to Downtown!
neighborhood_overview: The main thoroughfares around the house are home to some of Denver's most amazing international fare, including Vietnamese, Mexican, Thai, and Chinese.  It's what I love about being at home and what I hope you will enjoy, too.  The houses in the area are mostly quaint, single-family houses of about 1-3 bedrooms.  There is a small park with a playground about a block away and a larger park with a pool and pond and rolling hills for sledding (in the winter) within about a half mile.  Mile High Stadium is  about nineteen blocks away, and you have easy access to highways that cut north-south and east-west within a few blocks of the house.
transit: First, if you need help getting to or from the house from the airport, let us know.  We can sometimes offer rides for rates that beat taxi fares.   The 1 Bus has a stop within a couple blocks from the house ((website hidden))  The closest Light Rail station is about a mile away.   Enterprise Car Rental has several lots that will pick you up if you order a rental car.
house_rules: Pretty easy --either myself or a caretaker will meet you with the keys and show you the house (you must meet one of us in-person to get in --we don't leave keys out).  Dishes go to the dishwasher, I'll clean linens and towels after departure, treat my space and things with the courtesy you'd expect of others.  Be good to my neighbors.  No smoking in the house and save the parties for Motel 6. If you have any questions while you're at the house, just call.

name: DENVER SUITE WITH A MOUNTAIN VIEW CENTRAL LOCATION
neighborhood_overview: IDEAL LOCATION: Walk out of this suite, take the elevator down, step through the lobby and you are THERE, truly in DOWNTOWN! The Performing Arts Center is just a half block away. The Convention Center is just two blocks away as is historic Larimer Square, with all of its restaurants, cafes, bars, happenings-- and the ever popular 'MARKET'- a deli/coffee shop. On the corner is Sam's Diner, open early and late which offers up a true slice of city life and great people watching. Everything else is an easy walk, including the Pepsi Center, Platte Valley, Union Station, the Denver Art Museum, the Clyfford Still Museum, Museum of Contemporary Art, Coors Field baseball stadium. Confluence Park (REI, river walk and kayaking) Elitch Gardens Theme Park  as well as Tattered Cover bookstore and many other sporting and cultural attractions.
transit: Enjoy walking to your favorite destinations including the Theater District, Larimer Square, the 16th Street mall and Coors Field. Quick commutes will soon include the new Union Station hub with connections to DIA as well as the Denver Tech Center, the Federal Center, Park Meadows and Littleton.  Please use bus, light rail or sky-ride  RTD schedule.

name: Stapleton Carriage House
neighborhood_overview: Our Carriage House is located in the Eastbridge neighborhood of the Stapleton Redevelopment. This a a new neighborhood built on the former site of the Stapleton International Airport. The neighborhood has been developed according the new urbanism design principles with 1/3 of the land devoted to parks and open space. It is a great neighborhood for families, walking and bicycling. A grocery store, restaurants and a regional recreation center with a pool and workout facilities are located less than 3 blocks away. The neighborhood also operates 6 outdoor pools in the summer months.
transit: There is ample on street parking for personal vehicles. The apartment is located within 2 blocks of RTD Bus Route 89 that provides weekday hourly service between the Central Park Commuter Rail Station and the Anschutz Medical Campus. We are located within 2 miles of both the Central Park and Peoria Stations that serve the A Line commuter rail between Denver International Airport and Downtown Denver.  The Peoria Station also serves the I-225 light rail line (R Line) through Aurora in lat 2016. The closest highway access is I-70 at Havana Street. Uber and Lyft both operate in Denver along with a number of traditional taxi services. Stapleton is outside the Denver Car2Go home area, however, their cars are available at the nearby Central Park Station and Anschutz Medical Campus.

name: Large Downtown Home Walking Distance Sleeps 10!
neighborhood_overview: "Cultures blend in historic Five Points, one of Denver's oldest and most diverse neighborhoods. The district was known as the "Harlem of the West" because it was a frequent stop for jazz greats including Billie Holiday, Louis Armstrong and Miles Davis, who played clubs like the Rossonian and the Rainbow Room. The neighborhood was also mentioned repeatedly in Jack Kerouac's On the Road. Today, historic Five Points' creativity and vibrancy live on in a fascinating fusion of old and new. Visitors can stop in at innovative coffeehouses and craft breweries, visit museums telling stories from the past or eat at beloved soul food and barbecue institutions." Read more about Five Points from the VISIT DENVER website.

name: Private apt in Berkeley MTN Views!
neighborhood_overview: Our homes are situated in the Berkeley neighborhood which is filled with beautiful parks,  lovely vistas, exceptionally outstanding restaurants and charming boutiques. This is a park like property with lots of room and every space on Airbnb has a private entrance,  bathing facilities and cooking facilities.   It is also very easy to access all the practical services from grocery stores to hairdressers  to cleaners to beauty treatments,  yoga and pet services. It is about 10 minutes by car to the downtown performing arts center and it takes just under an hour to reach the Loveland skiing/ snowboarding area ( which we love.) Convenience,  comfort and the charm of a small town all amazingly close to the delights of downtown Denver and wonders of the Rockies.
transit: A car is certainly helpful in Denver but our family has used bikes to get everywhere as well. There are lots of beautiful trails and routes for bicyclists and there are also buses that take one anywhere in the area. We are 30 minutes by car from the airport, around 8 minutes from downtown and about one hour from the Loveland ski area.

name: Comforts of Home in RiNO - 3bd/2ba
neighborhood_overview: The house is a five minute drive or bike ride to: - The main highways, I-25 and I-70 - Larimer Street: Larimer Lounge and Meadowlark music venues, Megafauna indie boutique, Crema and Hutch & Spoon cafes, Nooch Vegan Market, Infinite Monkey Winery, Mile High Spirits, Populist Restaurant, Our Mutual Friend Malt and Brew, and Matchbox bar. My home is walking distance to Jake's restaurant, the Walnut Room restaurant, Black Shirt Brewing, and the RiNO art district.
transit: It's a straight shot from the airport via I-70, about a 20 minute drive depending on traffic. If you're not renting a car, Super Shuttle is available a less expensive than cabs and Uber is about half the price of cabs (they can legally pick up from the airport). Uber or Lyft is also recommended for overall transportation versus cabs, and Car2Go is also available in Denver, which works great if you're solo or have one other person. There is also a bus stop (bus #44) at the end of the block with a route that takes you right into downtown Denver. It is less than a mile from Denver's Light Rail system that goes through downtown, to the stadium, to southern parts of Denver all the way to the Denver Tech Center. If you have a car, there's plenty of street parking. There is street sweeping the second Wednesday every month from April through November, so that warning is included in the home manual.

name: 2 Bdrm Suite in Victorian (Denver Botanic Gardens)
neighborhood_overview: Directly across from the Denver Botanic Gardens (you can use our membership). We're on one of the main streets through town (Josephine), but also back on an old neighborhood with lovely houses and lots of trees. So treesy with old houses, but close to a LOT: - 2 blocks to restaurants, coffeeshop, market, laundromat - 1 block to Denver Botanic Gardens, B-cycle station, bus stop to downtown - 4 blocks to full gym and rec center with indoor pool, Cheesman park, Congress park with outdoor pool - 5 blocks to Tattered Cover bookstore, Sei film center, and Colfax Ave with more restaurants and coffee shops - 6 blocks to City Park! which has the Zoo, Nature and Science Museum (you an use our membership), a lake, geese, jazz concerts every Sunday evening in summer - 2 miles to the west, Denver Art Museum, Capitol, Colorado History Museum (we bike there) - 11 minute drive west (3.5 miles) to Union Station, the furthest point of LoDo (lower downtown, the funnest area of downtown). You can bus it,
transit: Free on-street parking out front and on 11th Avenue. The Route 10 bus stops a block away, and gets you to the heart of lower downtown (LoDo) in 20 minutes.  I can bike downtown in 20 minutes too, and prefer it.  B-cycle stations are very close - 2 stations within 2 blocks of our house.  Denver has Car2go, Lyft, Uber, Zipcars in our neighborhood. The Colorado Mountain Express can take you to the mountain towns. The A-train takes you to and from the airport from Union Station in lower downtown Denver.
house_rules: Please put your cups and other dishes in the dishwasher or hand wash. If there are other guests staying in the home, please be thoughtful about noise. That's it!

name: Like-New Victorian House 8blks2dwtn
neighborhood_overview: Curtis Park is a neighborhood of historic Victorian homes and urban rowhouses, on the edge of downtown--just 8 blocks north, and 3 blocks from LightRail and B-Cycle self-serve bike rental.  Walkable to coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, as well as downtown, conventions, and sporting events. Curtis Park is a great neighborhood, considered an 'area of change' by some; however, we often walk to & from downtown and take a stroll around the neighborhood in the evenings. Our street is a delightfully urban mix of townhomes old and new, 'painted lady' Victorian mansions, deli and storefronts, single-family homes and a few apartments. Within a few blocks, you will find all Denver has to offer--our finest dining & transit as well as some less fortunate neighbors. If you are open to city dwelling with a diversity of neighbors, you, too, will fit right in at your 'home away from home.'
transit: Location: - A 5-minute walk: Safeway grocery & their Starbucks, drop-in nail salon, pilates & yoga studios, breweries abound, gourmet coffeeshops, and the public Curtis Park/pool/Glenarm Rec Center as well as some of Denver's finest new restaurants. - Walk Score: 85, easy to walk downtown, or a short $8 cab ride. - Within walking distance to the RiNo arts district, Larimer Street & nearby are overflowing with new brewpubs and hip bars, or a 20 minute stroll to the free 16th Street shuttle. Active guests won't mind the mile and a half walk to all of downtown's restaurants, amenities and parks, with easy access to the Cherry Creek/Platte River bike trails. - Walk or bike to a Rockies/Broncos game or convention center; you'll be less than 2 miles from any of Denver's sporting venues and the heart of downtown.  - LightRail to football/hockey/sporting events, convention center, downtown, and the Tech Center.  - Drive 15-20 minutes to the Cherry Creek area, Foothills/Golden/Evergreen, our mo
house_rules: Treat this home as yours. We provide a variety of items for your use, and only ask that you treat them as you would your own and keep things neat and tidy. Everything is yours to use (except one cabinet) and information provided in a manual. I'm happy to recommend local places to visit. Please, no smoking (of anything) in the house;heavy smokers should look elsewhere. To reduce the risk of fire and annoyance, no candles, no indoor smoking, no parties, and no more than five people at the home. No illegal activities, including underage consumption of anything.  Any out-of-the-ordinary cleaning such as stains, excessive trash or dirt created by the guest must be performed by the guest; if this is not completed or additional cleaning is needed, an additional cleaning fee will be discounted from the security deposit.

name: Newly Renovated Apartment-Perfect for Families!
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood! It is a quiet neighborhood with older brick homes and tree-lined streets just west of downtown. It is just 10-minutes to downtown via car or light rail. Our location offers quick and easy access to many of Denver's popular destinations including the Denver Convention Center, Denver Performing Arts Complex, Sports Authority Field (we've walked to events there), Auraria Campus (Metro State and UCD), Pepsi Center, the Capitol Building and all of the shopping and dining of LoDo.  Plus we are just 3 blocks to beautiful Sloan's Lake Park with killer views of the mountains and downtown. It has a 3-mile running path, lake, tennis courts and playgrounds.  King Soopers (grocery store), Target and a handful of dining options are just minutes away. Our past tenants easily made the walk- plus you can even go through the park to stay off main roads.
transit: Getting around is easy with our central location!  If you are coming into Denver from the airport and don't want to rent a car you may want to consider taking the A line train. This train costs $9 and will take you to Union Station. From there you can call an Uber/Lyft to get to our house. It is a 10 minute ride and costs about $8-10. Alternatively you can switch trains (without additional cost) and hop on the W Line of the light rail. Exit at Perry St. Our home is just a 5-7 minute walk from the Perry St. station. If you have more than 3 or more people in your party, taking and Uber/Lyft from the airport to our house is usually the less expensive option.  Light Rail: As I mentioned our house is located just a 5-7 minute walk to the W Line of the light rail.  Other direct stops on the W line include Auraria Campus, Sports Authority Field and Pepsi Center and Golden. At Union Station, you can hop on the free shuttle which will take you up/down the length of LoDo.  BUS: We are one block
house_rules: Please no smoking of any kind on the property. THIS INCLUDES VAPE PENS. Eat all the edibles you want,  they taste better anyway. Please do not bring unregistered guests back to the property.  Please do not park in our driveway.  We will not enter the apartment without being invited. Please do the same for our home (with the exception of passing through our kitchen of course).

name: Curated & Comfy Home in Lohi/Highlands
neighborhood_overview: The Highlands neighborhood is currently the hottest neighborhood in Denver.  Two blocks away there are coffee shops, shopping, restaurants, sports bars and lounges.  Several of the top highly rated restaurants are located within 5-7 blocks for foodies.  As well as authentic Mexican and Italian food restaurants that have been in the neighborhood for many years.  The location of my home is ideal for parking and quiet, yet also close to day and evening entertainment.  There are also several parks nearby for tennis or basketball and it is a bike friendly town, with rental bikes available a few blocks away.  It also well located for it's proximity to downtown Denver, which can be reached on foot in 15 - 20 min or by taxi in 5min.  I suggest guests walk around to the local places and if they want to explore further in good weather I would rent the red bikes.  I'm happy to recommend restaurants and bars.  If you are coming for the city life then explore Highlands and downtown Denver.  If you
transit: Bus stations within 2 blocks, rental bikes and car2go are all over the neighborhood.  Can walk to Union Station for light rail and Amtrak to further away destinations.  Downtown is a 20 min walk.

name: Great Cheeseman Park Full Studio Apartment
neighborhood_overview: A confluence of different areas of Denver: Just to the southwest is Cheesman Park, a great place to hang out, walk, or jog.  Two blocks to the south is the Denver Botanic Gardens, which is very peaceful and open any time of year.  Further south is swanky Cherry Creek North, with many of Denver's finest restaurants and stores, & the Cherry Creek Mall.  To the east about 5 blocks are a few neighborhood restaurants like top rated Shells and Sauce.  Across the street on 13th street are Liks Ice Cream Shop and Wyman's Bar.  Just two blocks to the north you run right into the gritty and storied Colfax Avenue, written about in Jack Kerouac's "On the Road" in the 1950's.  Within 4 blocks of the apartment on Colfax you will find a new Illegal Pete's Mexican Restaurant/Bar, top rated Pinche Tacqueria, a British Football bar, Noodles & Co, Which Wich (delicious sandwiches), etc.  Just to the east on Colfax is a Chipotle, Tattered Cover independent book store, and an independent theater.  Further
transit: There is decent street parking.  Centrally located for a short Uber ride all over Denver.  Nearby buses.  B-Cycle Denver Bike Rental stations are 1-2 blocks away in either direction.

name: Beautiful Private Basement Suite near Downtown
neighborhood_overview: Many historical homes with a beautiful park nearby. Tons of ethnic restaurants, museums, and places of interest within walking distance from our address. There are 4 breweries within a mile; another 6 breweries within 2 miles. Excellent music venues are close by; 2 (Fillmore and Ogden Theater) are a couple blocks away. Public transportation and bike rentals are convenient from our location.
transit: We are walking distance to many attractions and downtown. Public transit is also convenient. We are located 1 1/2 blocks from the #10 bus line that picks up in Cheesman park and runs all the way across downtown on 15th street, providing easy walking access to all downtown transfer stations and light rail. The #10 bus drops off one block from the Denver Convention Center, and ends at the Denver Aquarium. Coors Field is 5 short blocks off the bus line. Uber is also an attractive option - generally $7 or less to anywhere downtown from our address.

name: Cozy and Convenient in Capitol Hill
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the heart of Capitol Hill.  The neighborhood was developed during the Victoria Era, so the properties here are beautiful.  I especially love the old-growth trees and the lovingly tended gardens all throughout the neighborhood.  Most importantly, just about everything of interest in Denver is only minutes away: downtown Denver and the Convention Center, great restaurants and pubs, music venues, parks, libraries, museums, it's all close by.
transit: Getting around Denver from here is really easy.  There are 2 major bus routes  one block from my front door, the 15 on Colfax and the 10 which stops in Cheesman Park.  It is a 10 minute car ride to both major highways, I-70 and I-25.  Via 6th Avenue, you can be in the foothills of the Rockies within 15 - 20 minutes, depending on traffic.  Walking distance to downtown Denver is about 15 minutes, exactly 15 blocks in fact.

name: Peaceful Retreat in Congress Park
neighborhood_overview: Congress Park is a quaint little neighborhood in the center of Denver.  It's tree lined streets, neighborhood restaurants and cafes and it's proximity to several of Denver's beautiful parks and gorgeous parkways make it the ultimate walkable neighborhood.  Also close by is National Jewish Hospital which make this home great for people who are visiting this state of the art hospital.
transit: This is perhaps the MOST walkable neighborhood in all of Denver!  The house is centrally located to everything from parks and recreation to shopping.  There is a bus line with a stop only 2 blocks away and it runs to downtown.  There is plenty of parking on the street so if you come with your own car you won't need to worry!  Taxi and Uber (town car service) are also easy ways of getting around Denver.  If you don't have an Uber account - get one!  You will be glad you did.
house_rules: Please make yourself at home but understand that this is my home too!  I also work from home several days a week and cannot be available to chat during those times.   You are free to keep some things in the fridge and use the kitchen but please clean up after yourself.   ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING

name: Great Value Highlands Bungalow!
neighborhood_overview: The Highlands neighborhood is currently the hottest neighborhood in Denver. Just a few blocks away there are coffee shops, shopping, restaurants, sports bars and lounges. Several of the top highly rated restaurants are located within a mile for foodies.  You will also find authentic Mexican and Italian food restaurants that have been in the neighborhood for many years. The location of my home is ideal for parking and quiet, yet also close to day and evening entertainment. There are also several parks nearby for running, tennis or basketball and it is a bike friendly town, with rental bikes available a few blocks away. It is also well located for it's proximity to downtown Denver, which can be reached by bike in 15-20 min or by taxi in 5 min.
transit: Easy access to I-70 and I-25 by car and plenty of public transportation options. Guests can have access to a beach cruiser to get around to all the great restaurants, bars, and entertainment venues around the Highlands and downtown.
house_rules: No smoking or drugs inside the house.  Well behaved dogs considered with pet deposit.

name: Charming, cozy, private hideaway
neighborhood_overview: What don't I love? The Highlands/Berkeley neighborhood is where my late husband chose our first home ...without me ... over 35 years ago. He grew up in spectacular Aspen, Colorado, and I was born and raised in the beautiful, mild San Francisco Bay Area. Though initially dubious when he brought me to our new, urban home, within one month I was convinced it far surpassed, for sheer livability and daily delight, any of my previous homes. It feels like a lively little town, with everything from a super market and natural grocer, to two libraries, several parks, shopping of all sorts, yoga, a beautiful university, schools, gyms, auto repair, bars , coffee shops, book stores, antique shops, boutiques, fabulous restaurants and beauticians for nails, hair and mind,  several veterinarians and much more in easy walking distance, yet we are about eight minutes from downtown Denver by car which means it is a snap to go to the symphony, opera or a music concert, or visit a world class museum or Chi
transit: There are bus stops within a few blocks and Uber is easy to use and ubiquitous. There are also stations for renting bicycles a walk away and it is pleasant terrain for biking.
house_rules: There are several lovely dogs on the property -- occasionally other guest's pups will be out in the yard as well. They will not have access to your apartment.  Please be sure to shut all gates and doors so no pets are allowed to roam beyond their designated areas.  Absolutely NO smoking is allowed -- not tobacco, not marijuana, not anything else. Please take off your shoes in the house. Please be sure to shut lights when not in use or in residence. Please keep shower curtains in the tub or shower when showering. Please use water wisely -- Colorado is drought-prone. Please let us know exactly what pets you may be bringing, and be sure to pick up after dogs if you leave them out in the yard. In general, there will be a nominal extra charge for cleaning when a pet stays with us  There will be an extra charge for cleaning if serious fur, hair or pet-related soil is found on the curtains or linens. This will be taken from the deposit. This is the owner's residence, so permission is required

neighborhood_overview: The Highlands is, in our opinion, the best neighborhood in Denver.  From our house we are a quick walk to some great restaurants and bars, and a 15 minute walk to Highland Square and LoHi.  The Universal, an incredible breakfast place, is a block away and Ernie's, a great neighborhood bar/pizza place is 4 blocks away. The neighborhood is easy access to Coors Field (Rockies), Pepsi Center (Avs, Nuggets, Concerts) and Mile High (Broncos).

With a young child, we take our sleep seriously, so we request that our guests be respectful of our night time sleep--relatively quiet after 10pm.   No cigarette/cigar smoking and no drugs that are illegal in CO.   If you choose to enjoy the CO greenery, please be considerate if smoking and open a window while you are home to keep air flowing. name: High-Rise Condo in Heart of Denver
neighborhood_overview: THE NEIGHBORHOOD The neighborhood is great!  There's some great dining, live music, awesome bars, the theater district, tons of nightlife, sporting events and concerts in walking distance, and 14th Street recently went through a multi-million dollar renovation. Oh, and there are breweries, distilleries, and even wineries in the area! Want to escape to the mountains for the day?  It's easy to access the highway and you'll be entering the mountains within about 15 minutes of leaving the city.  On top of that, there is a Hertz in the building.
transit: GETTING AROUND Denver has some awesome pockets of neighborhoods worth checking out, simply ask me what I recommend based on your interests and I'll point you in the right direction. Car2Go is a car share program that is extremely affordable if you're signed up.  If you're not, look into it and sign up in case it takes them a day or two to get your account live. There is a light rail station across the street.  Union Station for nearly all bus routes, trains, and the train to the airport is a short walk away, and there are plenty of cabs.  B-cycle is a bike share program that you can sign up for when you arrive, it's about $9 per day (I'm not certain on all the pricing so check out their website first) or you can sign up for longer periods with discounts.  There is a B-cycle station across the street and many throughout the city - available year round. Parking - In building garage parking available at an extra cost (this is generally a "market price" situation as some owners in the buil
house_rules: HOUSE RULES No pets, no smoking (anywhere in the building), please simply be respectful of my property, and the neighbors in the building. If you have a complaint, or just need something, please don't hesitate to notify me.  There's nothing worse than having an unhappy guest who doesn't communicate his/her feelings while something can still be done to remedy!

Close to City Park with the Zoo and Natural Science Museum, RiNo Arts district, Source a new local eatery/coffee/market, and many local breweries and coffee shops.

name: Inviting Re-Imagined Row House with Yard
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in Lincoln Park just outside of downtown, and blocks from the Santa Fe Arts District. The Cherry Creek trail is blocks away, perfect for biking or running, or a brisk walk to surrounding neighborhoods. Easily walk to the Denver Convention Center, The Performing Arts Center, Denver Art Museum, or the Pepsi Center within minutes & avoid driving. Supermarket handily located around the corner; unique restaurant experiences & breweries are nearby, as well.
transit: Super quick and easy highway access to get anywhere in the city or mountains in a snap. Blocks from I-25 and 6th Ave, both main access and exit points in and out of the city. Excited to announce that you can now take the light rail to my place from Denver International Airport! Take the train from DIA to Union Station; take the underground walkway over to jump onto the C or E lines; ride to the Osage & 10th stop - 4 stops from Union Station. My place is northeast across the park - 3 blocks North / 3 blocks East. The walk can appear a bit sketchy through my neighborhood if you're not used to cities - I do it all the time but I'm a tall male - just keep that in mind if you come in late at night. The other light rail stop 2 blocks north is great for getting to downtown locations. Colfax Avenue two blocks up is a good a place as any to hail a cab in Denver. Ubers, Lyfts, and Denver B-Cycles abound. Cherry Creek trail is blocks away. So many great places are walkable.
house_rules: BIG ONE: Parking is permit only directly around the house which makes it super easy 24 hours a day. But if you take off with my permit I'm unable to get a new one so your deposit will be kept in full. There's a big sign to remind you on checkout. No cigarettes, smoking weed outside allowed Not a hotel, anything left for a renter is to be left behind Love it and leave it clean

name: 10 Mins To Downtown! South Pearl • Wash Park • DU
neighborhood_overview: Location and space is perfect for families, professionals and travelers. Our home is just a ten minute drive to downtown Denver and a short walk to the Evans Light Rail Station (which gets you downtown in 10 min).  We are walking distance to DU, South Pearl, Wash Park and South Broadway.  We are 1 block to South Pearl, an eclectic urban shopping district with more than a dozen great restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Some of our favorite South Pearl spots include:  • Taste Of Thailand - Best thai food in Denver.  • Morning Collective - Best breakfast in town • Sushi Den - Best sushi in all of Denver/maybe all of Colorado   • Izakaya Den -  Sushi Den's sister fusion restaurant • The Tavern - Great beer selection, pub food. Great patio.  • Hansens - Great corner bar, cheap drinks and food. Local favorite. • El Tejado - Great mexican food • Village Cork - Cool little wine bar. Great patio.  • Fourteen Seventy-Two - Southern Cuisine.   • Sexy Pizza - Good pizza and beer • The Yardbird - A
transit: The Light Rail is within walking distance to the house. There are 2 different locations, the Evans stop is a 10 min walk and the South Pearl stop is a 15 min walk. Uber and Lyft run throughout the city for very cheap as well.
house_rules: Our house is located in a great neighborhood in Denver. Our neighbors are fun and easy going so moderate noise levels at night are totally acceptable until about 10PM. We do not allow cigarette or pot smoking in our house but you are welcome to smoke in the front or backyard. There are literally dozens of cannabis shops within walking distance from our home so we encourage those who smoke to pay them a visit! Unfortunately our daughter is allergic to dogs so we do not allow any pets at our home. My wife and I keep our house clean and we trust our guests will do the same.

name: Rustic Craftsman Master Suite
neighborhood_overview: Convenient walkable location. A few blocks walk to rail/train stops at 38th & Blake for the A-Line route and 30th & Downing for the L-Line route. Short walk or Lyft ride (~1 mile) to a ton of great restaurants and craft breweries on Larimer/Walnut/Blake Street. We really like this neighborhood, but it isn’t for everyone. It’s on the wrong side of the tracks for some. Our neighborhood is transitioning; it is at the confluence trifecta of low-income, working class, and  high-income people. We’re all people though!
transit: Getting around using the rail (train) is an easy 3-step process that involves walking, getting your ticket, and enjoying the ride. Denver International Airport to our house —> 1) Purchase a one-way ticket at the kiosk (takes cash or credit). 2) Get on the Rail: A-Line (train) westbound in the airport and take a 30 minute ride. Get off at 38th/Blake Station. 3) Walk 15 minutes to our house (~6 blocks south on Downing Street, 1 block east on Bruce Randolph Ave, south on Marion St).   Our house to Denver International Airport —> 1) Walk 15 minutes to 38th/Blake Station (north on Marion St, 1 block west on Bruce Randolph Ave, ~6 blocks north on Downing St). 2) Purchase a one-way ticket at kiosk (takes cash or credit). 3) Get on the Rail: A-Line (train) eastbound. Last stop is the airport.  Our house to Union Station —> 1) Walk 15 minutes to 38th/Blake Station (north on Marion St, 1 block west on Bruce Randolph Ave, ~6 blocks north on Downing St). 2) Purchase a one-way/round trip/or full-da
house_rules: No smoking inside. You may smoke outside.  Please leave your shoes at the front door if it's rainy, snowy, or muddy. Light snacks and drinks only in the bedroom.

name: HOT! Best Location in Denver.  Cozy clean quiet
neighborhood_overview: THIS IS THE BEST LOCATION IN DENVER:  My house is in a quiet tree lined neighborhood, with free parking.  It is also a short 1 mile walk to the center of Downtown.  There is no car needed for a full vacation with a huge variety of entertainment, food, parks... Walk out the front door and two doors down and you are at restaurant row.  At your feet are three restaurants (Paxti Pizza, Next Door, Olive and Finch, Limon) and many others. Within one block distance is Humboldt Farm Fish Table (a top-rated restaurant in Denver),  7-11, and Qdoba.  Walk another block and you will find Starbucks, coffee shops, fast food, bars, restaurants, sushi, and shops. Our neighborhood is officially City Park West, but is also called North Capitol Hill, Uptown, and Whittier Heights.  We are adjacent to Downtown, Capitol Hill, the Central Business District CBD, Five Points, Central, Cheesman Park, Congress Park, Curtis Park, Baker, Lincoln Park, and LoDo.
transit: B Cycles are available across the street.  There are buses that pick up and drop off one block from my house and run every 15 minutes into downtown. St. Joseph’s Hospital, St. Luke’s Hospital, and Children's Hospital are two blocks down. Denver's premier music scene is 5-7 blocks down, close enough to walk, but far enough for quiet tranquility. City Park and Chessman Park are a few blocks away Downtown, Botanic Gardens, Museums, and the Civic Center are a one mile walk. Walk a few more blocks to the Colorado Convention Center, Denver Center of Performing Arts, the Rockies, 16th Street Mall and many other attractions.

name: Architect Owned Reclaimed Retreat in the Art District
neighborhood_overview: This unique and welcoming brick home is in the Lincoln Park neighborhood in the eclectic Santa Fe Art District in Denver. The area is known for its brightly colored storefronts, fancifully painted alleyways, street art, diverse cultural scene, and abundant ethnic restaurants. This space is co-hosted by local experiential hospitality startup The Sursy: the company behind the shoppable design and experience. Use #staysursy to share your stay and follow along!

name: Beautiful Carriage House Apartment
neighborhood_overview: Location:  The carriage house is in Baker neighborhood, which is a historic Denver neighborhood.  While the carriage house is a new addition, the main house was built in 1880's.  The location can't be beat - it's within blocks of all the amenities of South Broadway: Sweet Action ice cream, Happy Coffee, Historian Ale House, Mayan Movie Theater, Beatrice and  Woodsley, Trve Brewery, and tons of other unique shops, tasty restaurants, and fun bars, all with a local feel.  The Santa Fe Arts District and several other local breweries are within walking distance as well. Downtown and all the sports stadiums are within easy bike / bus / light rail rides.   There is a B-cycle bike station within blocks of the house.  B-cycles are bikes that can be rented (for a few hours or a few days) with a simple credit card swipe.  There are stations throughout the city, so you can use a bike to get to your destination, turn it in, and then check out another one to go to the next place.  There are also usu
transit: Public transport: - 1 block to 52 bus (downtown) - 2 blocks to the 0 bus (downtown / South Broadway)  - 2 blocks to 1 bus (cherry creek mall) - 1 mile to light rail Alameda station (light rail to Pepsi Center, Coors Field, Sports Authority Field, Convention Center, Performing Arts Center, Union Station, downtown, etc) - Easy public transport to the airport (light rail or bus to sky ride) - 2 blocks to b-cycle station - less than 1 mile to cherry creek trail & bike path Parking: We are no longer offering the small parking space in the back of our carriage house. We just had our roof/gutters replaced and our new gutters are being destroyed. There is street parking.  Generally, it isn't hard to find parking on Bannock.  We are not responsible if your car is towed for any reason.  Note: None of our guests have had their car towed, so I wouldn't anticipate a problem.
house_rules: No smoking anywhere on the premises.

name: BEST! Location  open  quiet clean
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is in the Perfect Denver Location. Central to everything, you can walk one mile in any direction and reach Major Denver attractions.  Our house is in a quiet tree lined neighborhood on Franklin.  It is just two doors down from Restaurant Row, which is one of Denver's fastest growing, hippest destinations.   With-in one block of the house, there are at least seven dining restaurants, a bakery, a pub, a desert bar, and fast food restaurant, and a 7-11.  Walk just one more block and double your choices for food, coffee, shopping, and entertainment.   Looking for local entertainment, the Denver nightlife is centered about 8 blocks from the house.   Our neighborhood is officially City Park West, but is also called North Capitol Hill, Uptown, and Whittier Heights.  We are adjacent to Downtown, Capitol Hill, the Central Business District CBD, Five Points, Central, Cheesman Park, Congress Park, Curtis Park, Baker, Lincoln Park, and LoDo.     Traveling Nurse?  St. Joseph's Hospit
transit: Our neighborhood is located halfway between City Park and Downtown.  There are buses that travel 24 hours a day, and pass by every 15 minutes.  There are also B-cycles across the street from our house.  Lift and Uber are also popular options in Denver.  The light rail is approximately 1 mile from our house, and only useful if you want to travel to the a suburbs.

name: Cozy Cottage with Vintage Decor on a Park!
neighborhood_overview: Villa Park is located in West Denver - a couple miles west of downtown. The area is very urban and residential. Federal Blvd. is a busy byway (people cruise in their shiny, sometimes loud cars on Sundays) and there can be activity in the public park which lies right outside our fence. This is not a gentrified nor "hip" part of town. Many people in this neighborhood have lived here for generations - true Denverites! The house is on a park which means there is public activity - the parks in Denver are utilized - but can also feel too secluded if your aim is to be around a lot of houses/commerce. As far as businesses that are “walkable”: 7-11 & a liquor store are 2 blocks away; a Mexican restaurant & Hamburger Stand are 1 block away. We are no more than 10-15min. by motor to more pedestrian friendly neighborhoods (Baker, The Highlands) & 5 min to downtown.
transit: Crazy central! Our house is situated near I-25 (north/south) & 6th Ave (west/east). 2 blocks from the W line Light Rail stop. W Line runs from Union Station (downtown) to Golden (a city west of Denver). Get to our house from the airport using the Light Rail A Line. Transfer to the W line at Union Station. Federal/Decatur is our stop. Bus lines run up and down Federal Blvd. If you're not comfortable with public transportation, you'll need a car to get around or utilize Uber/Lyft ($10 average to get to most places in Denver). Paco Sanchez Park offers bike and pedestrian paths along a creek and connects the neighborhood to the rest of the city. It's a 45min. walk (or a 20 min. bike ride) on the trail to Elitch Gardens Amusement Park, the Aquarium, Children's Museum, REI, Brother's Bar, Sushi Sasa, and access to LoHi neighborhood restaurants.
house_rules: - Check out by 11am. Message on your departure. - Do not place/store anything on the stove top. The pilot light is located there and you may cause damage/fire. - No smoking/vaping/420smoke/candles/incense inside the house. - Turn off window a/c when you leave for the day. Operate at no lower than 73 degrees (78 is preferable). Close windows when running unit. - Open the window in the bathroom after showers to mitigate the humidity. - Do not put coffee grounds nor food waste down the sink drain. - No pets on the furniture. Pick up your pet's waste from the yard.  - Do not re-arrange the furniture nor move the knick knacks. Disregard of the house rules will result in a deposit forfeiture.

name: The Cloisters at Berkeley
neighborhood_overview: Boutiques, bars, restaurants galore! Highlands is one of the hottest neighborhoods in Denver -- with Tennyson Street, 32nd Avenue, and Lakeside Amusement park all within walking distance, downtown a 8-minute drive away, and the mountains right next door,  you'll never want for something to do!
transit: We have two bus stops within a mile of the house. There's also on-street parking immediately by the residence's private entrance.
house_rules: There are several lovely dogs on the property -- occasionally other guest's pups will be out in the yard as well. They will not have access to your apartment.  Please be sure to shut all gates and doors so no pets are allowed to roam beyond their designated areas.  Absolutely NO smoking is allowed -- not tobacco, not marijuana, not anything else. Please take off your shoes in the house. Please be sure to shut lights when not in use or in residence. Please keep shower curtains in the tub or shower when showering. Please use water wisely -- Colorado is drought-prone. Please let us know exactly what pets you may be bringing, and be sure to pick up after dogs if you leave them out in the yard. In general, there will be a nominal extra charge for cleaning when a pet stays with us  There will be an extra charge for cleaning if serious fur, hair or pet-related soil is found on the curtains or linens. This will be taken from the deposit. This is the owner's residence, so permission is required

name: Garden House in Sunnyside *Hot Tub*
neighborhood_overview: Sunnyside is North Denver's gem of a neighborhood. Tons of sunflowers in the summer and green chilis in the fall. Walkable and diverse mix of new and old houses, restaurants and shops. Common Grounds coffee shop across the street, Bacon Social House, Sunny's and El Jefe are 2 blocks down among many other options. Flowers, cheese, jewelry and boutiques, and the cool Chaffee park are all within a stone's throw. As a life-long North Denverite, Matt is glad to give guests insider tips for the best authentic Denver eats and treats and off-beat adventure ideas.
transit: Walk to a variety of neighborhood destinations and several bus stops; 1 mile to light rail which links to the Airport train; Lyft and Uber offer fast pick-ups; plenty of street parking if you have your own vehicle.
house_rules: - No pets. - No parties.  - No shoes in the house. - Lock doors and turn off lights and the AC or heating when you are leaving the house. Mother nature thanks you too!

name: Sunny Sky Loft in Highlands
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood where the house is located is in the Highlands historic district.  This neighborhood is a very safe, walkable neighborhood with lots of independent shops including award-winning wine and cheese shops, coffee shops, yoga studios, clothing boutiques, a variety of restaurants and bars, as well as bookstores and about anything else you could want.  On-street parking is easy and accessible.  Just make sure to read and adhere to the parking signs, they will ticket if you park in a no-parking zone or on a street sweeping day. The two most prominent of these areas would be following: Highlands Square Just four blocks from the house is a charming shopping district with tons of little independent stores and a few chains thrown in for good measure. Get outfitted in designer denim and the latest fashions at Dragonfly or Rustic Threads.  Need boots?  If you are willing to drop a chunk of change for absolute glamor, try Starlet, and then head over to the Garnet Gecko to get matching
transit: The 38 bus runs downtown, catch it on 38th street, just two blocks from the house.  The 32nd also runs downtown and out to Golden. Catch it on 32nd street, just 4 blocks from the house. Of the two buses, the 32 is definitely nicer and takes a more scenic route downtown.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking at all. Not in the house, on the deck, or in the yard. Sorry, no cats (allergic).  If you have a dog, contact us.  We may consider well-behaved dogs with a deposit or extra cleaning fee.  Indoor furniture stays indoors.  No flushing of feminine products, please, we have clay pipes. Please treat the space as if it were your own.  We love our house and hope that you do too! Enjoy.

name: Craftsman Bungalow in Highlands
neighborhood_overview: Berkley/Highland neighborhood, lots of hip restaurants, cafes, shops and a short cab ride to LoDo (2.5miles). One of the hippest zip codes in our country, surrounded by great restaurants, bars, cafes. A walk score of 80 (Bike score of 80 as well). Six blocks to either 32nd Street shops and to Tennyson Street shops.
transit: Plenty of free, on-street parking. Bus stop is half a block away. B-cycle (bike share) station is 8 blocks away. Car2Go (car share) is also an option for wheels usually within 6 blocks of the house.

name: GREAT LOCATION! 2 BR BSMT Apt in City Park South
neighborhood_overview: The City Park neighborhood encompasses City Park, the Denver Zoo, and the Denver Museum of Nature & Science. The neighborhood falls between York St. to the west and Colorado Blvd. to the east. Bounded by 23rd Ave. to the north and Colfax Ave. to the south, the City Park neighborhood attracts many tourists and locals alike. The City Park neighborhood was ranked one of the top 10 neighborhoods in the United States by REDFIN in 2015! Walking distance to many restaurants and bars.  Sprouts grocery store is 6 blocks away and the new Trader Joe's is less than a mile away.  The Cherry Creek Mall is ~2 miles away.
transit: Downtown is only 2.5 Miles away from the apartment, and you can easily access the bus line that will take you directly there (buses run every 10-15 Min). The bus line ends inside Auraria Campus (Metro State University, University of Colorado At Denver, and Community College of Denver).
house_rules: No smoking (cigarettes or marijuana) or ANY illegal activity is allowed inside the property.  Absolutely NO parties will be tolerated.  Unfortunately, no pets are allowed in the unit.  No overnight guests who are not part of the advanced, Airbnb reservation without permission from the host.  I work very well with guests who are good communicators.  If you need a light bulb, if you'd like an extra pillow, blanket, etc, let me know and I will do my best to make it available to you!

name: Brand New Modern Stapleton Home
neighborhood_overview: Just across the street, we have Bluff Lake Nature Center. Early morning walks (there is a mile dirt path around it (no bikes)) are awesome. There are beautiful birds everywhere, deer, foxes, even bald eagles in the winter. The Sand Creek trail heads NW and SE from there and you can connect it with trails to go all around the city of denver. About 4 blocks west is one of our neighborhood's pools. You will have to buy a day pass. This summer, there will be 5 pools to chose from in the hood. A half mile from the house is the Central Park Recreation Center with a large indoor pool and workout room and cardio equipment that looks out over Stapelton's Central Park and west to the mountains. There are bike/walking trails everywhere and a 2 1/2 mile walk/ride takes you to our town center with restaurants, groceries, bars, etc. I can get downton in 15 minutes on Martin Luther King Blvd and the same to the airport via 1-70. Stapleton is a fantastic location to see all that Denver has to offer.
transit: There is bus service to downtown and to the airport from Stapleton. The A-train stops are 1-2 miles from the house. You can take the trail to the airport or to downtown.
house_rules: Please leave the house as you found it and treat it as if it were your own. Absolutely no smoking inside the house and no animals. Move your conversations indoors after 10pm.

name: Amazing Guesthouse-Perfect Lohi/Highland Location
neighborhood_overview: We're located in a safe historic neighborhood in the heart of Lohi, Denver's hottest and hippest neighborhood, just a short 10 minute walk to downtown. Or rent a BCycle bike and cruise the neighborhood, head downtown, or take a ride along the Platte River bike trail. We're located within walking distance of some of Denver's best restaurants and happy hour spots. Within a 1-3 block range we have great places for foodies, including gourmet burgers, two fine dining establishments, a sit-down pizza place, a french bakery, several coffee shops and a frozen yogurt place. There are also lots of great bars in the area, and several more within a 5-10 minute walk.
transit: We're only one block from the busline. Car2go, BCycle, Uber and Lyft are all available here.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking on premises, no pets.

name: House on Stout: Mesa
neighborhood_overview: The House on Stout is located in historic Curtis Park, on the northeast edge of the downtown district, walking distance to Union Station in vibrant LODO, Coors Field, the RINO art district with its astonishing street art,  myriad microbrews, connoisseur coffee, cool patios and rooftop terraces. Nearby is the Larimer St and Walnut St corridor where you'll find yourself in the very green entrepeneurial hub of grow local businesses in Denver.  Samadhi Yoga,  DCPA, Denver Art Museum, and the Denver Convention Center are all within a 15-20 min walk from the house. Street parking always available if you're driving, but no problem if you're not. You can  take in the town walking, cycling, and short jaunts on UBER. Go to Crema for best best best coffee, Larimer St for world class street art, the Mercury Cafe for dinner, swing dance and tango, poetry and live performance. Curtis Park is designated an historic district, a multi-cultural neighborhood of victorian painted ladies opening its doors
transit: New RTD train service and AF route to/from the airport, or Uber for around $35 (price varies.) Light rail to the Auraria campus,  10 block walk to the convention center. Denver B-cycle stations available throughout the downtown area. UBER for $5-6 anywhere in the downtown district. Walk to the RINO district, breweries, wineries, coffee houses and restaurants on Larimer.
house_rules: House Rules: Registered guests only.  No third party bookings. Guests must use their own airbnb account to book. Check-in 3pm to 11pm Check-out 11 am Please take off your shoes before going upstairs Be respectful of others sharing the space: no loud or even kind of loud music or video.   Bathroom is shared. Please be considerate.  No smoking indoors. Smoking outdoors only No food upstairs in guest rooms. No perfumes or aerosol sprays No pets Garden and kitchen/lounge area open to guests 7am til 9pm.  If you use the kitchen please clean up after yourself. Dishes can be rinsed and put in the dishwasher. House on Stout is 420 friendly, but please, in the spirit of maturity and moderation. Excess and drunken-ness will be most unwelcome.

name: Private Queen Room w Ensuite Bath
neighborhood_overview: I love to walk and this is an area that is great for a walker!  The convention center downtown  is just 25 minutes west.  Our beautiful City Park complete with zoo, golf course and museum is a 20 min walk east. Just 3 blocks south are wonderful places to dine, listen to music or just hang out with the locals!   The Rino district is a one mile walk and there are sooo many great restaurants, breweries and bars in that area.
transit: The train directly from DIA is the most economical way to get to my home.  Take the train to Union Station, then Uber/ Lyft or taxi to my home.  Train tickets are $9, Uber approx $7 depending on time of day.   We have many other options for getting around town as well.  Uber, Taxi's, B Cycle, and Cartogo are all available and easy to use.
house_rules: CHECK IN: 4pm or later unless otherwise arranged  CHECK OUT: 10 am unless otherwise arranged  Feel free to leave your bags in the entry hall if you are going out for the day.  Feel free to use the kitchen and anything in it.  There is a grocery store around the corner and you are welcome to keep your goodies in the fridge.  I don’t usually have much in there, but if you need something help yourself.   I hope you understand that the wine and alcohol is not for guests.  THX! You are also welcome to use the washer and dryer whcih is located in the basement and pretty easy to operate. I do have a cat that lives with me- Lucy.  She is very shy and will probably be hiding under my bed. But don’t be alarmed if you catch a glimpse of her dashing up the stairs when you come in.  I keep my house pretty tidy, so I hope that you keep the common areas tidy as well.  Dishes in the dishwasher- that type of thing!   Please no smoking in the house.  Thanks so much!

name: Cozy Convenient Condo in Cherry Creek

transit: Cherry Creek Trail runs Northwest from the neighborhood all the way to downtown Denver. You can take Colorado Boulevard South to I-25, or North to I-70. Please help Sanela out by bagging up your trash before you leave, and if you made any messes that you yourself would be disgusted by, clean those up too. name: Peaceful Queen in Congress Park
neighborhood_overview: Congress Park is a quaint little neighborhood in the center of Denver. It's tree lined streets, neighborhood restaurants and cafes and it's proximity to several of Denver's beautiful parks and gorgeous parkways make it the ultimate walkable neighborhood. Also close by is National Jewish Hospital which make this home great for people who are visiting this state of the art hospital.
transit: This is perhaps the MOST walkable neighborhood in all of Denver!  The house is centrally located to everything from parks and recreation to shopping.  There is a bus line with a stop only 2 blocks away and it runs to downtown.  There is plenty of parking on the street so if you come with your own car you won't need to worry!  Taxi and Uber (town car service) are also easy ways of getting around Denver.  If you don't have an Uber account - get one!  You will be glad you did.
house_rules: Please make yourself at home but understand that this is my home too!  I also work from home several days a week and cannot be available to chat during those times. name: Comfortable 2 Bedroom in Cap Hill
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is young and active. I live on a residential street, but commercial shops, restaurants and stores are all within easy walking distance. It is also within walking distance (1 mile) of downtown Denver.
transit: Public transit in Denver is through the RTD system which can be accessed online. My condo is close to daily and hourly bike rental terminals, however. Uber and Lyft are both good options to get around Denver.

name: Great deals for a Sunny room in Denver!
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is a great neighborhood! It's quiet, yet a  short distance from Denver and Colorado's main attractions. It's a perfect place if you are working in the medical community because I'm basically right in the middle of all of them. One of my favorite things is the Cherry Creek Trail which is right across the road from our complex. The trail takes you all the way to Cherry Creek reservoir  if you go east, and if you go West it leads you into the heart of downtown. A great ride on a bike!
transit: Just a half block away is a central line bus stop. Three miles away is a mainline for the light rail system.  I also have bikes that you can use!
house_rules: I borrow from my parents: leave things (nicer :) than you found them!  Well, if not nicer, then at least AS nice. No smoking. Any shared common areas should be clutter free and neat.  You may enjoy spending time in your room, any space on the main floor, or the rooms in the basement.  Only the upstairs-area is off-limits. As far as cleaning your private space (only for those staying 1 month or longer:), I do have a few requirements listed in my handbook.  Otherwise, think of us as roommates with shared responsibilities. :-) I do allow well-mannered, well-behaved  pets in my home, (or otherwise kenneled pets).  Pets are not allowed on furniture (which includes the bed in your room). There is a pet deposit fee. I do reserve the right to disallow any pets that damage any part of my home or those that, for example, bark all the time.  I hope that doesn't happen because I love animals!  However, if it does, you will be asked to terminate your stay without refund. (sorry)  I also have a very

name: Stylish Hygge Condo with Meditation Room
neighborhood_overview: The Sunnyside neighborhood is a great spot full of young edgy urban dwellers, as well as locals looking for a convenient commute into downtown (5-7 min drive), coupled with the quietness of being just outside the city. Sunnyside is full of restaurants, coffee shops, liquor stores, bars, and city parks. You can get pressed juice right across the street, coffee directly across the street and brunch spots for days.
transit: Bus stop across the street. ~ $10 to get a lyft downtown.  5 min drive to LoDo. 15 min walk to LoHi. Denver has a ton of rent a bike spots -  a very bicycle friendly Denver culture.
house_rules: 1) Enjoy my place! 2) Please be respectful of our neighbors at all times. I do not recommend our condo for families with small children.  4) No pets or smoking. 5) Upon checkout please take trash (if full) to the trash bins in the alley and start the dishwasher. name: Classic Home on Capitol Hill
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is one of the oldest in Denver and a great location to everything that the city has to offer! You will be blocks away from a King Soopers and Safeway for groceries, multiple liquor stores, great restaurants and bars. Our favorite place to go is Cheeseman Park and we highly recommend visiting it! If you walk from the house and around the outer loop, it is approximately a 2.5 mile walk. You can easily Uber downtown but if you're wanting some exercise, it's approximately a 30-40 minute walk to downtown. We love being central to all areas of Denver (Cherry Creek, Downtown, Historic Baker District, LoHi, and the Highlands). You can easily get around to any of these areas withing 10-15 minutes driving!
transit: The Denver Bus Station Terminal is located at Colfax and Broadway, approximately 20-minute walk, easy access to the free mall ride downtown!

name: 2 BD House in Lower Highland
neighborhood_overview: The Lower Highland neighborhood is one of the hottest in Denver.  Within a few blocks are a number of restaurants, a theatre, art galleries, coffee shops, bars / breweries and the popular ice cream spot, Little Man Ice Cream. A couple blocks south or north you can walk to an even bigger variety of restaurants / bars. There is a King Sooper supermarket at 20th and Chestnut, which is about a 5-minute drive or 15 minute walk. Sprouts is about two miles west on 38th. Coors Field and the Pepsi Center are about a 20-30 minute walk.  Our Lady of Mount Carmel Catholic Church (Italian) is a block in one direction, and Lady of Guadalupe Catholic Church (Mexican) is a block the other way. St. Patrick's Catholic Church is 4 blocks away. There is an Ace Hardware store and a small market two blocks away as well as a 7/11 for immediate supply needs.
transit: As I mention I walk a lot, however you can also get around on a bike or car, or take a bus which stops around the block from me. There's a Denver B-Cycle spot on 32nd and Navajo. Union Station is about a 20 minute walk - from there you can take the light rail to the airport, Golden or buses to Boulder, etc.  My house is just west of I-25 so it provides easy access to I-25 and I-70 if you want to head to the mountains - or pretty much anywhere.
house_rules: *Absolutely no smoking inside the house  *Guests staying during spring/summer/fall are responsible for maintaining small yard - mowing, watering, spraying weed-be-gone.  *Guest staying during winter are required shovel / sweep heavy snow from the front sidewalk (about 25 feet wide). There is salt in the garage if needed for the back patio, side walkway or front patio.  *Also please set trash / recycle bin out on Thursday mornings.

name: Authentic loft in Lodo across from Union Station
neighborhood_overview: Oh my God, everything is in walking distance. Union Station, wonderful restaurants, bars,  trains, cabs, buses, car-, bike-, scooter- rentals are all across the street. transit: Buses, trains,and cabs are available across the street. We also have plenty of Car2go smart cars floating around and a bike sharing program. There are several parking garages available in a one block radius if needed. A direct bus route from DIA can bring you straight to our loft.  There is public parking available close by.
house_rules: Please be considerate to the neighbors. This is a very cool building in Lodo but everyone in the building is very protective, so you need to be friendly and courteous. There is absolutely no smoking allowed in the building but pets are welcome. There is a public roof top you can use.

name: 2 bedroom family home near RiNo and Downtown
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is known as the Cole neighborhood.  Cole is urban, diverse, and was just listed as one of the top 5 neighborhoods in Denver to buy a home. Close to everything including the Denver Zoo, City Park, Botanical Gardens, Downtown, RiNo, and 5-points. Easy access to I-70 which takes you to the airport or the mountains and a 3 minute Uber ride to the A-Line, Denver's train to Union Station and the airport.
transit: Neighborhood parking is easily accessed. Watch for street sweeping April-November. The street sweeping ticket is $50, please do all you can do avoid getting a ticket. If you do not have a car consider Cars-To-Go, Uber, Lyft or cab.  The cost of Uber to RiNo and Downtown ranges from $5-10. There are restaurants and bars within walking distance including The Whittier Pub, The Plimoth Resturant, and the very popular breakfast spot, Syrup!  It's a great neighborhood with easy access to all the Denver has to offer!
house_rules: The rules are simple:  -keep the house clean -no parties  -no smoking -love our house the way you love your own
