name: Modern 3 Bed Near RiNo Arts District
neighborhood_overview: The Whittier neighborhood is a great residential area full of charm, which I love for the incredible diversity of people, homes, and history. The neighborhood is a mixture of all types of housing from luxurious historic homes to Section 8 housing to everything in between. Kids skateboard in the cul-de-sac, families walk to school, and dog walkers are common en route to the Fuller Dog Park (2 blocks). Several neighbors spend the better part of the day on their front porches - most folks are friendly and the neighborhood feel is palpable.  In the midst of the 5-Points Historical Cultural District, we are walking distance from many parks. In fact, there is one only two houses down. Within a ten minute walk you can pick up a bike at B-cycle and get to downtown within minutes, as well as the River North Arts District (RiNo) which has several good coffee shops, microbreweries, winery and restaurants. Not to mention City Park, the Denver Zoo, Natural History Museum, LoDo, Curtis Park, Uptown,
transit: The lightrail from the airport is super easy, as the 38th and Blake Street stop is 1.5 miles, or a $3 uber ride from our front door. Once you're here, the nearest B-Cycle station (shared Denver and Boulder bike system) is 8 blocks away and there are plenty of Uber, Lyft, Car2Go and many other shared car services to be found. For those enthused by public transport, buses run two blocks from house, the light-rail station is a few blocks away at 31st and Downing, and Interstate 70 into the mountains is a 5 minute drive.
house_rules: We are on a residential street so we expect house guests to treat the home as their own, while respecting quiet times after 11 pm on week nights and midnight on weekends. The house is 420 friendly, but please no smoking in the house.   Check in 4:00 pm, checkout is at noon -- we can work with you if you have other travel details, but please let us know in advance.

name: **Snowstorm Special** Denver Bungalow w/Artsy Vibe
neighborhood_overview: Sunnyside and the Lower Highlands area is an up and coming Denver neighborhood with new restaurants popping up and a growing community.  You can walk or quickly drive to breweries, coffee shops and restaurants. There are apartments across the street but the tenants generally tend to be quiet and trouble-free.     While there are pockets of commerce developing around the neighborhood, it usually requires a vehicle, Uber, Lyft or short bus ride to fully experience downtown or other areas such as Tennyson St. between 38th Ave and 46th Ave. or Lowell Blvd. & 32nd Ave. The Sunnyside neighborhood's history includes being founded by the Irish and Italians in the 1800's, with a Hispanic and Mexican immigration in the early 1900's.  There is currently a large amount of rebuilding occurring throughout the neighborhood. The area consists mostly of single family bungalows, but there are also apartments, warehouse spaces, and new builds.  A lot of our immediate neighbors were raised in the neighbor
transit: Easy access to I-25, 1-70, I-76, Hwy 36 and more for city/ski/mountain accessibility.  1.5 miles to Lower Downtown (LoDo) & Coors Field, and about 3 miles to the Tennyson St. Cultural District (a very walkable area with lots of shops and restaurants).  One of the best Lower Highlands areas to eat and drink at is around 32nd Ave. and Tejon St.   Central St. and Platte River Drive in LoHi are also great places to visit/eat/shop!   Bus stops located on same block or within one block of the house.  Bus lines 19 & 52 come down the street, and it is near various other popular bus lines like the 38 & 44 and the RTD Gold Line.   The nearest B-Cycle Stations are located at 39th Ave & Fox St. and 32nd Ave. & Pecos St.

Please move your car from these areas at these times so you don't get a parking ticket and help our city keep our streets clean! name: Great work travel location! En-suite bath& parking
neighborhood_overview: I find Governor's Park to be the best, most centrally located part of Denver. You can get anywhere in the Metro Area from here easily by car, bike or public transportation. Cherry Creek bike path is close and can get you to downtown in 20 minutes, or take you south for a lovely jog or bike ride. Convenient to the Colorado Convention Center and downtown Hotels if you are here for a conference.   #6 bus (stop one block away, runs every 15 minutes). $5-7 Lyft ride or rent a B-Cycle. There are lots of great independent coffee houses and restaurants. Ivy’s for breakfast is 2 blocks (opening April 2019). Walking east on 7th Ave is a quiet, tree lined street with mostly historical homes/architecture. Walk to Parks, shopping, dining. Molly Brown House. Other Museums, galleries, shopping and downtown Denver are very close.
transit: Several bus lines are close #6 and #0), and can also connect you to the light rails. B cycle bike rental 2 blocks away. Cherry Creek bike path is a quick and car-less ride to downtown or Cherry Creek shopping center. Shared Lyft or Uber rides are usually under $6 to anywhere in town. From DIA take the light rail to Union Station and then it’s a short Lyft/Uber or use 6 or Zero bus to my place.
house_rules: I do ask for quiet hours after 10 pm. I don’t mind at all if you come in late as long as you’re quiet.  Late check-ins are no problem but early bag drop off must be requested in advance.  Smoking -no smoking inside the home. Smoking of all kinds on the patios is fine. Please do not smoke on the outside stairs or in front of the building. If you are a cigarette smoker please use the smoke collection ashtrays and enclose all butts in a ziplock bag before your final departure.  Laundry-washer and dryer are at the top of the stairs. They are not to be in use after 10 pm or before 8 am. Please follow the instructions on the machine. No perfumed laundry products please!i have detergent available for you to use.  Shoes-Please remove your shoes while in the home. Slippers are available for you.  Kitchen use- you are welcome to use, please advise when making reservations if you plan to cook so that space can be cleared for you. There are kitchen guidelines posted in the kitchen.  Recycling-Plea

name: Sunny Room-Private Bath-Close to Everything Denver
neighborhood_overview: Peaceful quiet neighborhood but you can walk to everything! Groceries (whole Foods, Trader Joes, Safeway, Soopers), shopping, restaurants, coffee shops (Pablo’s one block) dry cleaners, liquor store, dispensary all within 2 blocks.  Centrally located for getting to the mountains, Red Rocks or anywhere in Denver. A very quick bus ride to downtown and the nearby Baker/South Broadway neighborhood is fun for thrift shopping, bars, breweries and restaurants. New breakfast place -Ivy’s opening April 2019 2 blocks.
transit: Number 6 Bus to downtown and Convention Center is only one block away. B Cycle station is 2 blocks if you prefer to bike on the lovely Cherry Creek bike path to downtown or Cherry Creek shopping center. Lyft Line usually under $6 to downtown or South Broadway/Baker. Scooter rentals and car share all close by.

name: Carriage House-Highlands Square
neighborhood_overview: My family absolutely loves the Highlands neighborhood.  We have a walk score of 84 ('Very Walkable') and everything you need is within walking distance of The Carriage House, and downtown Denver is within a bike ride, 2 miles. There is  public transit to and from Downtown Denver (Union Station) to Denver International Airport. The people that live in the Highlands are so very friendly - this is a place where you know your neighbors and everyone looks out for each other. I love calling the Highlands home.  Here's a decent 'sampler' of things to do (website hidden)
transit: We are on the 32nd St. bus route that goes straight into downtown Denver, ~10 minute ride, including to Union Station.  You can take the train from the airport and the bus or a short cab/Lyft/Uber ride to the space.  We are also near a Denver BCycles bike share rental location for short trips in the city. The neighborbood is very walkable including restaurants, bars, cafes, and grocery stores, wine and cheese shops. Options include: Car2Go Denver BCycles Lyft/Uber/cabs Walking  Biking
house_rules: Here are some things we would appreciate when you stay in The Carriage House.  Guests are responsible for Denver City and County Lodging Taxes of 10.75%. Please NO smoking. This includes the outside patio as well. This is a NON SMOKING house. We will have zero tolerance for this and guests found to be in violation of this policy will be charged an additional $250 cleaning fee. Illicit drug use or other illegal activity will not be tolerated.  Any violation of this rule will result in immediate cancellation of your booking and involvement of local law enforcement where appropriate. Please do not dispose of feminine sanitary products or the like in the toilet. The Carriage House sewer is drained by a pump system and will clog resulting in an unpleasant backup and a $500.00 plumbers fee, which the renter will be responsible for.  Please treat the house as if it were your own. Leave entire Carriage House in a clean condition, like it was found. This is much appreciated.  In general, please

name: Unique 3-Level Loft in Ballpark
neighborhood_overview: The Paris Hotel building is listed on the National Register of Historic Places and is conveniently located in the heart of Denver's famous Ballpark Neighborhood, only blocks away from Coors Field, LoDo, and Downtown Denver. It is a vibrant neighborhood that continues to grow...new restaurants, breweries and other attractions are quickly becoming established. Before making my loft available to others via AirBnB, I lived here for 9 years. Please know that like any urban area, one must be careful with personal safety and security.  You should know that there are homeless who seek services from the Denver Rescue Mission, Denver Samaritan house and other facilities within a few blocks. You should also know that I have never experienced a break-in with my car, been robbed, or experienced any violent crime. Furthermore, the building has never been broken into. I encourage you to use your best judgement about personal safety, and expect that you will make the best decision for yourself about b
transit: Off-street and gated parking is included. Getting to downtown Denver is easy with many transportation options available. The light rail is very close. Car2Go is an excellent option as well are Uber and Lyft.
house_rules: No pets No smoking in the unit (this includes ALL types of smoking). Smoking allowed in the courtyard. Please be kind and respectful (duh)

name: 420 Friendly Carriage House
neighborhood_overview: The Historic Baker Neighborhood is bustling with life!  Our main home was built in 1886 with the Carriage House following in the 1920s.  2 blocks in one direction you will find restaurants, dispensaries, breweries, pharmacy, take out and lots of boutique shopping.  4 blocks in another direction are home to the well known Sante Fe Art District. We have the Denver Museum of Art as well as the History Colorado Center and many more museums within a 2 mi radius. The quiet neighborhood offers tree-lined streets and a step into a long-ago era.  We suggest you take a walk through the neighborhood and soak up its vibes :).
transit: We offer off-street parking right next to the Carriage house. (Alley access) There is also street parking if you wish. (Please pay attention to street sweeping signs as they will ticket/tow) There is a public bus transportation (RTD) stop on the block.  We also have a light rail station within a 1/2 mi. B Cycle, Car2Go, Zipcar and lots of other pay-by-the-hour type rentals available, including bicycles, scooters, and motorbikes.  We are so Centrally located that we normally go days without using a car.  Take a walk around Denver and enjoy the fresh Colorado air! Near light rail, bus routes, bike rentals
house_rules: 420 friendly smoking ok outside or out of window. Cigarette smoking outside only please. Thank you

name: our classy Denver home
neighborhood_overview: The City Park West neighborhood is by far one of the best in Denver. Known for its centrality, dining and proximity to City Park.
transit: Free street parking!
house_rules: LODGER TAX: Starting Jan 1, 2017 guests staying on or after that time will be required to pay a lodger's tax to the city of Denver (10.75%) on stays under 30 days.  Booking is a two step process. After your reservation is accepted, you will receive an email from the Resolution Center with a request for the Lodger's Tax for your reservation. You must accept this charge within 24 hours of booking (or immediately for same day Instant Bookings), or your reservation may be cancelled, as hosts are required to collect it. Your booking will show a 4% tax that is collected directly for the State of Colorado, but unfortunately, the City/County of Denver has not integrated their Lodgers Tax into reservation process, thus creating this additional step. Feel free to search "Short Term Lodgers Tax Denver" to verify this is a legitimate fee if you have any questions. You can see my license number in the "other things to note" in the description section.

name: SunnysideSweetSpot:Close In:420: 1BR/1BA
neighborhood_overview: Location! Location! Highland is an up and coming "hipster" area near Highland Square and Tennyson Street where all the trendy restaurants and bars are. Parks, liquor store, restaurants and three marijuana dispensaries are an easy one block walk away. Uber is $5-$8 to downtown Denver or to the sports venues. Although  joggers, baby strollers and bikers will go by, the neighborhood is very quiet for a good night's sleep. But so close to all the action!
transit: No car, no problem! There are bus and light rail within the vicinity but we suggest Uber/Lyft- $6-8 to downtown or to Union Station.From airport, take Airport Train to Union Station ($9pp),then Uber ($5) to house. or hop Uber from airport ( about $32 ). There are restaurants, 7-11, marijuana store, liquor store and Buchi Cafe Cubano (coffee to die for!) one block from house. If you do have a car,  there is plenty of free parking in the large driveway or on the street.

name: SkyView Loft in Healing Center
neighborhood_overview: The City Park neighborhood of old mansions has undergone a huge revitalization.  Known for it's conscious minded schools, i.e. 'The Nutritional Therapy Institute' and 'Massage Therapy Institute of Colorado'.  Across the street is East High School and The Denver Recreational Center. Daily passes are available.  Within one block away is the SIE Denver Film Colfax Theatre, Tattered Cover Bookstore, City Park, and several bars and restaurants.  Across from City Park is the Denver Museum of Nature and Science, and six blocks from the Botanic Gardens.  We are 10 minutes east of LoDo and 5 minutes North of Cherry Creek shopping district.
transit: There is an RTD bus stop behind the Center on Josephine St. Around the corner from Josephine on Colfax, Denver B Cycle has bicycles for rent by day, week or month.
house_rules: Please remove your shoes before entering the apartment. This greatly reduces any noise heard in the offices below.  General business and quiet hours are during the day from 9am to 9pm, with healing practitioners usually in session in other areas of the building.

name: Comfortable Room in Denver Home
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is active during the summer with a public park nearby.  Movies in the park happen every few weeks. Activities and attractions are nearby and easy to travel to, including the Santa Fe Arts District, Stranahan's Whiskey Distillery, Elitch Gardens amusement park, Mile High Stadium (home of the Denver Broncos), Coors Field (home of the Colorado Rockiez), and downtown Denver.  The guidebook and guest manual portion of the listing gives a sense for location and attraction locations, and includes some of our favorite places in town.
transit: The house is about five miles southwest (more south than west) of downtown Denver. Public transit (bus & light rail) is close. Public bus stops are about one block from our home, and connections can be made to light rail. Major roads and highways are also easy to navigate from our home, making day trips and ski days simple. We're happy to help with directions.
house_rules: No smoking of any substance or use of recreational drugs (including marijuana) anywhere on property. No firearms or other weapons on the premises. Please treat our home as you would your own. We certainly enjoy a drink or two occasionally, but please no heavy/binge drinking or loud partying. If you are out late as we are sometimes, please be respectful and quiet when coming home.

name: Discover the Old West in a Historic Highlands Carriage House
neighborhood_overview: The home is nestled behind an 1893 historic home in Sunnyside—one of Denver's hot original neighborhoods—with breweries, eateries, dispensaries, and coffee shops all within walking distance. Reach Mile High Stadium and Coors Field within 10 minutes.
transit: Public transportation is right on the corner but if that gives you the heebie-jeebies, Denver has Car2Go, Uber, Lyft and the good old-fashioned taxi-cab.  Bikes and scooters are nearby for rent and available for you to cruise the neighborhood and explore!
house_rules: We want you to enjoy your stay here and make yourselves at home! Please be respectful of our neighborhood and our property. If you use the facilities, please clean up after yourself. Smoking outdoors only. We are 420 friendly although we don't partake ourselves and there are 3, yes, THREE shops on the corner for you to explore.  Help yourself to any food/drinks you find in the fridge. Please leave the bed unmade on your departure or strip the sheets. Check-out time is noon.  Kindly text upon departure.

name: Charming Bungalow in the Highlands
neighborhood_overview: The Highlands neighborhood is currently the hottest neighborhood in Denver. Just a few blocks away there are coffee shops, shopping, restaurants, sports bars and lounges. Several of the top highly rated restaurants are located within a mile for foodies.  You will also find authentic Mexican and Italian food restaurants that have been in the neighborhood for many years. The location of my home is ideal for parking and quiet, yet also close to day and evening entertainment. There are also several parks nearby for running, tennis or basketball and it is a bike friendly town, with rental bikes available a few blocks away. It is also well located for it's proximity to downtown Denver, which can be reached by bike in 15-20 min or by taxi in 5 min.  Sports Authority Field at Mile High Stadium (home of the Broncos) is just a quick 2 miles away and an easy bike, cab or bus ride!  And if you're a baseball fan, the Rockies play just 3 miles away at Coors field.  And a trip to Denver isn't complet

name: Urban Oasis - Walk to SoBo & Downtown free bikes!
neighborhood_overview: The best of both worlds - on a quiet street, yet just around the corner from Denver's hippest, most eclectic stretch - South Broadway. Home of the historic Mayan theatre, plus tons of unique shops, bars, and restaurants.  Including a bowling alley, live music, funky boutiques, and great ice cream! From fancy to dive-y, you'll find it all there within walking distance! If you like beer, you're in the perfect spot to experience Denver's craft brewery scene - there are 4 Breweries within half a mile (Baere, Banded Oak, TRVE, LowDown) and 8 within a mile! (Crazy Mountain, Black Sky, Intrepid Sojourner, Renegade) If you're looking for great eats that are cheap and quick, you're just a couple blocks north from what's been called the "national epicenter" of fast-casual dining - Chipotle, Noodles & Co, Pizzeria Locale, Zaika Indian, Moe's BBQ, Red Ginger (sushi), Yogurtland, and more! You're also just a block from the Cherry Creek bike path, perfect for getting around the city by bike or foot.
transit: If you don't have a car, I'd recommend using Lyft or Uber to get around, you can get to most places in Denver for $4-10. And if you're new to either service, I can send you a code for your first ride free!  You're about a mile from the nearest Light Rail station, but I'd only recommend using the Light Rail if you're headed out to the suburbs or to/from the airport - for most places in Denver proper, Lyft/Uber are much more convenient (and usually cheaper if you have 2 or more people)

name: Clean Cozy Home in DU Neighborhood
neighborhood_overview: Major highway, I25, is close if you want to go north to downtown or south to Colorado Springs. Or go south on Downing to 285 and go west to Red Rocks or South Park. You'll be close to 2 great parks: a couple blocks from Harvard Park (a great place to walk in the morning, plus there's a tiny rec center and a small golf course) and a mile or so from Denver's most popular park, Wash Park.  You'll be situated within a block of 2 liquor stores (sometimes that comes in handy!), a marijuana shop, a grocery store (Safeway), gas station, coffee shop and a few great restaurants.  There's even a community acupuncture place, just in case. Also, you're walking distance to DU, so there are plenty of restaurants, bars, banks and fast food in the area. And more great stuff in the surrounding neighborhoods (South Pearl, South Gaylord, Antique Row on South Broadway, etc).  Denver is growing by leaps and bounds, so there's always something new popping up.
transit: You'll be just a few steps from a bus stop; there are 2 light rail stations within 1 - 2 miles. Easy access to most everything. Off street parking available.
house_rules: Please,  TAKE SHOES OFF AT THE DOOR (bring your slippers to pad around the house) and lock the doors/windows when you're not here. Please leave the place tidy to the level of how you found it.  No smoking in the house; if you want to smoke marijuana (just because you can in Colorado), I'll allow it on the deck...just please discard any butts in the alley trashcan rather than in the inside trash. No pets.  No other guests on the property unless confirmed beforehand. Neighbors are quiet, so please be respectful of them, especially after 10 p.m. Please be mindful of my personal belongings. In the summer, feel free to pick flowers and/or veggies in the garden.

name: Bohemian urban cottage (private room)
neighborhood_overview: Up and coming neighborhood that is urban industrial and very colorful with art and its people. Lincoln Park is one of the most diverse and culturally rich neighborhoods in Denver. There is a strong sense of community that has pushed back gentrification as much as possible and is just now starting to see the effects of this current city-wide development and boom. The house itself feels secluded and off the beaten path. It is situated close to the beginning of a highway so it can feel very industrial and loud (during rush hour) but it is quiet at night and safe at all hours. Heaps of art galleries just two streets over on Santa Fe drive. Breweries are also quite plentiful in this neighborhood-- Crazy Mountain, Renegade, Black Sky, Trve, and Wit's End are all less than 1 mile away. Crazy Mountain and Black Sky are the closest at a block or two down the road, as well as a handful of bars. We have good Mexican, Ethiopian, Jamaican, Japanese, as well as some other options for restaurants all
transit: One block from the house you can catch a bus running north to Downtown , just a 5-minute trip, or south and east to the Cherry Creek shopping district. Our excellent light rail transit system is a reasonable walk (4 blocks) away and connects you to the other lines taking you everywhere from Golden in the foothills to the speedy airport train that literally takes you right to the security line. Denver is a great city to bike in as well. They are cheap and easy to rent at various locations around the city. Lastly if you want to drive there is a CarToGo lot 3 blocks away. With a car you can get anywhere in Denver within 15 minutes or less, and to the world famous Red Rocks Amphitheater within 20 minutes as well as the foothills of the Rocky Mountains.
house_rules: No pets, unannounced guests, shoes or smoking cigarettes inside.

name: 5 Min to Downtown - Cozy Twin Room
neighborhood_overview: The house is a five minute drive or bike ride to: - The main highways, I-25 and I-70 - Larimer Street: Larimer Lounge and Meadowlark music venues, Megafauna indie boutique, Crema and Hutch & Spoon cafes, Nooch Vegan Market, Infinite Monkey Winery, Mile High Spirits, Populist Restaurant, Our Mutual Friend Malt and Brew, and Matchbox bar. My home is walking distance to Jake's restaurant, the Walnut Room restaurant, Black Shirt Brewing, and the RiNO art district.
transit: There is a bus stop at the end of the block with a route that takes you right into downtown Denver, but if you have a car, there's plenty of street parking. It is less than a mile from Denver's Light Rail system that goes through downtown, to the stadium, to southern parts of Denver all the way to the Denver Tech Center. It's a straight shot from the airport via I-70, about a 20 minute drive depending on traffic. If you're not renting a car, Super Shuttle is available a less expensive than cabs.
house_rules: The most basic of house rules is to treat my home as if it was your own, with respect to the property. As much as possible, I appreciate energy conservation consideration, meaning, turning lights off when not in use, and reducing heat or air conditioning when leaving the home. Smoking in not allowed in the house, but there is a back patio with patio furniture and a front porch. Please dispose of distinguished butts in the garbage. Please separate garbage and recyclables in the marked containers, and then general picking up after yourself, including rinsing and placing dirty dishes in the dishwasher.

name: Your  Denver Get Away!  3 bedroom 2 bath house.
neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood: Platt Park At the turn of the 20th century, the Platt Park neighborhood—then a separate city from Denver—was a bustling borough of five-and-dime shops and sprawling family homes connected to the city by a clanking trolley line that ran up Pearl Street. As the Mile High City grew, the neighborhood was incorporated, and Denverites migrated south to make it their home. Today, the neighborhood’s storied history is still visible on Pearl Street, where visitors can glimpse trolley tracks peeking through the asphalt overlay, and new shops and purveyors occupy the original, historic buildings. Platt Park is a pedestrian friendly neighborhood.  One block from Antique Row on Broadway with bars and retail.  5 blocks from South Pearl St. (URL HIDDEN) 15 minute walk to the Light Rail at Louisiana/Pearl St. Station. neighborhood_overview: The area is an authentic century+ old Denver neighborhood, with excellent and trendy restaurants opening monthly, bistros, coffee houses, small shops, exercise and yoga studios, ice cream shops, etc, all within walking distance! Two blocks over, the restaurant neighborhood begins and by the time you get 5 blocks over, it's hoppin'! Primarily a residential neighborhood with a perfect balance of wonderful small businesses, and century old homes mixed in with fun contemporary architecture. Downtown/ Lodo/ Union Station is 5 mins by car or an invigorating half hour walk through great neighborhoods and a lovely park. Confluence Park is nearby, where you can kayak in the heart of Denver. Rental kayaks are available in the neighborhood. name: Johnny los medx
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the Baker neighborhood. Its in the heart of the pulse right now.  Other areas were pretty popular over the years (larimar square, lodo area, etc.)  They are over played and over priced. The west side is the best side.  Everything you need is within 7 blocks of our place, trust me. The first Friday of every month we have the "first friday art walk".  If you like art and people watching this is a fun, free event that's always a blast.  It starts one block from my place.  About 25 galleries open for free.  There's food trucks, bands, good art, bad art, and great people watching.
transit: walking / taxi / bus / uber / train all close
house_rules: Have a great time! Just act like adults. No one under 25 allowed. Sorry. Take your shoes off when you come in. Respect the place.  No unexpected guests without the permission of owner.

name: One Bedroom in Capitol Hill
neighborhood_overview: Capital Hill is a great neighborhood, with a lot of coffee shops, great restaurants, short walk to museums, downtown and about 70 miles to all the ski resorts. If you want to check out a concert in the historic Ogden theater its only 2 blocks from the front door.

name: Charming High Street Carriage House
neighborhood_overview: Vibrant residential West City Park is filled with lovely Victorian homes. Shady, peaceful streets, overflowing gardens and friendly people. Whittier Cafe and coffee shop three blocks away, next to a convenience store. City Park, Cheeseman Park, and Capitol Hill are all within walking distance.
transit: Guests report $7 Lyft ride downtown, and about $35 from airport to our door. The A train from the airport plus a short bus or Lyft ride work, too. 15 minute walk takes you to the light rail station to access most of the metro area. Bus stop two blocks away. We are happy to offer suggestions for places to see and ways to get there!
house_rules: Please take off shoes indoors.  Quiet activities only between 10 pm and 7 am.  Please squeegee the inside of the glass shower doors after every shower, hang up wet towels, and tidy up before departing. Thanks!

name: The Spectrum Inn
neighborhood_overview: The North City Park neighborhood is vibrant with diversity and quick access to the city (just 5 minutes). The people are neighborly and helpful! If you like to walk, you will have the best view of downtown Denver there is to be had from Denver's City park, just blocks from The Spectrum Inn.

name: Quiet twin rm in trendy foodie area! 1908 bungalow
neighborhood_overview: This old Denver neighborhood is awesome, with excellent and trendy restaurants, bistros, coffee houses, small shops, exercise and yoga studios, ice cream shops, etc, all within walking distance! Primarily a residential neighborhood with a perfect balance of wonderful small businesses. Century old homes mixed in with fun contemporary architecture. Downtown/ Lodo is 5 mins by car or a gorgeous half hour walk. Confluence Park is nearby, where you can kayak in the heart of Denver. Rental kayaks are available in the neighborhood. I have a large pale green notebook with menus, coupons, and other info about neighborhood offerings and getting around. It's usually in the dining room.

Skyride bus ticket online for $11 one way/ $20 round trip  from DIA to Union Station. Once at Union Station, switch to the local line --the 38 or 44 depending on your arrival time. It should take 12 to 25 minutes to get from there to my house and may require a little walking if you arrive at off hours. Also Uber or Lyft only take a few minutes from Union Station to my home. neighborhood_overview: Sunnyside is an up and coming "hipster" area that borders Highland  which has all the trendy restaurants and bars. Restaurants,liquor store, coffee shop and marijuana dispensaries are an easy one block walk away. Uber is about $5 to downtown Denver or to the Sports Authority Stadium. name: Victorian Townhouse in Lower Highland (LoHi)
neighborhood_overview: The LoHi neighborhood is the place to be! It’s always buzzing with people and things to do. The house itself on a quiet one way street, but is within short walking distance to numerous fabulous restaurants and bars like Uncle, Linger, Root Down, El Five and Little Man ice cream. There’s also a coffee shop/bakery just down the block called Wooden Spoon. If you’re interested in heading downtown, it’s a 10 minute walk to the pedestrian bridge or a 5 minute Uber drive.
transit: You can quickly walk to anywhere in LoHi. Downtown Denver is easily accessible by foot, bike or car/Uber/Lyft depending on how motivated you’re feeling.
house_rules: This is a non-smoking house. If you do smoke please step outside on the back patio.

name: own bed and bath
neighborhood_overview: quiet, peaceful area, easily accessible  there is plenty of parking spaces for guests across the street from Lowry, which is a very nice community in SE Denver with many outdoor parks, ice skating rink, baseball parks, casual to finer dining, medical spas, specialty shops, museums, music venues, small theatre, and colleges.  A few miles West is Cherry Creek shopping district and mall, with bigger name retailers such as Saks and Neiman Marcus, and many, many, more upscale shopping, specialty stores, restaurants and bars.  To the South about 5-6 miles is the Denver Tech Center, which has all the above and more.  You will find Denver has a ton of parks and recreation areas around.  Finally, downtown Denver is only 6.5 miles away, with all of the major museums, sporting events and venues, as well as multiple live music halls.  Also good spots for eclectic music are along Broadway Blvd, running north and south, and Colfax Avenues, running east and west. Cherry Creek bike path is popular for
transit: yes, public transit is very easily accessible #3 bus or 3L limited during rush hours, plus this is centrally located within the central Denver metro area, close to Glendale, downtown, Aurora medical school campus, Lowry, ...
house_rules: non drugs/smoking indoors, respectful no shoes indoors please mostly dog friendly pleases turn off lights and appliances when not using them (did not think I needed I to state this, but for the record) cleanup after yourself and please be mindful of utilities-conserve where we can and recycle bins are provided

name: Beautiful home in Wash/Platt Park
neighborhood_overview: You will love South Pearl Street, with its many unique shops and restaurants just a short stroll away.  Some of our favorite restaurants on S. Pearl include: Yard Bird, and Izakaya Den, Tokyo Premier Bakery.  If you come over the weekend be sure to hit the farmers market on S. Pearl Street.  Or, if it's on a Tuesday you need to try Adelitas Mexican restaurant for $1 tacos and great Margaritas, but there isn't a night of the week that will disappoint.  We also live close to many antique shops, beautiful Wash Park, and the light rail that will take you downtown, or to Golden.
transit: One of the best ways to tour Denver is via bicycle.  There is city bike rental about 1/2 mile from our home.  The light rail station nearest our home is just over a 1/2 mile and it's very easy to use.  You can take the light rail downtown and catch a bus to Boulder for $5.  If you come by car, there is free street parking and one  space behind our home reserved for your use.
house_rules: No Smoking!

name: 40th Floor with Endless Views
neighborhood_overview: Tons of restaurants, shops and bars with in blocks, we have a sub shop, Japanese restaurant, and Bar in the building.  Pizza Across the street, Starbucks within one block.  We are downtown close to 16th st mall, the bus is free and travels up and down 16th st only. Take the train from the airport is the best way to get to us if you are not driving. Once downtown exit the train station and look to your right, that is 16th st, just hop on a free bus heading tords our building and hop off at Champa st.  Then walk 1.5 blocks to our door.
transit: We are across the street from the lite rail stop, 16th street mall has its own free bus system.  Take lite rail from airport to downtown main train station and then use free 16th st buss to get to our street.  Many scooters all over downtown or walk most anywhere.

name: Modern Guest House in Berkeley Lake
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is great. And only getting better! It's set out far enough from downtown that driving and parking isn't an issue, but it's still only a 10 min ride/cab ride to all downtown has to offer. It has it's own vibrant shop/restaurant district called Tennyson st with great coffee shops, tons of restaurants--and more opening every month. Sprouts grocery store that is a 5 minute walk from the house. We also have a beautiful lake and park a couple blocks away that offers great views of the mountains and a nice path if you want to go for a run. We are located only 5 minutes off I-70 so it's nearly a straight shot to get up into the mountains. In the summer, you can walk from the house to Lakeside Amusement Park, one of the old-style amusement parks with wooden roller coasters where you pay per ride for a fun, nostalgic afternoon.
transit: There is a bus stop within 15 yards of the house. That bus will get you downtown without transfers in 30min. Alternatively, a cab will take 10 minutes and be about $10.
house_rules: House Rules: *Our property is smoke-free including pot and tobacco. We do not allow pot in the house period. That includes the alleyways and sidewalks. If you smoke in the house, you will be asked to leave and you will forfeit any remaining nights stay. You will also be charged for the entire cleaning to get the smoke smell out—please respect the future enjoyment of other guests and us. Thank you. *Absolutely no parties at the casita. Ask before booking if you are planning on having any guests other than those staying there stop by. *All guests must read and abide by house rules. *Please treat our home as you would your own. Pick up after yourself and don’t leave a large mess for the cleaning lady. If you break something or spill something (or notice something broken or damaged on arrival), please let us know as soon as possible so we can take care of it.  *Please be aware that we live in a family neighborhood and keep the noise level down between 10pm and 7am.  *No pets of any kind ar

name: Cozy apt in historic bungalow
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love?  Turn of the century brick architecture, flagstone sidewalks, great neighbors, and restaurants, movies, and funky shops within walking distance.  Baker is centrally located and has loads of charm.
transit: The Alameda station light rail stop is a 10-15 minute walk from the house.  The 0 bus line along Broadway runs every seven minutes and is six blocks away.  You can also rent a B-cycle rental bike just down the street and easily hop onto the Cherry Creek or Platt River bike paths and connect with regional destinations.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking of any kind on the property.  We live in a dense, friendly neighborhood; we and both of our immediate neighbors are non-smokers.  We are also a pet-free space.  We request that guests quiet down around 9pm to be respectful of my parent's conservative bedtime.  Please store sports equipment, other than ski boots of course, outside of the apartment.  We're happy to provide access to the garage if you need a place to stash your toys. Please wash your dishes and take out the trash; we'll take care of the rest.

name: Newly Renovated 1890 Denver Queen Anne, sleeps 10
neighborhood_overview: The Baker Historic Neighborhood is one of Denver's gems.  We are centrally located and two blocks from the cities most sought after bars, restaurants and shopping while also being a real community amidst the charm and character of vintage homes.  It's also easy to get anywhere else with close access to I-25, 6th Ave (to the mountains) or anywhere else.  Public transportation as well as Uber/Lyft are all easy and nearby too.
transit: Transportation couldn't be easier.  Multiple bus lines stop literally across the street.  The light rail is five blocks away.  Denver's B-Cycle (bike rental program) has a rack two blocks away.  Additionally, there are Cars2Go vehicles readily available in the neighborhood as well as always a Lyft or Uber car nearby.
house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM, check out at 10am. No smoking in the home, smoke as much as you like on the porch or outside.   We don't mind you having a good time, visiting with friends, and having a few people over, the BBQ and back yard are fun to entertain. Please do not have large parties though.  Our neighbors have been in touch in the past and it upsets them. All we ask is that you treat our house as if it were your own, be respectful to our neighbors and have a blast taking it all in.

name: Bright | Clean | Modern House {Berkeley/Highlands}
neighborhood_overview: The Berkeley neighborhood in Denver is the hot place to be on the Northwest side of the city! It's a great combination of older homes with new construction mixed in, and a wide demographic of people. Just two blocks to the North is the Berkeley Lake Park, with a 1 mile walking loop around the lake, playground, dog park, Library, Recreation Center and lots of open space. Half a block North is a trendy new Coffee Shop, Boutique and Hair Salon. Seven blocks to the East is the well-known Tennyson Street Cultural District - shops, restaurants, bars, galleries and a park. Five blocks South is our Sprouts Grocery Store, 24 Hour Fitness, CVS Pharmacy and an After Hours Urgent Care Facility (just in case!).  The Berkeley neighborhood is ideally located just 15 minutes Northwest of Downtown Denver. A short drive to Mile High Stadium, Pepsi Center, Union Station and all that downtown has to offer! Also,  just South of I-70 for easy access to Denver International Airport and the Rocky Mountains. 2
transit: Parking included: -1 off-street parking spot included next to the guest house -Additional street parking available 1/2 block South Public transportation: -RTD Bus stop 1/2 block away -Car 2 Go easily found around the neighborhood -Uber and Lyft

name: Charming City Park Bungalow - Winter Specials!
neighborhood_overview: The Whittier neighborhood is growing rapidly. Our neighbors are friendly and welcoming. We find it to be one of the most charming historic neighborhoods in Denver! We are very close to the RiNo Arts District, City Park, the Denver Zoo, Uptown, Capital Hill, Downtown, and more. We frequent the Whittier Cafe, Vine Street Pub, Beet Box (vegan), and our local favorite Mexican restaurant, La Pasadita, all within walking distance. Bike rentals can be found nearby and the area is also very walkable.
transit: Bike rentals, the light rail, the RTD bus system, and a variety of car rentals are all within walking distance. Parking is always available on the street.
house_rules: We request that guests keep our home as clean and tidy as when you enter it. We'll wash the sheets and towels, but we ask that you wash all of your own dishes and tidy up the house upon departure.  Please lock all doors when you leave, smoke outside, no marijuana on the property, and please be mindful and respectful of our personal belongings. We have an old, charming home so we ask that you treat it with care and let us know if anything breaks. Especially during the winter, if you wouldn't mind leaving your shoes off at the door, we would be very grateful. Please, no pets or extra guests without our permission and without paying the pet fee. We are sorry, but we cannot allow cats as we are very allergic. We live in a quiet neighborhood so we ask that you are respectful of our great neighbors during the night. In return, we promise you a very clean, tidy, charming, quiet, and comfortable home. Welcome!

name: Historic & Fresh Home in RiNo
neighborhood_overview: "The River North Art District "where art is made" goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for visitors. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars, restaurants, brewpubs, art galleries and working studios. RiNo boasts a diverse mix of creative businesses ranging from visual artists, designers and furniture makers, to craft distillers and brewers, winemakers, creators of unique outdoor gear and small-batch coffee roasters. The art definitely extends beyond gallery walls in this neighborhood, with its colorful and innovative street art murals in alleys and on buildings around almost every corner!"  Read more about RiNo from the VISIT DENVER website.
transit: This row home is 4 blocks from a B-cycle station and 5 blocks to the light rail.
house_rules: Please treat my home as if it were your own. No cigarette smoking inside the unit. If you need to smoke, please do so outside and clean up after yourself. If you intend to partake in Denver's liberal weed laws, please let me know so I can inform you of the laws associated.  No pets and no parties. No outside guests unless approved by the host  All guests must be 21+ unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian We are a gun free household. If you are a firearms carrier, your firearm must remain off the property at all times.

name: Full of Character AND Comfortable !
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is walking distance to a historic music venue (Bluebird Theater), several bars (Atomic Cowboy, PS Lounge, Goosetown Tavern, Cerebral Brewing and others), great dining (Into The Wind, Stella's, R-Bar Tag Burger Bar, Sully's Pizza and Denver Biscuit Company), as well as an eclectic Coffee Shop (Hooked On Colfax). There is a full grocery store (Sprouts) 4 blocks from the house. A great book store (Tattered Cover) is a 5 min walk away.  City Park, Denver Zoo and the Denver Museum of Science and Nature are about a ten minute walk - and the Denver Botanical Gardens is a quick 20 minute walk through beautiful neighborhoods. All this, of course if you limit yourself to our neighborhood - hop the Colfax Bus and see what Denver has to offer! Downtown/LODO, RiNo 5 minutes away, Highlands 10 minutes away , explore all the neighborhoods.  Leave the car at the airport - it is super cheap if you are travelling within this city!
transit: It is quite easy to navigate the city from our home.  Biking, Walking, Uber/Lyft, and Public Buses (The Colfax #15 which goes downtown and runs every 10 minutes during peak times one block away - schedule at house) are all viable options for getting around Denver from this location. Off street parking is available!  Ask for more information at time of booking.
house_rules: The "house book" spells out all of the rules and we ask that you read it upon arriving, however: -Strictly no smoking indoors - backyard OK - people smoking anything inside will be assessed a $250 fine. -Strictly no pets. -Keep back yard noise down to a reasonable level after 10pm - we have close neighbors. -Take care of our house like you would your own. -All guests staying at the apartment must be listed on the reservation (i.e. two guests staying, reservation states two guests on AirBnB platform).  If additional guests are found to be staying that are not listed on the original reservation, the fee assessed will be 75 dollars per extra guests / night. -Guests who are not checked out by 11 am will be assessed a $100 fee.

name: Gracious, comfortable Farm House
neighborhood_overview: What do I love about our neighborhood? Pretty much everything! The parks, the trees, the amazing assortment of spectacular, cosmopolitan places to eat, the proximity to downtown with all it's cultural wonders, from museums of every kind to the opera, ballet and world class Broadway productions. The friendly people, the easy access to everything from super markets to beauty salons and all the practical kinds of shops one needs. The walkable nature of the neighborhood, the beautiful lakes, the mountain views, the many beloved dogs, the endless interesting things to do ...the bookstores, cafés, universities, and artsy movie houses. The wonderful array of antique and classy second hand stores on W. 44th Avenue and the quirky specialty places like Double Dutch, which specializes in real Dutch delicacies including at least 20 different kinds of licorice; the Dolce Sicilia Bakery with its mouth watering Italian pastries, breads and savory treats; or the Mexican bakery on 32nd, Oh, and if I st
transit: Free street parking!
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking allowed. You are welcome to bring pets but please be sure to pick up and vacuum up thoroughly after them. No loud, late night parties (the neighbors are friendly but conscious of the noise). Please let us know how many people and or pets will be in the Farm House both before you come and if there are changes in the population. Please dispose of your trash and recycling in the dumpsters and recycling bin behind the house in the alley. Please leave the used linens in a pile in the bathroom before you depart. If you have the time or inclination to do the laundry you will receive serious extra brownie points, but don't feel obliged. The Farm House is over 100 years old, it has been serving well for a long time ; if there is a problem with anything, please let us know via text ASAP. (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , we will do our best to attend to it promptly. Have a great stay.

name: Sunny Classic Central Row Home
neighborhood_overview: Children play in the front yards of homes and, on street sweeping days, neighbors will literally knock on your door to remind you to move your car so you don't get a ticket!  Neighbors are kind to one another, and, if interested, direct neighbors in the connected two row homes are friendly and like to hang around together.  City Park Jazz is hopping on Sunday evenings in June and July, and is but a nice walk away!! There is one posh, super local restaurant 3 blocks walking down the street, The Plimouth. There is a a super local Ethiopian coffee shop (coffee ceremonies on Sundays!) another few blocks in the other direction. You can bike to restaurants and bars on 17th street or in downtown in 10 minutes, or drive there in about the same. The area is primarily residential. There are convenience and liquor stores within 3 blocks.

Business License # 2017-BFN-(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). Thanks!

name: Cozy Master Suite (private floor) in Highlands
neighborhood_overview: Premier location! The Highlands is a very walkable, historic neighborhood, with some homes dating back to the 1880s.  Only two blocks from West Highland's main street , over 25 hip bars and eating establishments, as well as boutiques and salons, are only a short walk away, as well as a farmers market every Sunday morning (see my custom GUIDEBOOK and MAP at bottom of listing for tips). Lovely Sloan's Lake is only a 10 minute walk away where you can stroll or jog while viewing Mount Evans to the west or see downtown reflected in the waters from the east. The Tennyson arts district with more cafes and bars is less than a mile away.  Denver's exciting downtown nightlife can be reached in minutes by car or 10 minutes by bike, or walked to via the Lohi walking bridge.  Also, the neighborhood location is ideally suited to miss city traffic and quickly access the mountains via I70 for a day of sightseeing, hiking or skiing.
transit: Very convenient to public transit. Bus stop to downtown is only 2 blocks away on 32nd. You can rent public bikes at 32nd and Julian. Or feel free to hop on my bike during your stay and bike downtown, around Sloan's Lake, or take the Cherry Creek bike path. Uber and Lyft are a great way to get around town (only $5-7 to get downtown). Also, the home is ideally suited to quickly access I70 and escape for a day of skiing at Loveland or one of the resorts in Summit County.
house_rules: No smoking outside or in. I do request that guests exhibit responsible alcohol use and no illegal drugs are allowed. Please respect privacy and noise levels.  Dogs are welcome if they are friendly and can get along with Buster who would love the company. Cats are not allowed through instant book, but you can contact me prior to booking to discuss.

name: RiNo Art district private home, yard & Hot Tub
neighborhood_overview: RiNo or River north is an amazing neighborhood which was formally an industrial warehouse district.  It is filled with art galleries, studios and other creatives... it is known for it's graffiti art festival, Colorado Crush, with murals visible all year round. It is home to some of Denver's best restaurants, microbreweries and wineries.   Don’t be fooled by other AirBnB’s which claim to be in RiNo, our place is the corner of 31st and Larimer, the heart of RiNo. The only hotel in RiNo is the Ramble which is typically over 500 dollars a night!!!
transit: If you need to leave RiNo, it's EASY to get around Denver without a car:   *  Transit:  5 Blocks to A-line (Denver International Airport & Denver Union Station) and 5 Blocks to D-Line (Convention Center, Performing Arts Center). *  Car2Go - Car Rental by the minute, hour, or day.  Grab any of 500+ Mercedes cars parked all over the city, Park in any legal spot for free, no need to refuel. *  Denver B-Cycle - Wanna Ride a bike?  Station within 1 block of house.  88 stations with 700 bikes all over the city.  From $9 / Day.   *  Uber and Lyft *  Bird, Lime, Lyft scooters (download the app) - are a fun and cheap way to zoom around the neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview: LoHi is an awesome neighborhood!  This area is an eclectic, modern twist to authentic, old town Denver.  Several restaurants, shops, parks, trails, and 4 pro stadiums are nearby.

house_rules: We expect you to have a good time, just leave it the way you found it ;) There is a 100$ fee for early check- in or late check- out.  And yes, this includes dropping bags off early.  The cleaning service needs every minute to get the house ready for you! Our cleaning service is awesome but doesn't cover cleaning up after any kind of smoking.  Please take all evidence out with the trash.  Unfortunately, we will charge the entire deposit amount for any evidence left behind.  Sorry to be so strict but you can imagine showing up to someone else's party.  We can't have that or any butts left for the next group.

name: LoHi Hot Spot w/ View
neighborhood_overview: We have more restaurants within 5 blocks than you could possibly imagine. The best deli in Denver is right downstairs. There are two speakeasies within 2 blocks, one being in the top 50 best bars in the WORLD! There are 2 local breweries within 3 blocks. Sushi, Tapas, Juice Bar, Pizza, and Bar Food are around the corner.  If you have plans downtown, it's an easy and pleasant walk to get to the 16th St Mall. You can pick up the free mall shuttle or just keep walking to see everything downtown has to offer.  Grab a B-Cycle or scooter and jump on the river trail. You can get all over Denver using bike trails.  Are you going to a sporting event? All of the venues are within a 15 min walk or $5 lyft/uber ride.
transit: You can get to anywhere in Denver for no more than a $10-15 lyft-uber ride.  The 16th street free mall shuttle is a 7 min walk and will get you across all of Downtown.
house_rules: Please no smoking in the house. We understand that Marijuana is legal in CO, but please smoke it on the porch. If you are leaving behind leftovers please leave them on the counter where they can be easily seen.

name: Cozy Base in Vibrant Family Home
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a lively mixture of families, young couples, and the elderly. The area is quickly transitioning and gentrifying, and it comes with all the associated circumstances. Our family is very happy here, and we embrace our urban location. We take our boys to the park, let them play outside, and say hello to all our neighbors. We also live on a very friendly block, where everyone knows each other and gets along great. Our area is residential and doesn't offer many restaurants or bars, but it is just a short drive from all the best spots in the city. On foot, you can visit a 7-11, a liquor store, a couple of great taquerias, a nice little New Orleans bar with pretty good food, and an asian grocery store.  And soon, we hear, an Ace Hardware, woohoo.  :)
transit: There is a bus stop 2 blocks away from our house. In our experience Denver is best explored from our area by car, but the bus also works, it just takes a bit longer.  Once downtown, there is a free bus that runs up and down the length of downtown, on the 16th street Bus/Pedestrian Mall.  It runs all day and most of the night.  By car we are close to the major highways, airport, and downtown (downtown is 3 miles from us).   City Park, Denver's largest park, is a 30 minute walk, or less than 10 minutes by car. The Zoo and the Denver Museum of Nature and Science are also pretty handy - in fact they're on the north side of the aforementioned City Park (the side nearer us). As of April 22, 2016, there is a new light rail line (A Line) between Union Station in downtown Denver and the airport.  Express line. $9, makes only 5 stops or so.  The stop nearest us is at 40th and Colorado Blvd, which is about a mile from us (1.2 miles).  From there you can walk or take another bus (Number 24) which
house_rules: We know many people are visiting Denver these days to enjoy our recently legalized marijuana. While we don't object to people's personal choices in this area, we must insist that no smoking of any kind is allowed in our home. We appreciate our guests' understanding!  Also, no pets please (sorry).  Our kind sweet no longer young cat is completely terrified of dogs (and a bit territorial with other cats).

name: 1908 Rowhome In Sloans Lake
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in Sloan's Lake, a historic Denver neighborhood featuring the city's largest urban body of water (also named Sloan's Lake). Highland Square shops and restaurants are less than a half mile NW and Jefferson Park restaurants and Safeway supermarket are a half mile SE. Downtown is less than 2 miles.
transit: Getting around is easy. The 32 bus runs down 32nd ave and the 28 bus runs down 26th ave - stops for both lines within 3 blocks with E/W service to downtown 7 days a week. Also the 31 runs N/S on Federal nearly 24 hrs 7 days a week. Speer Blvd provides great access across town to Cherry Creek, and I-25 & I-70 are both easily accessible. Uber and Lyft are both very useful and cheap from this location as well.
house_rules: Smoking tobacco is not permitted in the house. Pets must be confirmed by host. No cats - Dogs only. No pets allowed on furniture. Please clean up the backyard after your pet. Pet owners who may be subject to an additional cleaning fee. Limit 1 dog per group. The house is not child-proof so parents with young children will need to aware of potential issues.

name: Urban Nest of Denver
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the oldest neighborhoods of Denver. All the houses have character and charm. It is fun just to go for a walk. We live just a block from many great restaurants, and our go- to coffee shop "St Marks". There are restaurants all along 17th street! Just 5 blocks from both - City Park and Cheeseman Park, where we love to take the dogs, go for a run, rent a bike or paddle boat for an hour or so, or picnic on a summer sunday night to listen to live music. The Zoo and Botanic Gardens are in walking distance. During the summer months the Botanic Gardens hosts amazing, intimate concerts in their outdoor amphitheater. If you're here during this time you should check out their calendar. There are several other concert venues in close proximity, too. Less then a 10 minute commute to both Downtown Denver and Cherry Creek North or Cherry Creek Mall. Close to several other old town neighborhoods with small shops and tons of restaurants.
transit: Street parking is free and untimed in this area, but can be a bit challenging later in the evening. Lyft and Uber are readily available - if you are a new user to Lyft, download the app and use the code DENVERAIRBNB for free ride credit, if you're new to Uber, download the app and use the code H93TK. There are 3 different bus stops within a 2-5 minute walking distance.  We have Car2Go and ZipCar in Denver which is super easy to use.  We have two bikes available to you at any time, and if more are needed there are lots of city rental bikes (B-Cycle) with the closest station being at the corner of Race and 17th, less then 5min walking distance. Just use your credit card at the kiosk to purchase a day/week/month pass and you'll have 30 minutes to get it to the next station and lock it in without any additional charge. It's only another $1-2 for the next half hour.
house_rules: -No smoking inside the apartment or anywhere on the property - including the courtyard (electronic vaping is allowed - nothing with a burning element - no dab rigs). Brownies taste much better anyway  -We charge a nonrefundable pet fee of $60 for stays under a week, $120 for a week, and $180 for over two weeks.  - Couch cover must be used when pets are staying -Respectful and reasonable quiet noise levels especially after 10pm -Hot tub use only until midnight -Longterm stays (14 days or more) have cleaning services weekly, with linens being changed out, kitchen, bathroom and floors cleaned, this is a $69 additional charge to the guest  -No parties please! -Most importantly relax and enjoy your stay!

name: Historic Capitol Hill Mansion
neighborhood_overview: This the historic Molly Brown and Capitol Hill neighborhood.  My "mansion" is the south mansion of the complex, built in 1890 by Mr. Guillilly who was, at the time, the treasurer for the Denver Rio Grande Railroad.  There is a large courtyard with gardens that I have been personally tending to for five years.  The neighborhood is eclectic and safe. The walkability index is 10+. My Denver Art Museum and Botanic Gardens membership are available to my guests.
transit: Walking is the best way to get around as everything interesting is within a 20 minute walk, including Trader Joes, coffee shops, the best restaurant in Denver, Potager.  There is a B-Cycle station a block away.  Car2Go is also very accessible in the city.  There is a bus line on the corner of 12 & Pennsylvania.
house_rules: We will figure it out.  I am fairly easy going although no smoking of any type of plant is allowed.  I appreciate consideration and cleanliness on the part of my guests and will extend the same to them.

neighborhood_overview: Whittier is a diverse neighborhood and has become a hip hot spot. Gathering with the neighbors for Fetch 'n Stretch (yoga at the dog park), biking/running City Park trails...the closeness of all these things makes it a great place to live and stay.

Congress Park constantly gets voted one of the best places to live in Denver, come experience it!

name: The Comfy Casa
neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in the Clayton neighborhood, just north of City Park.  It is mostly residential and very quiet at night.  You are near access to the RTD bus line, the A-line to the airport, and just a short Lyft or Uber ride from downtown. There are a few hole in the wall restaurants and bars within walking distance.  There is a Walgreens on 36th and Colorado blvd less than a mile from the house and Uptown Grocery just 2 blocks south.
transit: Getting around is super easy from where you will be staying. If you are flying in, you can just hop on the A-line from the airport and get off at the 40th and Colorado station. From there it is a 15 minute walk or a $5 Uber or Lyft. Speaking of which, Uber and Lyft are the best way to get around by far.  If you are driving there is plenty of free parking in front of the house and easy access to I-70 and I-25 which will connect you with the rest of the metro area.
house_rules: All I ask is that you respect my home and my neighbors.  Smoking pot and drinking is fine as long as you are old enough to do so.  Cigarettes outside please.

name: Garden Chateau in City Park + Hot Tub
neighborhood_overview: North City Park is the best of everything Denver has to offer. A short drive is the #1 new restaurant in Denver- The Plimoth.  City Park and Golf Course is only 5 blocks away where you can go see the Denver Zoo and the Denver Museum of Nature and Science (one of my favorites!). You will be 15 minute drive from the Colorado Convention Center, 10 minutes from 16th Street Mall, the main shopping district in the heart of Downtown Denver, 15 minutes from the Denver Art Museum, 10 minutes from National Western Complex, 10 minutes from Coors Field and 15 minutes from Sports Authority Field at Mile High Stadium, home of the Denver Broncos. The house is a 25 minute drive from Denver International Airport and 30 min to Red Rocks Amphitheater. This is a urban neighborhood five blocks from City Park and near downtown but quiet and without the crowdedness of being right downtown. You are near all the bus lines and the light rail station. You are very close to Colfax Street with the best music venue
transit: You can get pretty much anywhere in Denver by light rail or bus. The home is very convenient to the Light Rail system. You are 2 miles, or 6 minutes away by car from the Light Rail station where you can park all day for free. I would recommend having a car or using bikes to get the most out of your trip. You can use Lyft or Uber as relatively cheap alternatives to cabs and B-Cycle to rent bikes throughout the city. Although Denver has great public transportation infrastructure, it is not frequent enough in comparison to very large cities to solely rely on in my opinion.
house_rules: Pets We love pets and allow them if they are well behaved. Please clean up after them. Smoking  No smoking inside the house, but you are welcome to in the backyard or front yard.  420 friendly only in the sunroom and backyard(be sure the windows in the sunroom remain shut at all times) Hot Tub -No glassware in or around the tub.  -Please shower before getting into the hot tub. -Use the built in metal lift to open/close the hot tub cover -Be sure to close the cover (along with the additional rain/sun cover) after each use Security Our neighborhood is safe, but as soon as you leave please make sure all the windows and doors are locked. Please be considerate of your neighbors. Keep your noise level to a minimum  after 10pm while in the backyard.

name: Charming Urban Loft Near Downtown
neighborhood_overview: Our loft is located in the Golden Triangle, the area South of Colfax, West of Broadway and East of Speer Blvd. The area is a mix of old and new buildings, office space, retail shops, coffee shops, bars, pubs, restaurants, galleries and museums. Whether you are exploring on foot or bike, the choices of eating and drinking establishments are endless. Whatever mood you are in, you will find what you like. The Cherry Creek bike path is right across the street and is great for a picnic lunch, exploring or getting some exercise: bike, rollerblade, run or walk.
transit: -Free 16th Street Mall Shuttle will take you the length of 16th Street, and you can then walk anywhere!  -There are B-Cycles rental bikes 1 block away that you can check-out hourly to get around if you don't want to walk. We ride our bikes everywhere and it's a great way to check out the city. -The Cherry Creek bike path will take you downtown or up to Cherry Creek North where there is more great shopping, restaurants and fun things to do.  -Union Station -This transportation hub has Amtrak, Light Rail and Buses. -Uber, Lyft and Taxis frequent the area  -ZipCars and Car2Go
house_rules: -This is our Home; please respect it as you would yours.  -NO Smoking indoors and NO pets. -420/Cannabis smoking is NOT allowed in the building due to HOA regulations. -There may be drop-ins scheduled to water the plants and you can have cleaning scheduled.  Please respect the neighbors.  Everyone in this building is friendly and noise isn't an issue if you keep it at a normal level. Please be mindful of not slamming the front door, the noise is very loud in the hallways. When using the TV/stereo, please make sure the volume turned to a reasonable level, especially after 10pm.  We hope you feel very comfortable and at home when you are here. Thank you for showing consideration and care throughout! Wendy & Ryan

name: RiNo, Ballpark, & Downtown
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, light rail, downtown, Welton street cultural district & RiNo district.  The area is exploding with new art, food, nightlife, and innovative attractions! Walking score of 92.  Disclaimer... downtown Denver is host to several homeless shelters.  There can occasionally be foot traffic in the surrounding streets.  None of our guests have ever felt threatened and neither have we...  in fact, most interactions can be quite pleasant, but if the occasional shopping cart or person singing to themselves is a concern, then this urban neighborhood might not be for you.  Otherwise, come enjoy all this amazing area has to offer!
transit: Denver is very biker and walker and Lyft/Uber friendly so it's often easier to get around without a car.  From the airport there are a few options:  1. Fastest (and cheapest if more than 3 people) is Uber/Lyft roughly $30 - $40 2. The train to 38th & Blake or Union Station is $9/person. It is about 20 minute walk from either of those stops or a $7 Uber/Lyft.  3. Train to Union Station and take the free 16th Street mall shuttle from Union Station to the Light Rail stop at 16th & California. Take light rail ($2.50/person) to 25th & Welton and walk 3 blocks to our home on 24th & Stout. Light rail is 3 blocks away & downtown business district is 8 blocks.  Tons of amenities are easily accessible by foot.  There are also several B-cycle stations in the neighborhood and all over the Denver area.   Scooters are also aplenty.   If you want to go explore Red Rocks or the mountains you will need a car. There are a few rental car places within walking distance if you would like to rent a car for
house_rules: Our building is quiet.  We have great relationships with our neighbors and will not allow disturbances to them.  Please remember this is our home.  We want you to feel at home, but not in an animal house sort of way.  If our neighbors report disturbances, or any unregistered guests, your reservation will be immediately cancelled and the security deposit along with remaining balance will be surrendered. By confirming your reservation with us, you are acknowledging the existence and availability of a kegerator in the unit.  You also acknowledge the beer will only be consumed by persons age 21 or older, and that all members will drink responsibly.  Our vision of this amenity is equivalent to offering a bottle of wine or a six pack to welcome guests.  Please treat it as such as it is our personal beer we are sharing with you.

name: Cozy 2BD-parking yard laundry
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is perfect for someone who wants to be close to the city, but not have to worry about noise, traffic, or parking. There's plenty of walkable shops, bars, and restaurants. The best part is there are two grocery stores and a liquor store just 1 block away.  My house is 15 minutes from downtown, and 30 minutes from the airport, in a residential neighborhood called Montclair. There are some excellent coffee shops, restaurants, and bars within walking distance. 2 grocery stores are just a block away. There's a park a few blocks south of me with a playground for those of you with kids.  **Check out my "guidebook" for my recommended restaurants/bars/cafes!
transit: Uber and Lyft are both very popular in Denver, and affordable to use! Ask me before downloading the apps onto your phone- I'll give you a link for a free ride on each. Turo is a car rental service, I can give you a code for $25 off. There is also a bus stop right at the end of my block, and if you use Car2Go, there's one frequently parked right in front of my house. Hertz just opened a rental place at the end of my street as well.
house_rules: We live here and will be here at the time of your stay, so please do not attempt to circumnavigate any of these rules:  1. No parties. Quiet hours after 10 PM on weekdays and 12 AM on weekends. No music or loud talking after these hours.  2. Absolutely no unregistered guests. Any guest with unregistered overnight guests will incur a $100 fine and be asked to leave.  Please make your reservation for the exact # of guests who will be staying, and discuss any changes with hosts.  3. No pets or support animals due to safety concerns with another animal that lives on the property. 4. Smoking outside only, please. Guests who smoke indoors will be asked to leave immediately and charged a $100 fee. 5. If you spill/break/stain something, please tell me instead of trying to hide or cover it up.

We request that you leave our home in the same condition that you found it when you arrived.

name: Cozy 1 bedroom unit in hip area!
neighborhood_overview: Within a very short walk you will find the South Broadway (SoBo) district with shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, pot shops, yoga, bowling, movies, and light grocery shopping. The neighborhood is becoming increasingly popular with all types of people and is great for people watching! During the week most places are open late and on the weekends most bars and restaurants are open till 2am or later.
transit: There is a dedicated garage spot for this unit! It is an old horse barn from 1876, so stay away from huge SUVs when you are renting a vehicle, or street parking may be the only option. Depending on the night street parking can be harder to find on street parking across the street from the apartment, but usually there are spots no longer than a block away. There is a bus stop located on the corner of Lincoln and Bayaud. Car2Go is a local car share company that is always accessible in the neighborhood. Uber and Lyft are always nearby if you would prefer not to drive. There is a Bcycle station just a few blocks east on Bayaud if you would like to rent a bike for the day. If you live in a city that has Bcycle already, your membership will transfer!! Highway is only a few short minutes away if you are looking to head to the mountains! Who would want to leave the neighborhood anyway??
house_rules: Quiet time is from 10pm to 8am Monday to Thursday, 11:45pm to 10am Friday and Saturday.  No parties.  420 friendly and will help with utensils and/or advice if you are traveling for that purpose. 420 smoking is allowed inside or in the courtyard but NO CIGARETTE/TOBACCO PIPE/E-CIG/SPLIFF(tobacco/marijuana mix) smoking inside the apartment.  If you are traveling for the new recreational activities in Colorado, you may smoke inside the apartment, just be respectful of others and please DO NOT smoke inside on check out day/night. Ashtrays are provided in the courtyard.  Carefully review the Smoking Rules information emailed when you book and print out left in the kitchen area. name: StockedHome!
neighborhood_overview: This home is in the upscale and very safe University Park neighborhood adjacent to the University of Denver. A historic park with kids area & tennis courts is only 1 block away.  The neighborhood has welcoming shady sidewalks to enjoy strolls along the blocks dotted with varied architectural mansions to the South and West towards campus. The area has lots of charm and is mostly populated by younger families, though it's very much a part of bustling Denver which means busy streets but also many conveniences within walking distances. Only 6 blocks West of the house is The University of Denver campus (DU) and the University Blvd street boarding it packed with many retail conveniences - Starbucks, many easy restaurants, Ben & Jerry's,  a few bars, banks/ATM, hair salons.  6 Blocks East is busy Colorado Blvd where all the larger retail stores are located - natural grocery store, huge Total Wines liqour store, gas station, post office, and chain eateries.  In just 1 mile is the 'University'
transit: We do recommend having a car for convenience, BUT between walking, delivery options, Uber/Lyft, and public transport it's not necessary :) WITHOUT A CAR OPTIONS: - DOWNTOWN - walk 1 mile to Light Rail station to downtown /or/ 15 min Uber - GROCERIES - King Soopers grocery store delivers / or use a Shipt account - WINE/BEER/LIQOUR - Total Wines liquor store (walking distance) delivers for $8 :) - RED ROCKS - Uber/Lyft for about $30-$45/way /OR/ 'Bus to Show' shuttle goes from University of Denver campus (walking distance) to Red Rocks for concerts (book in advance)  - SCOOTERS - try one of the popular scooters when you don't want to walk (all the sidewalks keep it safe). Companies with scooters: Lyft, Bird, Lime, Spin (check their apps for scooters near you - drop them wherever you want to stop) - OTHER DENVER SITES - use Uber/Lyft to get anywhere else

name: Clean Apartment in Historic Home
neighborhood_overview: This centrally located apartment is walking distance to many amenities and attractions (see below). Sundays, in the summer, include a farmers market (9am-1pm) and Jazz in the Park (6-8pm) only a few blocks north.  The best part about this neighborhood is the solitude and safety of a well established neighborhood, but it's super close to several attractions and downtown Denver is only 2.3 miles away. Please see the guidebook at the bottom of the page that illustrates many of the nearby amenities.  Walk score: 85 out of 100. Nearby Attractions:  •Denver Zoo  •Denver Museum of Nature and Science  •Denver Botanic Gardens  •Denver Art Museum  •Vance Kirkland Museum  •Molly Brown House Museum  •Denver Firefighters Museum Walking Distance:  •Many restaurants (Shells and Sauce, Chef Zorbas (Greek, American, inexpensive breakfast), The Goods (vegan, veggie, carnivore cuisine), Chipotle Mexican Grill (local, healthy, fast Mexican food), Okinawa (sushi), Tacos, Tequila & Whiskey, Pepper Asian Bis
transit: We are 8 minutes (2.3 miles) away from downtown Denver by car. The bus stop that connects you to downtown Denver is one block away (RTD trip planner website or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) maps will give you more detail). The Denver Bike Share station is also one block away. A cab ride downtown is approximately $5-10. Lyft, Uber, Wingz, and Car2go are also available in Denver.  If your a new Lyft user sign up and get a $20 credit. (URL HIDDEN) If you will be driving or renting a car, there is free street parking. Like any congested area, it is occasionally difficult to find a parking spot right in front of the house in the evenings, however you can usually find a spot within a block of the house.   Please Note: The city performs street sweeping the first Tuesday (east side) and Wednesday (west side) of the month on my street, from April through November. Please take note of the signs, to avoid a ticket.
