name: Private Kitchen Bed & Bath 4 Blocks From Downtown
neighborhood_overview: You are staying in the Santa Fe Art district.  It is the perfect neighborhood for the artsy, trendy, social folk. With more than 30 art galleries, studios and innovative businesses. The neighborhood's traditionally Hispanic roots are evident around every corner, from colorful murals and the exhibitions at Museo de las Americas to the Latino influence on the neighborhood's restaurants. The district features some of the most authentic Mexican culture in the city. It's also home to craft breweries and the Buckhorn Exchange, Denver's oldest dining establishment. First Friday Art Walks and Third Friday Collector's Previews attract both locals and visitors each month throughout the year. Art lovers can meet and mingle with artists and gallery owners, while discovering contemporary, traditional and emerging art in unique and creative spaces. For the health-conscious visitors, there are gyms, climbing gyms, and yoga studios in the area. LOCALS KNOW The Art District offers a free shuttle for Fi
transit: The light rail which can take you all over Denver Bicycle rentals in the area Free parking on street
house_rules: Quiet time after 10pm - 6am

name: Wash Park Retreat ⭐ Walkable ⭐ Easy to Downtown
neighborhood_overview: The Vibe: Local spots where urbanites and nearby residents—mostly 20- and 30-something renters, young-families, and homeowners—hang; foodies visiting the hood’s rich and varied selection of eateries; joggers finishing their loop at the adjacent Wash Park. Grub: Head to the French-inspired Vert Kitchen for homemade sandwiches (try the curried chicken), or a fast-casual brunch. (Or not so casual: They also sell bottles of champagne.) For Greek food—a genre that’s a little sparse in Denver—Pete’s Central One is a mainstay. Wash Park West is also a great destination for Asian cuisine, and Thai Basil, although a chain, serves up the best green curry in that neighborhood. Next door, Fontana Sushi rolls up creative specials, like the Spiderman, which adds extra crab, spicy mayo, and eel sauce to the already scrumptious Spider roll. Get Some Work Done: Head to the cutely named Wash Perk for a home-away-from-home spot to pull out the laptop. The wifi is password-free, the coffee is fresh, and t
transit: A $5 Uber/Lyft will take you pretty much everywhere you want to go.  It's a great biking neighborhood and a bike share is located around the corner. You can also catch public transport a few blocks away.
house_rules: No crazy parties and please be courteous to the neighbors.  Absolutely no smoking of any kind. There is a $250 fine for failure to return the parking permit as the city will not issue another one. We can not accommodate late checkouts. Thank you!

name: 1880s Historic Apartment By Downtown 420 Friendly
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is one of Denver's oldest with access to several shops and restaurants within five minutes walking distance! The Light Rail is also a three minute walk to the nearest station (20th and Broadway Station), which gives the visitor access to several parts of Denver all for a reasonable price, eliminating the need to rent a car!  Rental car place a five minute walk away as well. Uber and Lyft are also viable options if you are drinking or don't want to worry about where to park when you get to your destination!  Bird and Lime are those electric scooters you may see people cruising on throughout the downtown area.  Price is reasonable and perfect for quick trips in and around the downtown area.  I recommend downloading their apps for more details! I love that my parents grew up in this neighborhood. I've enjoyed watching how the historical district has come into its own and buildings have slowly been reclaimed. The Clements Historic District is now a special pocket gem neigh
transit: You can walk most anywhere from the Row House.  RTD light rail train is located at Union Station  > twenty minute walk or a $6 Lyft Line ride away  Train from Union Station to DIA > $10.50 and is about a 40 minute ride.   B-Cycle station is located a block away at 22nd and Tremont > buy a daily or weekly pass for best benefit  RTD Light Rail "D Line" (@ 20th and Broadway Station) takes you to South Suburbs or you can transfer from 18th & California stop to most anywhere in the Denver area. 10 minute walk to downtown and 3 minute walk to the light rail station ($2.25 one way) which can take you to various parts of Denver and the suburbs.  I recommend downloading the Transit APP as it gives you various options for getting cheap and expensive transportation in whatever city you are visiting.  I used it in Chicago and it came in handy.  Uber and Lyft are also a viable option at reasonable rates. Public transportation is also a $10.50 Light Rail ride (A Line from Union Station to DIA) to or

name: Denver's West End Neighborhood!
neighborhood_overview: This side of Sloan’s Lake has recently become popular.  Colfax Ave, which is US Hwy 40, runs through the middle of the neighborhood at 25-30 mph.  Before I-70 was built in the 1960’s, it was the main E/W highway thru Denver, where travelers would come to stay.   Some call this neighborhood and block "wonderfully urban-cool".  Some others, who live in more suburban areas, might describe the neighborhood as “a bit gritty”.  There are still a few “no-tell" motels nearby & used car dealerships - BUT, the neighborhood is quite wonderful with great architecture & very-wonderful neighbors. Now, there are lots of Subaru Outbacks, but the neighborhood hasn’t yet been overrun with Audis.   Its not yet the same as being in The Highlands, yet it is geographically very close – and it is incredibly more reasonably-priced.
transit: By car, downtown is between six and ten minutes away depending on traffic.  By bike, its about 12-14 minutes getting there and possibly double that time getting back [coming back up the hill]. I-25 [at Colfax] is four to five minutes away. I-70 [at Sheridan] is eight to ten minutes away.  6th Ave Freeway [at Sheridan] is six to ten minutes away.  The house is 40 blocks directly west of downtown Denver.  This home is 5 blocks away from the W-Line Light Rail station, 2.5 blocks from Sloan’s Lake Park, 1.5 blocks from the D9 bike path into Denver.
house_rules: Non Smoking inside AND outside (kids and non-smoking neighbors nearby). Entertaining is great. Guests should feel free to enjoy their time in the home. But, unless approved in advance, please, no 10+ person parties… Owner reserves the right to pass-along excessive utility expenses. If the total utilities were to exceed $250 in any month [on average, its half that throughout the year], anything over $250 may be billed to the guest.   Owner is a licensed real estate broker in the State of Colorado.

name: Scottish 5 Star Capitol Hill Walk DWTN 3BD+Garage
neighborhood_overview: The historical Capitol Hill neighborhood is rich with culture and diversity. It is one of the most sought after areas to live in Denver. Just blocks away from the Governor's Mansion, The Kirkland Museum, The Denver Art Museum, The Molly Brown House, and The Capitol Building, you will not run out of things to do without needing to travel far. It is also within walking distance to Cheeseman Park and the Denver Botanic Gardens, a must see while in town. It is also within minutes by car of many Denver attractions such as the Denver Zoo and the Denver Aquarium. DOWNTOWN VENUES  Denver Convention Center 1.2 miles  16th Street Mall Downtown 7 blocks  Capitol Building 6 blocks  Whole Foods Market 3 blocks SPORTS STADIUMS / VENUES  Coors Field 1.7 miles  Pepsi Center 2.0 miles  Invesco Field 2.6 miles HOSPITALS  Denver General Hospital 0.3 miles  Children's Hospital 1.0 miles  Presbyterian St. Luke's 1.4 miles  National Jewish Health of Denver 2.3 miles OTHER  Denver Public Library (central) 6

(Downtown). 2 Block to the 15/15L route bus stop. (North/south). 8 Blocks to the 0 route (east/west). There is a B-Cycle (Bicycle rental) station 2 blocks away. Lime, Lyft, Bird, spin and razor scooter rentals are available in the neighborhood to use round the city. The house comes with a garage but if needed there is street parking.

name: Rock House in Berkeley
neighborhood_overview: The Rock House is in the best location of Denver for your purposes and for the locals that live here.  It sits perfectly between two of the best parks in Denver - Rocky Mountain Park and Berkeley Park. Jog, fish, walk, tennis, baseball, events, etc. All this within walking distance of the house. Downtown is a short 10-minute ride from the property so short you feel you are practically downtown but minus the riff-raff and concrete. Lower Downtown which boasts Coors Field home of the Rockies, Pepsi Center home of the Avalanche and Nuggets, convention center, theater district, Union Station, and many spectacular restaurants/pubs/shopping and more.  Typically we all as tourists believe downtown is where it's at when we start our exploration of places new to us.  For the most part this is true in Denver, but not entirely.  Denver is made up of many unique and eclectic neighborhoods that all have their own flavor and reasons for existence as well as personalities that jive with those neighbo

LoHi has a kid-friendly, eco-friendly, community tone. This is a place where neighbors talk to neighbors, and everyone on the street greets one another with a smile or a friendly “hello”. name: Live Like a Local in Trendy RiNo
neighborhood_overview: RiNo is an amazing neighborhood with culture to spare, but the best part for guests is the accessibility - everything is a walk or short bike away!  The neighborhood has countless restaurants, bars, breweries, galleries, and dispensaries to explore - Work and Class, Great Divide, and Snooze to name a few. Coors Field, 16th Street Mall, Union Station, and Curtis Park are a short walk away.
transit: The University of Colorado A Line will take you from Denver International Airport to Union Station in about 30 minutes. From Union Station, we're a short 15-20 minute walk or a $5 Uber/Lyft/taxi ride.  Most of downtown is a 10-15 minute walk away. RiNo and Five Points are neighborhoods with a lot of character - walking is the best way to see it! On-street unmetered parking is available in front of the house. Finding a space is usually not an issue, although it can be more difficult for Colorado Rockies home games or big downtown events. Be sure to read street signs carefully as some streets are 2 hour parking. Uber, Lyft, and other rideshares are always available and usually the transportation method of choice for most guests. Taxis and pedicabs are easy to find as well.
house_rules: No smoking inside, but the guest bedroom has a private outside area for smoking.  Alcohol and 420 are welcome on the premises - act responsibly goes without saying. Pets, however adorable, are not allowed.

name: Luxury 3 Bedroom Townhome Minutes to Downtown
neighborhood_overview: Jefferson Park is a neighborhood and public park that overlooks Downtown Denver, Colorado from its perch across Interstate 25 (I-25). It is located in the area that is called North Denver. Views east from Jefferson Park take in Elitch Gardens Theme Park, The Children's Museum, Denver's Downtown Aquarium, Pepsi Center, the REI flagship store and other attractions in Downtown's Central Platte Valley. Downtown Denver and the Central Platte Valley are quickly accessed from Jefferson Park, using the 23rd Avenue overpass on I-25 and Water Street. In addition, the Light Rail C-Line is located by INVESCO Field at Mile High in the southern part of the neighborhood.
transit: Guests can walk to the Broncos stadium, Aquarium and Children's Museum.  Other than that I recommend using Uber/Lyft which costs $7 to most locations downtown.

name: Private room private bathroom and great backyard!
neighborhood_overview: Barnum is a fairly quiet, residential neighborhood. Past guests have found the location to be a great jumping off point to see the rest of Denver, but not for an abundance of restaurants, bars, and city life outside the front door. However there are a few gems within walking distance from the house. Within 3 blocks you'll find: a library, an ice cream shop, a Mexican bakery (the best breakfast burritos!), a hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant (so good and cheap!), a small market, and 7-Eleven. Within 3 miles, you can find the best Mexican and Vietnamese food Denver has to offer. We'd be happy to point you towards our favorites. If you enjoy running or going for a walk, Barnum Park is just up the road. There you'll find great views of downtown, nice open spaces and a swimming pool.
transit: A direct bus to downtown stops less than a block from the house (20min ride). The same bus also gets you within a 10min walk to the Broncos stadium if you're in town for a game. A Lyft  or Uber to downtown or South Broadway (great restaurants and bars) is usually between $8 and $15 depending on when you go. If you have your own transportation, the house is: 10-15mins to downtown, 35-45mins to the airport, 20mins to the foothills and Red Rocks, and 1hr to the closest ski area. Being only a few blocks from 6th Avenue and on the west side of Denver, we have quick and easy access to all the mountains have to offer.
house_rules: -Before booking, please make sure you have the right dates. We have had a couple guests plan to check-in after midnight (which is fine), but didn't reserve the room until the next day. For example, if you want to check in at 1:00am on February 5th, you need to start your reservation on February 4th.  -We ask that you treat our home with respect and cleanup after yourself.  You're more than welcome to use the fridge, microwave, toaster and coffee maker, but please refrain from using the kitchen to cook full meals.  -We don't mind if you smoke whatever it is you like to smoke as long as it's on the porch or back deck, but not inside.  -Come and go as you'd like, just please remember to lock both the side door and front door.  -Lastly, please honor the 11am check-out time unless you've arranged a later check-out. This gives us plenty of time to get the room ready for the next guest.  Thanks!

name: Sunny Garden Apartment
neighborhood_overview: A quiet, tree lined working class neighborhood. You will be just blocks to Tennyson Street (going west on 46th Avenue where there are all sorts of restaurants, coffee shops, art galleries and yoga studios.  Going South, you are only 10 minutes from the city and all it has to offer. Within walking distance you can be in a large park with a lake, ducks and geese, tennis courts, public pool and indoor gym.  You will be in Sunnyside, a well known and revered part of the city. You will be a short distance from I70 where you can go West towards Golden and Boulder or visit Mt. Evans - a famous 'teener', that has a road all the top! Going East on I70, you'll reach the airport and the city of Aurora. This neighborhood is filled with young families, kids  and pets, It is a place where many accomplished artists and teachers live and grow! Lots and lots of fun things to do!
transit: In front of my house there is parking across the street on 46th, or on Clay or Bryant Streets. (pay attention to street cleaning signs!)  The public transportation near my house is plentiful. Buses run on Federal, 44th and 38th to downtown or other destinations. There is a Safeway, liquor store and gas stations just west on 44th and Lowell Streets. You are just a few blocks from Tennyson Street and 32nd Streets where you will find many attractions: Parisi Restaurant, 4401 Tennyson St, an Italian inn that boasts freshly made gelato, considered an art district of Denver, Tennyson is home to coffee shops,  galleries, health food, yoga and book stores.  Even closer, at 44th and Lowell (catty corner to the Safeway) is Billy's Bar, a great place to have a sandwich, hamburger or veggie meal and a beer after your flight or before heading downtown.   There are bike trail that surround the city with easy access from my house. There is a city bike transportation system that crosses the city in ma
house_rules: Not too loud, not too  quiet...all is well! Although this is a 4/20 friendly home, I must ask that you do not bring hard drugs into this house. Puffers are welcome inside and out! Smoking tobacco is fine outside, ashtrays are on your patio table and in front. You are welcome to use other parts of yard.  Upon departure please bring your trash downstairs to the kitchen and put key in front next to door or give to me. Remember, It is a 1904 house - thank you!

name: Newly Renovated Condo  North Wash Park
neighborhood_overview: Washington Park is a neighborhood and public urban park in Denver, Colorado. Its historic buildings, lakes, tennis courts, lawns, large flower gardens, and recreation center provide various experiences for visitors. Apart from activities like jogging, walking or biking, the park serves as a center for social activities and encourages community involvement. Due to its welcoming appearance and unique characteristics, the Washington Park was designated as one of the “Great Public Spaces in America” by the American Planning Association in the year 2012. name: Private entry with en suite in Downtown Denver
neighborhood_overview: We are located in an ideally urban setting, close to several popular neighborhoods, including downtown, Five Points, RiNo, Capitol Hill, LoDo, and LoHi. From our home, you can walk to the Sixteenth Steet Mall, the Denver Convention Center, and Coors Field. We are within easy walking distance of several breweries. Here are a few in the area: Spangalang Brewery, 2736 Welton St., 0.5 miles Ratio Beerworks, 2920 Larimer St., 1.1 miles Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery, 1139 20th St., 0.7 miles Great Divide Brewing Co., 2201 Arapahoe St., 0.5 miles Our Mutual Friend Brewing, 2810 Larimer St., 0.9 miles Epic Brewing Company, 3001 Walnut St., 1.2 miles There many more brewery favorites a mere Uber or Lyft ride away!
transit: There are so many great options for getting around in Denver! If you only need a car for a short period of time, you can rent from car2go. Interested in seeing downtown via bicycle? Denver B-cycle has over 88 stations in the Denver area for rent. Uber, Lyft, and taxi services are available around the clock. And of course, the most popular method for getting around our downtown core--walking!  RTD runs the regional mass transit in the Denver area.  We are conveniently located 0.4 miles from the nearest light rail station, 20th & Welton Station. We are also only 1.4 miles away from Union Station, the downtown hub. There are several bus stops within three or four blocks, as well. Please consult the RTD website or app for current schedules. We do not offer guaranteed parking at our town house. There is open parking between the hours of 6:00pm and 8:00am. There is a two hour parking maximum for the times between 8:00am and 6:00pm. There are  several surface parking lots and parking garages

name: 3BD 420 friendly space in SE Denver Welcome Home!
neighborhood_overview: This home is within the Hilltop neighborhood of Denver.  Within a very close distance are several excellent restaurant I recommend.  Groceries and gasoline for your trip are all very close by.  For immediate snacking and smoking needs, there is a gas station/convenience store directly across the street.  The Cherry Creek trail system can be accessed at Garland Park. Awesome for jogging or biking with direct access to downtown. Garland park features sand volleyball, tennis courts, a basketball court, baseball fields, a playground, walking trails and a small lake where I caught crayfish with bologna when I was about 7 years old.
transit: There is ample free parking on the street.  Easy driving access to Cherry Creek (5-10mins), Downtown (15-20 mins), Airport (30-1:00hr), Boulder (30-45 mins), Major Ski Areas (1.5 hrs) A city bus less than one block away, the 83L ($2.25) will take you directly to Civic Center and the 16th Street Mall downtown. UBER and Lyft are generally cheaper than taxis. Bicycles can be rented at numerous B-Cycle stations around Denver, however the closest is appx 20 blocks away .
house_rules: • There is no smoking allowed inside the property or in front of the property. You smoke on the patio in the backyard. • Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. This includes washing their dishes.  • Shoes can be worn inside • Out of respect for my neighbors, no loud music past 11:00pm or before 8:00am.  There is no curfew or hours during which guests must be out, but I encourage travelers to explore the city. It is generally not a good idea to rent the space to simply crash in front of the television. Please, go out and enjoy all Denver has to offer! My home is one of toleration and respect. I welcome all LGBTQ folks. Black, white, brown, purple, yellow -- anybody can be welcome. Old and young get in, as do the short and the tall. From guests of any stripe, I ask for clear communication, respect of my place, and honest feedback. If we have that, we are golden.

house_rules: Please take your shoes off in the house! :-)  We will always respect you and your belongings, we would ask the same in return! Please do not rearrange furniture. (We are saying this because it happened last year.) Please turn off lights and water when not in use.

name: Cozy Room on Cheesman Park
neighborhood_overview: We sit on Denver's 3rd largest park and it is 1.5 miles around.  The neighborhood is historical, eclectic and upscale. The space is a half block from the park, and is located at the end of the Humboldt Street Historic District. Lovely environs await you here!
transit: 1-4 blocks from most major RTD bus lines, including the 6, 8, 10 and 12.  There is also car2go and zipcar ( short term, local trip car rental) throughout the neighborhood. Uber and Lyft are also easily available in the neighborhood, and are affordable options for getting around. Taxis are available within the neighborhood within a short period, as downtown is the epicenter for all taxi service. Rental bikes are available within the neighborhood at 11th and York or 9th and Downing. Walk score:81 Bike score: 97
house_rules: I am extending my place to you and will bend over backwards to make you feel at home.  I love Airbnb and I love meeting people.  This is my fourth year as an Airbnb host and I want you to have fun.  Please do the same, as my guest!  And please read these house rules, you will be held accountable by them. Things about this Space, that You Need to Know - All beds are super comfortable airbeds.  There is a bathtub, not a shower, the bathtub is always cleaned after anyone uses it with antibacterial Clorox. With over 700 guests that I have hosted, no one has ever had any issues, and my cleanliness score rocks, so you will be ok, haha.  This is a garden level, meaning that my windows are ground level.  There is one flight of stairs to come down into my garden level, fyi.  Towards the back of the hallway and into the bathroom the ceiling heat ducts are a bit low, please be aware of this.  No biggie, but some guests have brought this up, so mentioning it here. Parking - Street parking only out

name: Furnished Jefferson Park Townhome
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Jefferson Park in Northwest Denver is a hot neighborhood with a lot of development happening and super easy access to Sports Authority Field at Mile High for football games & concerts.  Within 0.5 mile of this property are Sports Authority Field, numerous popular neighborhood restaurants and bars like Sartos (Italian), Jefferson Park Pub, Sassafras (Breakfast/Brunch), Little Machine Beer and a new brewpub at 23rd & Clay opening sometime this Fall.  Jefferson Park is located 1 block away and Union Station & Larimer Square are within 2 miles of the property.  Jefferson Park was just called one of the most bike able neighborhoods in the City of Denver according to the Denver Business Journal and in the unit will be 2 cruiser bikes for your convenience.
transit: Getting around the neighborhood is quite easy with options of walking, riding a bike, Uber & Car2Go all available to get around the neighborhood and downtown Denver.  There will also be 2 cruiser bikes with locks in the garage available for your use.
house_rules: No Smoking of any kind, no pets and no loud parties as any complaints from neighbors will result in immediate eviction.  The space is great for small get togethers and BBQ's.

neighborhood_overview: The property is in a wonderful, old, established neighborhood, with great shopping, coffee houses, bars, and restaurants. The West Highlands is only a 7 minute drive from The Pepsi Center, Coors Field, and the downtown Denver area.

My home is 45 minutes from DIA (Denver Airport) depending on traffic. All transport listed above are available from DIA as well. There is always safe and ample parking on the street in front of my home. From April through November, there is street sweeping, once a month on a designated week day, but no biggy, you just park across the street. It is of course, always wise to always lock up.
house_rules: I honor my guests and expect them to treat my home with respect and care and most importantly, I want you to enjoy your stay. Excess noise created by guests is highly discouraged.  Dogs are potentially welcome upon discussion. As far as dogs staying with guests, there are a few guidelines, which Lovedy is welcome to discuss with you.  There is one rule that is stedfast... No pets are allowed ON the furniture. (including the bed) Let's discuss your needs and see if it is a win win for everyone. name: DU/Washington Park Bungalow w/ Loft, South Denver
neighborhood_overview: Though located in central Denver the area is quiet, peaceful and relaxing.  The home is considered to be part of “University Park” due it’s proximity (6 blocks) to Denver University, and there are two wonderful parks located near-by: Observatory Park: 2 blocks away. Visitors can follow in a long tradition, begun on August 1, 1894, by attending Public Nights at the historic Chamberlin Observatory, Observatory Park, Denver, Colorado. You can listen to lectures about astronomy, and if weather permits, view the night sky through the 20-inch Alvan Clark-Saegmuller telescope. In addition, the Denver Astronomical Society also hosts an Open House each month. Washington Park: I am one mile from Washington Park, one of Denver's finest parks, known as Wash Park for short. Washington Park neighborhood  is often compared to "Mayberry". It is Denver's first suburb and until the 1950s a trolly car ran from downtown to the Old South Gaylord Street's bustling retail area (located one mile northwest).
transit: You are located 1/2 mile from the DU, the light rail station and I-25. I-25 (or the Valley Highway) puts you on a direct path to the ski resorts. Denver city buses have a stop one block south which will take you right to the bike rental kiosk and light rail. Denver has a wonderful bike rental program and bike paths that make cycling an ideal way to get around the city. Access to city wide bike paths is located within blocks. We've supplied maps and transit information for you in the guide book in the living room. Please ask about transportation from airport.
house_rules: Respect my home as your own! I live in a QUIET, charming neighborhood with elders as my neighbors. Loud music and noisy gatherings are not welcomed and I have asked my neighbors to contact me if such occurs.  I request sensitivity toward my neighbors, as I do not wish to do anything that offends them. While 420 friendly, smoking is NEVER permitted inside the home. Regarding tobacco smokers, I do not accept inquiries from tobacco smokers at all. This is a consideration about the smell on clothing getting into my furniture, bedding, etc. Sorry you guys! No more than 3 guests are allowed to stay in the home, and my preference is for mature guests.  No pets. I have a house manual in the living room which list important things to know and that are requested to be kind to my home!

name: Modern Luxury - Two Fireplaces + Private Deck
neighborhood_overview: Washington (Wash) Park is one of the trendiest neighborhoods in central Denver. Perfect for families, couples, friends, and those wanting to be within easy access to downtown.  Our home is blocks away from Washington Park, spacious and energetic, the park boasts paddle boats on a large duck pond, walking and running trails, a playground and friendly games of flag football, volleyball and soccer in the summer.  The home is less then a mile from Whole Foods and within easy walking distance of several restaurants. Nearby lively South Broadway - a vivacious street on warm summer nights lined with hip restaurants, bars and the best ice cream in town! A perfect place for a Saturday night stroll.  Don't forget to check out Lucile's for some of the best creole-style brunch in town only two blocks from home. See our "Neighborhood Map" for full details on nearby sights!
transit: You can take a train into downtown from the airport, then a short 10-15 minute Uber ride in normal traffic to get home. You can also take an Uber straight from the airport to the house. Denver has Lime scooters and bikes, as well as B-Cycle. Bike paths are plentiful and you could tour nearly the whole city on a bike path that weaves through downtown and along the river. There is a bike station two blocks away that features rentals called b-cycle (free for the first half hour.)  The 16th Street Mall is at the center of Denver and the free mall ride will take you up and down the 1.5 mile stretch of shops and restaurants. Uber is always close to the house. There are also smart cars distributed throughout the neighborhood that can be easily rented with a Car2Go membership. Distances: Bus lines: 2 min walk Broadway Light Rail Station: 20 min walk/5 min drive B-Cycle Station: 2 blocks away Uber and Lyft are always only minutes away.
house_rules: Extra guests are permitted pending prior approval. There is sleeping arrangments for four - a queen sized bed in the master and a queen sized pull-out couch in the living room. Additional sleeping arrangements are the responsibility of the guests.  Smoking cigarettes is NEVER permitted inside the house. Evidence of smoking or any damage as a result of smoking (inside or outside on deck: burns, smell, etc.) will incur a damage and cleaning fee. We get a lot of questions about Colorado's legal cannabis laws. If you have questions, feel free to message us.

name: Lovely private basement apartment with kitchenette
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful, safe, quiet, residential neighborhood about 15 minutes from downtown.  If you are a walker or runner, ask for ideas of where to run, we have a number of lovely local parks.  Plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood including Lowry Town Center with Chop Shop Casual Urban Eatery, The Tavern, Serioz Pizza, The Delectable Egg, Einsteins Bagels and Starbucks, Pei Wei, Cafe Mercato, and Salty Rita's (Lowry is about 1/2 - 3/4 of a mile to our east at 200 Quebec Street).  If you go west on 4th and 3rd, you will find Locando Del Borgo (casual Italian), Park Burger (fresh, sophisticated burgers and salads), Basil Doc's Pizza and the Crumb Cafe all located on Holly Street.  If you want to venture further, the Cherry Creek area (follow 3rd west of Colorado Boulevard and you will find the neighborhood) some of my favorites are the Cherry Creek Grill (awesome salads & grill) and True Food.  Best brunch place:  Snooze on Colorado and 8th, expect a line peak brunch hours.
transit: If you are renting a car, the garage is all yours, come and go as you please.  Otherwise, we are a quick Lyft or Uber ride from downtown, and we are near  a number of major bus lines, including N/S buses on Monaco, and E/W buses on 6th Avenue.
house_rules: I'M SORRY BUT I CANNOT ACCOMODATE LARGE TRUCKS TALLER THAN 76", TRAILERS OR ROOF CARGO THAT MAKES YOUR VEHICLE TALLER THAN 76 INCHES.  IF YOUR VEHICLE DOES NOT FIT IN THE GARAGE,  YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO STAY SINCE YOUR CAR MUST FIT INTO A STANDARD SIZED GARAGE.  Absolutely no smoking.  This is a quiet house and neighborhood.  If you are looking to party or tend to be a loud group, this isn't the place for you.  You will have the garage door opener,  please ALWAYS park in the  garage. You may have 2 cars if they both fit together in a standard garage.  MAX OF 2 CARS. With the remote, the garage is super easy and convenient, and the entry to your place is right off the garage, so it works out great!  If you have infants or little ones, please note that they are welcome and we love them, but the place is not baby or child-proofed. Also, please bring something for the baby to sleep in.  Thanks!

name: Downtown Mt. View 20th Floor Condo
neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of downtown Denver, one block from the 16th street mall with free buses running from the Platte River to the State Capitol Building.  16th Street is lined with stores and restaurants.  The Denver Performing Arts Center is one block away; the Convention Center is just a couple of blocks away as well.  The sports stadiums and the Pepsi Center are an easy taxi ride away.

Downtown Aquarium Children's museum Sloans Lake Lodo/Downtown Denver Platte River (with bike path access) Breweries Restaurants Safeway Grocery Store Coffee Dispensaries  Music Venues This house is in a very prime and desirable area of Denver, close to many attractions.

We highly recommend  touring the city via B-cycle, and there is a station to get bikes 4 blocks away. The I-25 interstate on-ramp is only 6 blocks away with easy access to Hwy 6 or I-70 for those who want to explore the amazing possibilities that the Colorado Rocky Mountains have to offer.

name: Sunny Lohi Retreat-Gourmet Kitchen
neighborhood_overview: We moved to Denver from NYC so walkability was a huge priority for us. We definitely found it here in LoHi.  From our house, you're a short stroll from enough restaurants, bars, breweries, parks, and coffee shops to keep you satiated for a month (ask us for recommendations!). A couple of notable places are the famous Little Man Ice Cream and Williams & Graham (rated the best Cocktail Bar in America) both within a 5-minute walk. Check out our guidebook for more suggestions. A 15 minute stroll across a pedestrian bridge (or $6 Uber) puts you in the heart of downtown Denver, the 16th Street Mall, The Denver Performing Arts Center, Coors Field, Denver Convention Center, and so much more. A 20 minute drive, and you're hiking the Rocky Mountains or catching a show at Red Rocks.
transit: You couldn't be better situated to get around Denver. Walk to the...     - Bus stop (2 minutes)     - B-Cycle Bike Share (2 minutes)     - Car2Go Car Share (everywhere)     - Electric Scooters (sometimes in our front yard)     - Train & Bus Station (10 minutes)     - Free 16th Street Mall Shuttle (10 mins) We're about 30 minutes from the airport. To get in you can... - Take a car (~$35 via uber) - Take the train ($9/person) to Union Station and either walk or car (~$5) from there
house_rules: We live in a quiet neighborhood. Please, no raucous parties, and respect the neighbors with whom we share walls. Please lock the door when you come and go. We love all pets! You can find ours on Instagram at OnlyHelix. Please pick up after them, and use our blankets on the couch. We're smoke-free inside, but you're welcome to use the patio for such activities. No open flames are permitted anywhere in the house including smoking, incense, or candle-burning. In short, this is our home. We are delighted to share it with you, and we appreciate the respect you'll give it. Thank you!

name: Spacious bright and beautiful home in RiNo
neighborhood_overview: Located in the historic Five Points/Curtis Park/RiNo, our home is ideally located for easy access to most places in Denver. We are within easy walking distance to exceptional restaurants, crafted beer breweries, jazz bar, music, and the best coffee shop in Denver. Only 15 EASY WALKING blocks to downtown, 10 blocks to Coors field, 10 minutes (driving) to Denver Botanical Gardens, 1/2 hour to the airport - new train station only 6 blocks away for easy access to airport and less than 3 minutes to access major highways (I-70 and I-25).  Mountains nearby! Our neighborhood is the oldest in Denver and it reflects this by the diversity of the people living here. It is home to different groups of people which is why we love it here.
transit: The Light rail system is only 3 blocks away, around the corner from our house is B-cycle the public bike system (rent bikes for $8 a day).  Major local streets are seconds away. Denver is very bike friendly.  The new train service to DIA (airport) is now running - only 6 blocks from our home. Downtown Denver is only 2 miles away, 40 or so minute walk, 10 minute bike ride or light rail ride.
house_rules: As the house is close to other homes, please be mindful of the noise especially if you are sitting outside enjoying the evening.  No smoking inside which includes vaping  (outside is okay including 420) No pets  Quiet hours after 11 pm (meaning pay attention to noise level)  No parties or loud music  Only registered guests are to be on the property - we are open to guests having visitors but no parties and please inform host of additional house guests if staying overnight.  Green mindset (turn off lights when leaving, heat down or off at night, use only what's needed)  Please leave the house as clean as you found it  Please be careful wearing shoes in the house and we prefer no high heels inside - we like our maple floors  Our check in and check out times are firm.

name: Cozy Basement Suite near RiNo
neighborhood_overview: The Cole neighborhood is a residential "up-and-coming" neighborhood next to the popular RiNo district, which is more industrial. You may notice construction in and around the neighborhoods as Denver is growing very rapidly and we have several big projects underway, including a highway expansion.  We are easy driving/biking distance to other neighborhoods, a lot of new restaurants, shops, art galleries, breweries, dispensaries, and music venues--notably the Mission Ballroom, which opened August 2019. Easily accessible via main streets and highways.  Many homes in our neighborhood were built in the early 1900s. The closest neighborhood bars you can walk to are NOLA and Jack Rabbit Slim's; the closest coffee shop is Rivers and Roads. Also nearby are the Whittier Cafe, Crema, and Prodigy.  The RiNo neighborhood, next door to Cole, is a craft beer mecca, growing rapidly and you will find lots of new businesses and places to explore around Larimer, Market, and Blake Streets, and Brighton Bou
transit: We currently only have street parking due to our recent construction project, but there is plenty of parking on 36th, 37th, and Gaylord streets. We are 1/2 block from a bus stop (24) to Colfax, Cherry Creek shopping district, Botanic Gardens, and DU. Downtown by bus requires a 4-block walk. Lyft and Uber are the most convenient options for getting around town if you do not have your own car or don't want to deal with parking for events. The A-line train to the airport has stops one mile from us in either direction, making it easy and fast to get to the airport or to Union Station (esp. helpful during rush hour). There are only a few places in close walking distance, but biking and driving are quick and relatively painless. There are also a few parks nearby for walking or jogging. We recommend (Website hidden by Airbnb) (Website hidden by Airbnb) and the Go Denver app for transportation options. Rental bikes and scooters are plentiful! If you want to ride a bike or scooter, check out B
house_rules: Coming and Going: we use a sign to indicate whether we are In or Out, and provide one for our guests. If we are Out, and you are last to leave, please lock both doors. If we are In, you can leave unlocked. When you are the last one In at night, please lock both locks on the inside door only. Smoking is not permitted indoors, there is lots of outdoor space for smoking and an ash tray provided. 420 friendly.  Please respect common areas. Pick up after yourself and do not leave overflow trash in the room.  We respect your privacy and ask that our guests do the same. We generally observe quiet time after 11pm on weeknights, and do our best to be quiet when we know our guests are sleeping. * Please read house manual and all details when booking! *

name: Quiet Denver Carriage House Retreat
neighborhood_overview: The Carriage House is nestled within the popular City Park West neighborhood.  Experience the city’s premier cultural amenities including the Denver Zoo, the Museum of Nature and Science, and the expansive 320-acre City Park nearby.  You'll be within walking or biking distance to all the happening restaurants, bars and shops on 17th Avenue.  From Starbucks and Einstein's bagels to St Mark's Coffee House and the award-winning Beast + Bottle - you've got it here!  We're close to supermarkets, coffee shops, and a tasty vegan bakery! Easy access to public transportation to downtown attractions and shopping are just minutes away.  Whether you’re meeting friends for dinner at Strings, discovering local art while sipping on a cappuccino at St. Mark’s Coffee House or listening to great music at Jazz in the Park, the Carriage House offers one of the best Denver locations for your stay! Restaurants: Steuben's The Beast and Bottle Vine Street Pub & Brewery Avenue Grill Parallel 17 Chada Thai Rest
transit: Have we mentioned you can walk lots of places?!?  You can also rent a bicycle at a D-Station around the corner from the house.  7 bus lines travel through the neighborhood and it's an easy drive to get around the city.  We use Lyft a lot too.

Please note: the gym, swim spa, and sauna are all used at your own risk.  No alcohol, food, or drink can be consumed in the gym or sauna.  No unsupervised children in the gym or sauna.  Host assumes no liability.  Although in the city, this is a quiet neighborhood, we ask that you respect our neighbors! Sorry - no pets!

name: Charming Updated Victorian in LoHi!
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the LoHi (Lower Highlands)/Highlands neighborhood. We have lived all over the US and in many other countries and we've rarely found such a vibrant, fun, dynamic neighborhood as this. We truly love it!  The Highlands neighborhood is currently the hottest neighborhood in Denver! Within just a few blocks, there are plenty of options for coffee shops, shopping, restaurants, sports bars, dispensaries, ice cream shops, and much more. Many of the best rated restaurants are located just a 5 minute walk away. We're only a short 15-20 minute walk downtown or an even shorter 5 minute drive or uber/taxi ride. Check out our extensive Airbnb Guidebook.  If you have time while you're in town, it's certainly worth it to get up to the mountains! At a minimum, we encourage you to get to Red Rocks Amphitheater since it's only 25 minutes away and great to check out whether you go for a show or not. You can stop at a brewery in Golden for a beer on your way home.  There's so much to do he
transit: Denver is impressively pedestrian and bike friendly. We walk and bike almost everywhere. In fact, the two of us share a car because we're able to bike so often.  There are bike rentals available only a few blocks away. If you're not walking or biking, most guests who come visit choose to either rent a car from the airport and/or they use Uber or Lyft or regular taxis to get around. The airport is a 30 minute drive from our house when there's no traffic (traffic peaks between 7:30am-9:30am and 4:00pm-6:00pm).

Just let us know if that will be an issue for some reason and we can likely accomodate.    Smoking is NOT ALLOWED in our home (your deposit will be taken if there is smoking smell or evidence of indoor smoking), but you're welcome to smoke in the front or back yard (and we just ask that you dispose of your cigarettes appropriately). name: Stunning Luxury City Victorian

Experience the city’s premier cultural amenities including the Denver Zoo, the Museum of Nature and Science, and the expansive 320-acre City Park nearby. You'll be within walking or biking distance to all the happening restaurants, bars and shops on 17th Avenue. From Starbucks and Einstein's bagels to St Mark's Coffee House and the award-winning Beast + Bottle - you've got it here! We're close to supermarkets, coffee shops, and a tasty vegan bakery! Easy access to public transportation to downtown attractions and shopping are just minutes away. Union Station, where the A-train from the airport drops off, is about a mile and a half or a $6 Uber down the hill.

name: Historic Home Near Old South Pearl
neighborhood_overview: Platte Park is the neighborhood directly to the west of Washington Park in Denver.  It is an old neighborhood with a lot of bungalows, victorians, and Denver squares.  Just around the corner from my home is a bar and restaurant called Lincolns Roadhouse. They have good burgers and fries if you need a quick bite or drink and offer free live music on the weekends. There is also a stretch of restaurants and bars just a few blocks to the south on what is called Old South Pearl St.  There is a good coffee shop. great sushi place, and other shopping across that few block stretch.  There are a couple of breweries within walking distance as well.
transit: Ample street parking is available in front of the house and around the corner.  Please be aware of parking restrictions that are in place during the business day.  I do have a guest parking pass for use during your stay.  I also have a parking space next to the garage behind the house.  I can't guarantee it will be available as sometimes my camper may be there, but if it is empty feel free to use it!  You can also walk two blocks to the west just where the highway (I-25) crosses Washington street and you will find the Louisiana/Pearl light rail stop.  Maps and directions for getting around Denver via mass transit can be found online. It’s only 10 -15 minutes to most locations downtown including the 16th street mall, Union Station, the Convention Center, etc via the light rail.
house_rules: The house is non smoking but you are welcome to smoke outside.  Please be considerate of the patio furniture as any burns/holes will result in a repair fee.  The homes are very close to each other in this neighborhood so please be considerate of the neighbors and keep noise to a minimum after 10pm.   No groups or parties larger than 8 people allowed.

name: Amazing House! Downtown Walk EVERYWHERE Sleeps 14!
neighborhood_overview: "This neighborhood offers a vibrant mix of arts, culture and Colorado history. Explore the gold-domed Colorado State Capitol with its "Mile High" marker on the 13th step. Civic Center Park plays host to live music and food trucks on Tuesdays and Thursdays from May-October. You'll find some of Denver's finest museums nestled amongst beautiful turn-of-the-century mansions of "Cap Hill," including the Kirkland Museum of Fine & Decorative Art and the Molly Brown House Museum. In the Golden Triangle neighborhood don't miss the Denver Art Museum and the Clyfford Still Museum. With more than 50 galleries, fine-art studios, museums, specialty stores, restaurants, nightclubs, coffeehouses and bistros, the neighborhood is a great place to explore on foot." Read more about Capitol Hill and the Golden Triangle Museum District from the VISIT DENVER website.
transit: Denver is home to an award-winning RTD public transportation system, and the property is very close to light rail and bus stations.

Highway is only a few short minutes away if you are looking to head to the mountains! Who would want to leave the neighborhood anyway??

name: Beautiful Capital Hill Condo!
neighborhood_overview: Capital hill is one of Denver's most unique historic neighborhoods!  Elaborate turn of the century mansions line the streets of this beautiful neighborhood which is conveniently a short walk or bike ride from downtown Denver.  The Governor's mansion is located within a 10 minute walk from the condo, as well as a number of beautiful city parks (Cheeseman Park, Washington Park, Governors Park, etc.).
transit: Countless restaurants, breweries, and downtown are a quick walk or bike-ride away.  Denver B-cycle stations (rentable bicycles) are available 1 block away from the condo for easy man-powered transportation. Uber, LYFT and taxis are also available within the city.  The center of downtown is approximately 5-10 minutes away.
house_rules: This condo is located in a secure historical building in Denver.  We ask that our guests simply remember this multi-unit building is home to many people and be respectful during their stay. By accepting the rental agreement, the guest agrees to the terms of the lease.

name: Lovely, Large Room & Bath in LoHi!
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the LoHi (Lower Highlands)/Highlands neighborhood. We have lived all over the US and in many other countries and we've rarely found such a vibrant, fun, dynamic neighborhood as this. We truly love it!  The Highlands neighborhood is currently the hottest neighborhood in Denver (according to basically every survey ever). Within just a few blocks, there are plenty of options for coffee shops, shopping, restaurants, sports bars, dispensaries, ice cream shops, and much more. Many of the best rated restaurants are located just a 5 minute walk away. We're only a short 15-20 minute walk downtown or an even shorter 5 minute drive or taxi ride.  If you have time while you're in town, it's certainly worth it to get up to the mountains! At a minimum, we encourage you to get to Red Rocks Amphitheater since it's only 30 minutes away and great to check out whether you go for a show or not. You can stop at a brewery in Golden for a beer on your way home. The opportunities are endless
transit: Denver is impressively pedestrian and bike friendly. We walk and bike almost everywhere. In fact, the two of us share a car because we're able to bike so often.  There are bike rentals available to guests only a few blocks away. If you're not walking or biking, most guests who come visit choose to either rent a car from the airport and/or they use Uber or Lift or regular taxis to get around. The airport is a 30 minute drive from our house when there's no traffic (traffic peaks between 7:30am-9:30am and 4:00pm-6:00pm).
house_rules: Front door locks automatically so just make sure to pull it shut.  Check-In is any time after 3:00 pm on weekdays and 1:00 pm on weekends. If you need to check in earlier, let us know and we can usually make it work or at least let you drop off your bags prior to check-in, as needed.    Check-Out is by 11:00 am. However, if there's some reason you can't leave by 11am and we don't have new guests trying to check-in, you're welcome to hang out for longer. We can communicate about this and usually make whatever you need work.    We kindly ask that you don't smoke in our home, but you're welcome to smoke in the front or back yard (please dispose of your cigarette butts). We don't care if your cigarettes are brown or green -  - it's all legal here in beautiful Colorado.  Please do not open windows when heat or air is on. We have a planet to protect. If you're hot or cold, just let us know and we'll happily adjust the temperature!  Our phone numbers are posted in your bedroom and you're welc

name: Urban Hideaway
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is historic, vibrant, and beautiful. This neighborhood provides access to the best Denver has to offer. We are blocks to the Denver Art Museum, 16th Street Mall, Denver Botanic Gardens, Denver Convention Center, and Denver Center for the Performing Arts. We are a short walk from the Colorado State Capitol building and the Denver City & County Building as well as the municipal, county, state, and Federal courts. You'll find delightfully varied dining and night life at your doorstep. Be sure to try a brunch at "Jelly" on the corner, or a slice of pizza at Benny Blancos. We love the Friday happy hour at Charlie Brown's. This neighborhood favorite was the haunt of Jack Kerouac and Neal Cassady during their time in Denver. You can belly up to a piano bar, it's two-fers on drinks during H-hour, and the chicken wings are free! If history is your thing, Molly Brown's Denver mansion is a few blocks away and is open to the public or check out the nearby History Colorado Center. Or j
transit: 12th street is a great bus route that takes you directly to the convention center (15 minutes away) or if you prefer to bike the trip is about 10-12 minutes accounting for traffic.  Walkers will be pleased to know that the 16th street free mall ride is located 15-20 minutes walk away, and ushers visitors along 16th street to Union Station, Coors Field, Colorado Convention Center, Larimer Square, as well as shops, bars, and stores along 16th street. Denver hosts a B-cycle program with kiosks to rent and deposit bikes throughout the city 24 hours a day.  There is a kiosk 1.5 blocks away.
house_rules: Tea and coffee are available to make for yourself, but please wash and place your dishes on the drying rack.   Also, we do ask that you please remove your shoes and leave them by the door as the carpet stains quickly.   We expect our guests to enjoy the space without undue late night noise. Smoking of traditional cigarettes is only permitted in the backyard, otherwise friendly. We only ask that you please be courteous of the neighbors! We cannot allow pets at this time. Otherwise, enjoy Denver!

name: Private room with TV in West Denver house
neighborhood_overview: It's quite with easy access to public transportation and freeway access. Downtown is only 10 minutes by car and 25/30 minutes by light rail/bus. Multiple grocery stores within a 3 mile radius of the house. Only 15 minutes from Red Rocks or just a short drive to the mountains. Don't be fooled by some of the run down buildings off Sheridan Blvd.
transit: Close distance to 3 bus lines (1, 50 and 51). The 1 runs east/west and will get you downtown via 1st Avenue. The 50/51 run North/South via Sheridan and will get you to the Light Rail train station just 1 mile North of the house. Uber/Lyft $12-15 to get you to downtown Denver.

Do not touch and/or adjust the thermostat to my house.   You are welcome to invite friends/family over if you happen to have any of either in town assuming when you are visiting Denver. Please do not allow your guests to sleep on my couch.  Also to be clear about something here. Just because I request you to respect my personal space. That does not mean you cannot hangout in the living room, dining room, or kitchen. All I request is that you just acknowledge when I am home, and let me have my living room. I have had guests that abused their access to the house. I just find it a bit uncomfortable for me to have to come home from a hard days work/school and ask you to get off my spot on the couch. name: Comfy, Private Bedroom/Bathroom in a  Great Area!
neighborhood_overview: Sunnyside is a great place to live, and as you'll see is also very convenient for visitors.  Restaurants, coffee shops and bars exist around every corner here, and the proximity to downtown makes that an easy trip.

Our Sunnyside neighborhood is also very walkable, with restaurants and coffee shops located frequently along the short path into Riverfront Park and downtown Denver. name: Modern & Victorian - Perfect 4 bed!
neighborhood_overview: The Highland's and Sloan's Lake are great neighborhoods that we are sure you will enjoy!   Indulge at all the amazing bars and restaurants of Highland Square - less than a mile away.  There are also great restaurants overlooking downtown in Lohi.   The house is within 2 miles to tons of amazing restaurants, shops, museums and attractions: - Sports Authority Field/Mile High Stadium .6 miles - Children's Museum .3 miles  - Aquarium .8 miles - REI 1.1 miles - Pepsi Center 1.5 miles - Elitch Gardens amusement park 1 mile - Sloan's Lake Park .8 miles - Jefferson Park .2 miles plus much more! If you feel like eating in Safeway supermarket is just a few blocks away!
transit: Bike, walk, Lyft, drive - it's up to you!  There is a bus stop at the corner that can take you to downtown, the Convention Center, Coors Field and more. There is also a Bcycle station a few blocks away if you'd like to cycle to your destination. If you prefer to drive we have easy access to interstate 25 which runs north/south through Denver.   When we want a ride we use Lyft but there are lots of local taxi services as well!
house_rules: Yup, it's legal, but there is absolutely no smoking - of anything - in the house or on the property. There will be a $500 charge for smoking. Sorry! Although in the city, this is a quiet neighborhood, we ask that you respect our neighbors!

It is also very easy access to the Lower Highlands, Downtown, Sports Authority Field and I-70 to head up to the mountains.
transit: Denver is impressively pedestrian and bike friendly. We walk and bike almost everywhere. In fact, the two of us share a car because we're able to walk/bike so often. There are bike rentals a couple blocks away that we can point you to if you are interested in renting for the day (b-cycle). If you're not walking or biking, Uber or Lyft are available within minutes or there is a bus stop a couple blocks away. The airport is a 30 minute drive from our house when there's no traffic (traffic peaks between 7:30am-9:30am and 4:00pm-6:00pm).
house_rules: Check-in is any time after 5:00 pm. If you need to check in earlier, let us know and we can almost always make it work. However, if there's some reason you can't leave by noon and we don't have new guests trying to check in, you're welcome to hang out for longer. We kindly ask that you don't smoke in our home, but you're welcome to smoke in the back yard (and we just ask that you dispose of your cigarette butts). name: Chill Apartment Close to Downtown.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is one of Denver's fastest growing. Right around the corner you can stop into Jefferson Park Pub for a drink with the neighbors, dine at Sarto's Italian Restaurant and upscale menswear themed italian joint, have a cup of coffee from 2914 Coffee & Tea one of the least pretentious coffee houses in the city. If you want to walk a block or two, try The Federal Bar and Grill which has great food and an ever changing selection local draft beer.
transit: You're really close to a bus stop if thats how you like to get about, but really when you're in Denver its all about the bike. There is a public bike hub at 23rd and Clay, just a couple minutes walk away, then you can ride downtown by path and bike lane in about 10 minutes. Of course you can always take an Uber or Lyft anywhere in the city in less than 20 mins.
house_rules: The apartment building is pretty quiet so please no crazy parties. This place is a great spot for 2-3 people to crash after a long day at a beer festival or football game. 420 freindly-ish (be cool about it.)

name: Cozy Bedroom in Congress Park 1
neighborhood_overview: Congress Park is a beautiful neighborhood located on the east side of downtown Denver. Home to many young families and young professionals. The dining scene is wonderful and not quite as crowded as Cap Hill or Downtown you will still find lots of great places to get/drink within walking distance of my place. Congress Park constantly gets voted one of the best places to live in Denver, come experience it!
transit: The bus stop is on the corner of Jackson and 12th, about a 30 second walk from my front door. The route on RTD is Route 10.
house_rules: Not 420 friendly.  Exceptions: recreational smoking off premises and edibles/non-smoking weed. Please no paraphernalia or smoking on property. While pets are allowed, it's up to my discretion if they will be accepted (size/weight/type) You will be required to split the monthly cleaning of the house (first Tuesday of the month for about 2-3 hours around noon) I will request this payment through AirBnB. Please take the recycling and trash out. Trash is every Thursday and located in the back in front of the garage, recycling is every-other Thursday and in the front on the sidewalk. Quiet Hours 10pm - 8am

name: 1BR Luxury Condo in Prime Riverfront Location
neighborhood_overview: Riverfront Park is nestled between Lower Downtown and the Lower Highlands (LoDo and LoHi), and perched atop Confluence Park and Commons Park - the greenest space in Downtown Denver! Easy access to countless bars and restaurants, Union Station and a brand new Whole Foods. A great place to walk and bike.
transit: The building is a 10 to 15 minute walk from the busiest transit hub in the city, Union Station, which has a direct link to Denver International Airport. A single underground parking spot is included. Located on a major city bike path and near a bike-share station.
house_rules: Please respect the neighbors. The building is generally quiet after 10 PM. If you would like to smoke, please do so on the patio with the doors and windows closed.

name: 3rd floor apt in great central location
neighborhood_overview: This is the historic 5 points neighborhood that is one of the hippest upcoming neighborhoods in Denver. It is blocks from the light rail to get around the city. City Park and Downtown are walking distance, and it is right next to the Rino Arts district as well, just minutes walk away. Since this neighborhood was built in the late 1800s and early 1900s, there is a lot of great architecture throughout, so it is nice to just take a stroll around the neighborhood.  With plenty of neighborhood restaurants and bars, you can always find a place to get some food or a drink as well. Please feel free to ask for recommendations or more info about the neighborhood.
transit: As noted, the building is blocks from the lightrail. It is also minutes to I-70 or I-25 so driving to the mountains is convenient.  The airport is less than 30 minutes away. It is close to many bus routes as well and there is a Denver B-cycle station down the street to rent bikes to ride around town.
house_rules: Since there are 3 permanent residents in this building, we would appreciate that you keep in mind that you are not alone here. Since the apartment is on the 3rd floor you are above everyone else, so please keep it quiet during the late hours and early mornings. All of the permanent tenants will pay you the same respect. Make sure to always lock the main door behind you when you come in and leave to help keep the building secure.  Additionally, there is a dog that lives in Unit 2, so make sure to close the gates behind you when entering the property. You can park in the off street parking off of the alley if there is space available. There is plenty of street parking if there is not space in our lot, just make sure to check the signs as it is pretty easy to get a ticket for parking in the wrong place on the wrong day with street sweeping.

Parking is available in front of the house in the circle drive. Uber, Lyft, Car2Go and WayToGo are all available in Denver. Buses to DIA and downtown are within walking distance.

name: Near Airport: Sunny room w/ comfy Queen Bed & HDTV
neighborhood_overview: My nurturing home is in Northeast Park Hill in East Denver.  It is a 5 minute walk to Stapleton town center, with shops, restaurants, a Starbucks, Einstein's Bagels, King Soopers and Walgreens.  There's a Target in a mall with a movie theater ~3 miles away. It's a 21 minute/18.2 mile drive to/from the Denver International airport (DIA) and a 16 minute/5.3 mile drive to the Colorado state capitol, near all the downtown sights.  It is also just an 11 minute drive to Dick's sporting goods center and a short walk to the hotels on Quebec St where conventions are often held and more shops (Walmart, Ross, Home Depot, etc).
transit: Parking is free and generally available right in front of the house. The A-line from DEN airport goes to Central park station, which is a short bus or Uber ride from my house.  The #20 bus stop is a 3 block walk south, at 23rd St.  It goes east to Anschutz Medical campus and west past LoDo.  The #43 bus is a 3 block walk north, at Martin Luther King Blvd, and goes west to downtown and east to the Central Park train station.  The #65 and #73 bus go north/south and are a few blocks to the west or east, respectively. Uber and Lyft are also great options for your visit, if you don't have a car.
house_rules: - The door is set to AUTO-LOCK 30 seconds after it is opened, so please be aware of this. - The front door has a Ring video doorbell home security camera that records when it senses motion in front of the house. -If you bring a pet, please keep your pet in your room and ensure no damage is done to the room by your pet.  Thanks! -Take your shoes off when you enter. - Inside, you may NOT smoke, but you MAY vape. - Outside, you may smoke or vape on the front or back porch (ashtrays are provided). - You may *not* book reservations for a third party because this is an Airbnb rule, unless you bring that person to stay with you as a guest and pay the extra guest fee. Please see this Airbnb help article if you have any questions about that: https://airbnb.com/help/article/427/can-i-book-on-behalf-of-a-friend-or-family-member - Kindly clean up after yourself. - There is a $25 fee to replace a lost room key or keys. Your key is on a keychain with a snap hook so you can hook it onto something. -

name: Quiet, luxurious Denver estate - sleeps 14
neighborhood_overview: The home, located in Congress Park, one of Denver's premier neighborhoods, is South and West facing. The home is always light and bright with an ideal location in close proximity to Congress Park, the Denver Botanic Gardens, Cheesman Park, and the Cherry Creek Shopping District. Beautifully landscaped, this elegant home comes complete with two fireplaces (non-functional), two family rooms, and a sun room. Location, location, location ... and a beautiful home!
transit: There is a garage that fits one small car and driveway that can fit one car or two small cars. There is street parking on 8th Avenue in front of the house specifically designated for our guests. There is also plenty of parking on Steele Street, but we ask guests to utilize the garage, driveway, and spots on 8th first out of courtesy to our neighbors.

Please no early arrivals/late departures without prior approval. There will be a $75 fee for unapproved late check outs.  2) This is a non-smoking home. Any smoking (cigarettes or marijuana) inside of the house will result in loss of your security deposit. name: Serene 2BR House in Heart of Denver. 30+ days only
neighborhood_overview: Jefferson Park is a neighborhood and public park that overlooks Downtown Denver. Nestled between the bustling neighborhoods of downtown Denver, Sloan's lake and Highlands. From Jefferson Park take in Elitch Gardens Theme Park, Sports Authority Field, The Children's Museum, Denver's Downtown Aquarium, Pepsi Center, the REI flagship store and other attractions in Downtown's Central Platte Valley. Downtown Denver and the Central Platte Valley are quickly accessed from Jefferson Park, using the 23rd Avenue overpass on I-25 and Water Street.  Highlands is Denver's latest "it" place to be. This community has been featured in Travel + Leisure Magazine as well as National Geographic Traveler. The 250-acre section northwest of downtown has experienced amazing growth and changes over the past few years, and is overflowing with trendy restaurants, bars, and shops. It is a quick hop off I-70 on your way to or from the mountains.
transit: This house has a walk score of 72 and a bike score of 87! Most residents in this neighborhood bike to/from downtown. There is a b-cycle (bicycle) rental kiosk 1/2 block away. (Website hidden by Airbnb)  This house has offstreet parking for up to 2 cars or an RV. The Light Rail C-Line is located by INVESCO Field at Mile High in the southern part of the neighborhood. Some easy walks/bike rides include: 2 blocks away from Jefferson Park 10 minute walk to Sports Authority Stadium at Mile High, home of the Broncos 10 minute walk to the Denver Acquarium 10 minute walk to Children's museum 10 minute walk to Safeway supermarket 15 minute walk to Cresent Park 15 minute walk to Viking Park 10 minute bike ride / $5 Uber to Highlands bars and restaurants 10 minute bike ride  / $5 Uber to downtown Denver 10 minute bike ride / $5 Uber to Pepsi Center, home of the Avs, Nuggets and major concerts 15 minute bike ride / $8 Uber  to Coors Field, home of the Rockies
house_rules: If you do smoke please step outside. Please be courteous to the neighbors and keep loud noises down to a minimum.  If you'd like to bring a pet, please contact me with details on type and size of the pet! No puppies, kittens or cats.

name: 1890's BRICK COTTAGE & BACKYARD - NEAR DOWNTOWN!
neighborhood_overview: The Baker Historic Neighborhood is the oldest, most unique, and diverse neighborhoods in Denver! Not only is it close to downtown, RTD bus & light rail stations, highways / main transportation corridors; it is also extremely bike and walk friendly... The Bike Score is a 95 and the Walk Score is a 78. If you like to skateboard, it's really flat and great for that too! - Walk or bike a half mile East on 2nd Ave to Broadway (5 bike and 10 minute walk), which is one of my favorite places to explore in Denver. Broadway features many unique restaurants, breweries, boutique shops, and entertainment venues. Check out my Guide Book for more of my recommendations in and around the area! - Safeway grocery store and Walgreens are within a mile (15 minute walk). - Travel 1.5 miles (7 minute drive) North to Downtown Denver where you will find yourself with endless possibilities to stay entertained. The Convention Center, Coors Field, Pepsi Center, Mile High Stadium, State Capitol, Denver Art Museum,
transit: You can pretty much get anywhere around Baker, South Broadway, and Santa Fe Arts District on foot or bike. Baker is very flat and walkable. Below are some other options to get around: - Nearest bus stop @ 2nd & Galapago (half block east)  - Nearest train / rail station - Cherokee and Alameda (.75 miles South) - Uber and Lyft are very active in the area and you can generally have a ride available in under 5 minutes. I typically find a Car2Go (instant car rental) within a block of my house. There is a Denver B-Cycle bike rental station at 1st and Broadway (next to Punch Bowl Social).
house_rules: - CLOSE SKYLIGHT when you leave and if it looks like it could rain or snow. The control pad is next to the thermostat. - Lock all entry doors when you leave. name: Cozy townhome in RiNo. Minutes to top local spots!
neighborhood_overview: The River North Art District "where art is made" goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for visitors. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars, restaurants, brewpubs, art galleries and working studios. RiNo boasts a diverse mix of creative businesses ranging from visual artists, designers and furniture makers, to craft distillers and brewers, winemakers, creators of unique outdoor gear and small-batch coffee roasters. The art definitely extends beyond gallery walls in this neighborhood, with its colorful and innovative street art murals in alleys and on buildings around almost every corner! See the map to start exploring Denver's RiNo Art District now. Larimer Row is in the prime transit oriented location just blocks from the 35/36th Pedestria
transit: From the airport: Uber/Lyft - ~$25 ride to the Townhome Public Transportation - $9 a person. A line Train from the West/International exit to the 38th and Blake, then the walk is about 7 minutes (.3 miles). Rent a car - Free parking and Garage Parking. Light rail station is minutes away: Larimer Row is in the prime transit oriented location just blocks from the 35/36th Pedestrian Bridge and the Commuter Rail Station - access to Union Station and DIA.   There are tons of restaurants you are near and walking distance to.  Populist  Fish and beer Hop alley Denver central market  Dio Mio Shake shack, open 3/21/2018(9 minute walk) Breweries less than a mile away.   Epic  Great divide Ratio Blackbird Winery Monkey theorem Nails treatment.   (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Book a reservation as a Airbnb guest and get 15% off!!

name: Amazing location! across Avanti, walk Coors Field
neighborhood_overview: Perfect for the traveling executive, the family vacation or friends gathering for golf or ski!   If you are visiting for business, mountain adventures, taking in city scenes, nightlife and great restaurants, enjoying a sports or concert or participating in craft brewery or 420 tours, this direct central Lower Highlands (LoHi) home is precisely where you will want to be!      Located in the Highlands, it is Denver's hippest place to be.  It is a charming neighborhood overflowing with trendy restaurants, breweries, bars and boutique shops.  The neighborhood is filled with small family-owned restaurants specializing in regional cuisines from Italy, Mexico, Peru, and Argentina.  This community has been featured in Travel + Leisure Magazine as well as National Geographic Traveler.    Things to do in Denver include visiting world-class museums, attending sporting events, or enjoying Denver's renowned parks and recreations.  The Mile High City has over 360 days of sunshine each year and one o
transit: You don't need a car to get around, besides high walk-ability from home, there is a Bike Rental Station in the park across the street as well as prime location for picking up a Car-To-Go.  Uber and Lift are also active in this Highlands location.   If want to get out of the city to enjoy our beautiful Rocky Mountains for hiking, fishing, skiing, biking, etc.  the I-70 expressway, is less than 5 minutes from house location.  Major ski resorts - Eldora 40 minutes, Loveland 55mins, Keystone 1hr, Breckenridge 1hr10mins, Vail 1hr30mins. Many more, you choose!   Blackhawk Casinos are 1hr. All make for an easy day trip so you can stay in Denver and not have to pay resort pricing.

neighborhood_overview: Denver's oldest neighborhood, Curtis Park is nestled in RINO with craft breweries (Odell, Epic, Ratio, Crooked Stave, Spangalang, Our Mutual Friend, Beryl's, Black Shirt, Great Divide, Stem Cider, just to name a few), Denver's best restaurants (Uchi, Hop Alley, Fish & Beer, The Populist, Work & Class, OwlBear Barbecue, Acorn, Rosenberg Bagels, etc) and mega-hip shared marketplaces (The Source & Denver's Central Market) - all in walking distance (minimum 3 blocks away). About one mile to Denver's 16th Street Mall, Union Station, Coors Field, and easy public transport to Mile High Stadium.  One block from Curtis Park with public outdoor pool open Jun-Aug - $3 entrance!
transit: 1/2 block to light-rail, 1/2 mile to A-line to DIA (and Union) and near to B-Cycle (public bikes). LYFT/UBER to downtown under $5, to DIA for about $25. Walking distance to craft breweries and restaurants on Welton and Larimer. Easy access to I-70 & I-25 - 25mins to South Boulder, 30mins to Morrison/Golden, 60mins to Silverthorne (ski areas). Perfect for getting around by public transportation only, but also street parking is available.  NOTE: The street parking in our neighborhood is zoned for 2 hour on weekdays  from 8a-6p, excluding holidays and weekends. We do not have off-street parking. We DO have one guest pass for one vehicle that can be parked in front of our house at any and all times.
house_rules: Be mindful of noise and considerate of neighbors, so reasonable quiet hours requested. Please no pets, large gatherings, or smoking in the house.

name: Charming Denver Bungalow
neighborhood_overview: We love our location in Denver. It's near tons of breweries, a short walk to Old South Pearl (Sushi Den, Park Burger and Steam Coffee shop are our favorites), down the street from DU, and a 2 minute drive (7 minute walk) from the Evans Street Light Rail which gets us to all the main things we want to see in Denver (LoDo, Performing Arts Center, Union Station, Sports Authority Field / Mile High, Pepsi Center, Coors Field). It's also 1 block off Harvard Gulch Park (it's large but quiet, which we love and has a 9-hole golf course, outdoor pool, rec center).
transit: As mentioned above we are a 2 minute drive (7 minute walk) from the Evans Street Light Rail which gets us to all the main things we want to see in Denver (LoDo, Performing Arts Center, Union Station, Sports Authority Field / Mile High, Pepsi Center, Coors Field).  Parking on our street is abundant (so even amateur parallel parkers can leave their worry at home :-).

name: Modern Luxury 5 min. from Downtown!
neighborhood_overview: Jefferson Park is conveniently located just 5 minutes from Downtown Denver with easy access to I-25. Walk to the Broncos stadium, the Aquarium and numerous other downtown attractions. The neighborhood has recently seen a huge surge in new construction development bringing in more and more restaurants and shops. The most recent retail development is located at 25th and Eliot and showcases one of Denver's best new restaurants called Sartos. This Italian style eatery is all the buzz featuring homemade pastas and pastries.  Other notable neighborhood restaurants include our Louisiana favorite, Sassafras. This creole-style cafe features beignet, homemade jellies, gumbo, fried green tomatoes and any other southern comfort food concoction you can think of.  Other businesses have recently opened including Briar Commons Restaurant, Amass Restaurant, Sexy Pizza and Jefferson Park Pub. name: Curtis Park Charmer- blocks from RiNo

Curtis Park & pool are a few short blocks away as well. We are also a 1 0-15 minute walk to Coors Field and a short car ride / Uber  to Union Station, Convention Center, Pepsi Center, and Mile High Stadium.
transit: There is ample street parking and the light rail is within walking distance. Short walk to a B-cycle (public bicycles). A short Uber ride to most places in Denver. I-25 and I-70 are a short drive away.
