name: Sweet twin room in vintage W Highlands
neighborhood_overview: My house in the Ghost Historic District is just 2 blocks away from the center of West Highlands where there are numerous bars, restaurants, local shops and book stores. Access to more than a hundred miles of bike paths is maybe 3/4 miles away.
transit: There's a bus stop that goes to LoHi, another hip newer neighborhood with many restaurants and bars and then goes within walking distance of the Auraria campus, LODO and the rest of downtown. It's also easy to bike around. And then, f course, there's Lyft and Uber to get around town. We're on the west side of Denver so have easy access to the mountains - but you really need a car to get to ski areas and mountain trails and towns. There's an Enterprise rental car place 6 blocks away that is easy to rent from for the day or longer.
house_rules: My general attitude is - do unto others. ...I would ask you to use coasters to protect furniture and clean up after yourselves in parts of the house other than your bedroom. And to just be considerate of others. Guests must have my permission to invite anyone into my home.  It is never appropriate to bring home guests late at night, that you've just met. No guns or weapons anywhere on the property. You may smoke marijuana or tobacco on my front porch or in the backyard - please just be discrete and use an ashtray. No firearms in the house. And, sorry to be so harsh, but I can only get 2 guest parking passes every 2 years so will charge $150 for unreturned parking passes.  Enjoy!

name: Cozy and the Living's Easy
neighborhood_overview: University Hills is a calm and peaceful neighborhood. We are one block away from the Highline Canal Trail, which is a 71-mile long walking, running and biking trail that extends all throughout the Denver area. Several public transportation options are conveniently located nearby, including the light rail, making it easy for our guests to get around Denver with or without a car. Our house is about 15 minutes south of downtown, and we're near the University of Denver and the Denver Tech Center.
transit: We are at the crux of three of Denver’s main roads used to get around and out of Denver (I-25, I-225 and Hampden Ave [US 285]), and we're less than a 15-minute walk from the Yale light rail station. All of which provide quick access to downtown, the mountains and the airport. Uber and Lyft provide another inexpensive option for our guests to get around the city (typically ~$16 from our house to downtown).
house_rules: The most important for us, is having a clean house. We both work normal 8-5 jobs so getting a good nights sleep during the week is important. Weekends, we'd like guests to treat the home as if it were their own and be respectful. We keep our house tidy and we appreciate our guests to clean up after themselves as well.  1. No smoking in the house. 2. If anything is broken or breaks during your visit, please let us know and we'll work to fix it. 3. Please DO NOT dispose of feminine products in the toilet. 4. Our washer/dryer is a high-efficiency model so it requires special detergent. Please use the detergent that we have and ask us on how much to use, cause you don't need a lot of detergent!  5. Please do NOT use dryer sheets in the dryer. They zap the high efficiency model sensors and can start a fire in the vents. 6. Please remember to lock/close the doors on your way out. name: Cozy home in historic Baker
neighborhood_overview: Baker is the best down-to-earth neighborhood in Denver! Quiet and safe, it's close to incredible food, all kinds of nightlife, Denver's impressive array of art museums and galleries, parks and it's growing network of bike trails and burgeoning local craft food and beverage scene. We provide a notebook full of menus, options and ideas.
transit: Proximity to 6th and 8th Avenues makes getting around and out of town quick with easy access to I-25, I-70 and Speer Blvd - it's a straight shot to the mountains and the airport. Parking is readily available in front of the house and on nearby streets, just make sure you pay attention to the signs - alternate sides of the street are no-parking for cleaning on the first Thursday/Friday of the month. For those without cars, regular buses run downtown on Galapago Street and Broadway, and you can catch the light rail at 10th and Osage or the Alameda Station at Alameda and Cherokee. You also can get around town with Car2Go.
house_rules: City streets are yucky and shoes/boots can get dirty after a day of being outdoors. Please do not wear shoes in the house. Flip-flops, slippers - anything that stays indoors - are welcome. Yes, we live in the Mile "High" City but there is no smoking (of any kind) in the house.  Given the close proximity of our great neighbors, please be respectful in terms of noise, especially late at night and early in the morning.

name: Cozy 2 BR in Sloan's Lake/Highlands
neighborhood_overview: Sloan's Lake/Highlands is an awesome part of Denver! Within biking distance there are numerous breweries, coffee shops, cafes, restaurants with a wide array of cuisines, boutiques, grocery and liquor stores, and recreation trails. Broncos Stadium is just 1.5 miles away. 3 blocks away, Sloan's Lake, surrounded by a 3 mile walking/biking trail, boasts a beautiful view of the Rockies from the east side, and a skyline view of the city from the west. Walk down to catch the sunset behind the mountains! We will leave you a list of our favorite spots to eat, drink, and play.
transit: There is plenty of free street parking on our block (note street sweeping signs that affect parking one day per month). RTD buses 16 and 28B have stops within a 15 minute walk that will take you to other parts of the Highlands, LoHi, and downtown with no transfers. However, having a car or bike is definitely best for transportation in this neighborhood. Uber is another easy transportation option with cars available for pickup within 10 minutes almost all times of day.
house_rules: 1. remove shoes upon entry  2. no smoking cigarettes inside (420 okay) 3. use care in your use of all amenities, appliances, and furniture 4. be respectful of neighbors 5. Three people maximum; if you arrive with more in your party we can not accommodate you and will not offer a refund  Please be sure you're cool with these things before booking: 1. apartment is in the basement of our home so you will likely hear muffled voices/footsteps from the rest of the house 2. ceilings may be too low for folks above 6"1' 3. there is no TV

name: CannaBLISS at Denver's Green Mile!
neighborhood_overview: The Green Mile is a uniquely hip neighborhood with lots of things to do right along S. Broadway  (much within walking distance) - shop (for pot, antiques, vintage clothes, a used car), eat (to satisfy every taste: Eat, eat, and eat some more), take public transportation to downtown Denver (10 minutes away), walk to the park AND golf course. This is really a fun and unusual neighborhood!
transit: Even though, there's free on-street parking, you really don't need a car. Public transportation is steps away. There's lots to do and see within walking distance. There's a car rental office just down the street in case you want to take a day, or overnight, trip to the mountains.
house_rules: Cannabis smoking is fine indoors. Cigarette, cigar or any other tobacco smoking is absolutely NOT allowed inside. In terms of smoking pot, we do NOT allow blunts or any other rolling paper or wrappers containing tobacco to be smoked indoors. Only joints made with non-tobacco rolling papers may be smoked indoors. A $150 will be charged if there is any tobacco-related smoking inside the apartment. Pets are not allowed. $250 will be charged if there is any evidence that a pet has been in the apartment.

name: Private Space in Trendy Hood
neighborhood_overview: Historically, The Highlands had been home to a cultural mix of migrant populations. Today, The Highlands maintains it's diversity bursting with unique art galleries, tiny theaters, award-winning restaurants, clothing boutiques, and craft breweries. Among million dollar townhomes and 1900's houses, you'll find pockets of mixed-use areas with favorite neighborhood coffee joints and chi-flowing yoga studios.  New restaurants and breweries continue to hang their signs on old converted buildings or modern, new store fronts. I would love to share my favorite best-kept secret spots with you!

STORING BAGS: Before asking to drop your bags off early or keep them at the property late, please keep in mind that there is one key for guests. name: Private Floor with Space and Comfort
neighborhood_overview: Clayton is the right combo of relatively close to downtown and convenient to major highways. It's all single family residences in the immediate neighborhood and it's a quiet block. We recommend having a car while you stay here- but guests have made it work with only public transportation.
transit: Plenty of on-street parking if you have a car. A $6-10 uber ride to many shopping/dining areas. We are a 10-15 minute walk from the lightrail station at 40th and Colorado. This can take you to the airport and Union Station.
house_rules: Please treat our space as you would your own home. No smoking inside... backyard smoking is fine but clean up after yourself. No overnight guests who aren't on the reservation. If you'd like to have friends over to visit, give us a heads up about it. Because we have two dogs, no other pets are allowed.

name: Lovely 2BR+ in ReVisioned Church, pet friendly
neighborhood_overview: Historic Park Hill is due east of City Park and Downtown, and boasts several acclaimed neighborhood bistros (tables, cherry tomato, Desmond's, and bistro barber--voted top 10 new Denver restaurants in 2015), great coffee shops/bakeries (cake crumbs and Spinellis), an italian market (Spinellis) and gourmet specialty market (Marczyks), a terrific wine store (Grape Expectations), a bike shop (Bike Depot), yoga studios, multiple pocket parks and adjacent to Denver's largest park-City Park. Enjoy walking along Park Hill's tree lined streets, filled with beautiful historic homes built from the late 1800s into the mid-century! Park Hill has a rich history of grass roots activism-both on local issues and national issues.  Park Hill is close to dozens of amazing restaurants, several music venues (Ogden, Bluebird, Fillmore), and so many great historic urban Denver neighborhoods...too many to introduce. Ask!
transit: Please ask me about whether renting a car makes sense, as if you intend to stay in Park Hill/City Park/Downtown corridor, a rental car is not necessary.  The apt is on numerous public transit lines, including A train that runs from Denver International Airport to downtown Denver with two stops adjacent to Park Hill.  A $5-12 uber/lyft ride gets you from the apt to pretty much anywhere in downtown Denver.  In addition to the A train, we are 1/2 block from the #43 (to downtown) and a short walk to the #20 (to downtown and Fitzimmons). Lots of parks, restaurants, pubs, coffee, wine, flower shops within short walk. Downtown is an easy direct bike ride, under 4 miles downhill with good bike lanes! Great for cycling, we hope to bring on cruisers for guests before long. Denver's B-cycle shared bike program has a station at East edge of City Park, abutting Park Hill.
house_rules: Be safe, be kind, be appropriate.  At the end of your stay, please place any used towels and spa bathrobes in laundry basket, and txt to let us know you have departed. No smoking in the apartment, but we do have a nice area outside the immediate entrance to the apartment for smokers.  This isn't the best place if your plan is to have loud on-site parties.

name: Cozy, updated 3 bedroom home, with great backyard!
neighborhood_overview: Barnum is a fairly quiet, residential neighborhood. Past guests have found the location to be a great jumping off point to see the rest of Denver, but not for an abundance of restaurants, bars, and city life outside the front door. However there are a few gems within walking distance from the house. Within 3 blocks you'll find: a library, an ice cream shop, a Mexican bakery (the best breakfast burritos!), a hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant (so good and cheap!), a small market, and of course 7-Eleven. Within 3 miles, you can find the best Mexican and Vietnamese food Denver has to offer. We'd be happy to point you towards our favorites. Wit's End Brewery is also close to the house. They serve up some delicious award winning brews. If you enjoy running or going for a walk, Barnum Park is just up the road. There you'll find great views of downtown, nice open spaces and a swimming pool.
transit: A direct bus to downtown stops less than a block from the house (20min ride). The same bus also gets you within a 10min walk to the Broncos stadium if you're in town for a game. A Lyft  or Uber to downtown or South Broadway (great restaurants and bars) is usually between $8 and $15 depending on when you go. If you have your own transportation, the house is: 10-15mins to downtown, 35-45mins to the airport, 20mins to the foothills and Red Rocks, and 1hr to the closest ski area. Being only a few blocks from 6th Avenue and on the west side of Denver, we have quick and easy access to all the mountains have to offer.
house_rules: We just ask that you treat our home with respect and cleanup after yourselves. We don't mind if you smoke whatever it is you like to smoke as long as it's on our comfortable patio or deck. Unfortunately we stopped  allowing marijuana to be smoked in the house due to previous guests taking it too far.  Come and go as you'd like, just please remember to lock both the side door and front door.  The hot tub is not for guest use.  Lastly, please honor the 11am check-out time unless you've arranged a later check-out. This gives us plenty of time to get the room ready for the next guest. Thanks!

name: Best Location in Denver: 7th Ave Historic District
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in one of the most desirable zip codes in Denver. We are five blocks away from the North Cherry Creek Shopping District (Cherry Creek Arts Festival JULY 6-8) where you will find wonderful boutique stores, Whole Foods, the Cherry Creek Shopping Mall and delicious eateries such as: Hillstone, Blue Island Oyster Bar, Hapa Sushi, Margs Taco Bistro, Paxi's Pizza,  The Cherry Cricket, Crepes n Crepes, and True Food among others.  Five blocks north of our home you'll find the beautiful Botanical Gardens and beyond the gardens the Denver Zoo and Denver's Museum of Nature and Science.  In that same neighborhood, you will find a number of bars, restaurants, music venues and boutique stores lining Colfax Avenue. If you want to enjoy Denver's night life and more delicious restaurants we are a 15 minute drive from Larimer Square, Lodo, RiNo and Broadway.
transit: Our home is located one block from a major bus route.
house_rules: The 7th Avenue Historic District is a family centered neighborhood so we would ask that you respect our neighbors by maintaining appropriate noise levels in the evening hours (especially after 9:00 PM). Our home is a non-smoking environment.  We welcome trained and well-behaved dogs. We would ask that you respect our pet rules - which include no dogs on the furniture.

name: Spacious Stapleton Townhome
neighborhood_overview: The townhouse is an easy and enjoyable walk to Stapleton town center. There are restaurants and shops, parks, play-grounds and pools. Stapleton is full of families, so enjoy walking around the neighborhood and saying "hi" to all of the friendly neighbors.
transit: The home is close to the Central Park Station in Stapleton. The light rail, A Train from the airport, opened in late April 2016, and buses are available to get anywhere in the area. I also use Uber regularly, as a cost effective and fast method of transport.
house_rules: You are welcome to use anything in our home, as we are glad to be able to share what we have with our guests. Please keep in mind that this is our personal home.  We don't have many rules, but one we take seriously is: there is absolutely no smoking in the home.  We come from the midwest, where typically people remove their shoes as they enter the home. Although this isn't a rule, you can be comfortable walking around the house in your socks or bare feet, as we do.

name: Bright & original in the Highlands
neighborhood_overview: The Highlands, or more specifically Highlands Square is a really fun neighborhood in Denver. It is less than ten minutes away from Downtown, yet feels like a small village. On our street, literally 5 minutes walk away, there is a whole area with cafés, restaurants, bars, breweries, shops and other small businesses that are ideal to wander around. It is also really easy to park around our house, so if you come with a car that will not be a problem.
transit: Free street parking!
house_rules: Common sense, really: we recycle and compost, the bins are in the side yard (picked up every monday), and the trash is in the back alley. All the open food that you will find is yours to use (mustard, jams, sugar, etc...) but we will empty some spaces in the kitchen so you can dispose of it as you wish. The neighborhood is very safe, so no extra need for security apart from locking the doors when you leave.

name: Cozy apartment in a great central location
neighborhood_overview: This is the historic 5 points neighborhood and adjacent to the Rino Arts district that is one of the hippest upcoming neighborhoods in Denver. It is blocks from the light rail to get around the city. City Park and Downtown are walking distance (roughly 2 miles to the center of downtown, but less than a half mile to many bar brewery and restaurant options). Since this neighborhood was built in the late 1800s and early 1900s, there is a lot of great architecture throughout, so it is nice to just take a stroll around the neighborhood.  With plenty of neighborhood restaurants and bars, you can always find a place to get some food or a drink as well. Please feel free to ask for recommendations or more info about the neighborhood.
transit: As noted, the building is blocks from the lightrail and the airport light rail station is 1 mile from the house. It is also minutes to I-70 or I-25 so driving to the mountains is convenient.  The airport is less than 30 minutes away. It is close to many bus routes as well and there is a Denver B-cycle station down the street to rent bikes to ride around town.
house_rules: Since there are 3 permanent residents in this building, we would appreciate that you keep in mind that you are not alone here. Since the apartment is below two of the permanent resident please keep quiet during the late hours and early mornings.

neighborhood_overview: This location is at a wonderful crossroads, just next to downtown (outside of major traffic), just north of Capitol Hill and Uptown, just west of City Park and just south of RiNo and Five Points. You can literally head in any direction and find something fabulous, but enjoy a peaceful residential setting. We live less than a mile from some of the best shopping, dining, breweries, and dispensaries Denver has to offer.

Also, there is a B-Cycle station (rental bikes) located just across the street.

You may NOT bring friends or other people back to this space to party or smoke, the space is only for your use.

name: Tiny private room/crash pad for rent
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the best, hottest neighborhoods in Denver. Very safe. You can walk around at 3 in the morning and it should be fine.  1. Within walking distances are MEZCAL (mexican restaurant), GOOSETOWN TAVERN, CEREBRAL BREWERY, THE COFFEE as you walk towards downtown (going West) on Colfax. Colfax is one block from my house going North. Sprouts is 1 block north of my house on Colfax. 2. There are TRADER JOES, INDIAN, THAI, KOREAN restaurants going south on Colorado Blvd. Go east from my house and turn right on Colorado blvd. Go four blocks south and all restaurants should be there. 3. Going east on Colfax are some good Ehiopean resturant, Subway. 4. Museum/City Park/Denver Zoo  is 10 block walk away. Capital hill/Civic Center/16th street mall is 5 min drive.
transit: My place is 1 block from bus stop. Bus 15 or 15L go towards Downtown Denver every 10 or 15 minutes. After 10 PM, I believe they run every 30 minutes. However they run till 3 AM in the morning. Day pass is 5.20 for local and 9 dollars for regional. With regional, you can catch light rails anywhere rails go to.  RTD denver runs the bus system in Denver. 6 minutes uber ride to most things to central of downtown. My place is 25 to 30 min drive from Airport. 5 to 8 minutes from civic center/convention center

name: NW Highlands COZY CUTE AND SPACIOUS garden suite
neighborhood_overview: Victorian-era homes and brick bungalows; lush gardens and parks; hip independently owned shops; art galleries; and restaurants, all make the Denver Highlands neighborhood a great destination for visitors. There are three diverse districts to discover here: Highlands Square, Tennyson Street and Lower Highland (LoHi). Boutiques, wine shops and bookstores, as well as popular restaurants and bars radiate out from Highland Square on West 32nd Avenue and Lowell Boulevard. And, in the Tennyson Street Cultural District, you can spend an afternoon browsing antique prints, photographs and paintings from Colorado artists, plus find live music venues and great ethnic foods. LoHi is characterized by a mix of old and ultra-modern architecture, some of the city's most innovative restaurants and bars, and incredible views of the Highland Bridge and downtown Denver. They are all a 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk away.

name: Modern Townhouse 1600 sqft 2bd/2ba
neighborhood_overview: Property is one mile off I-25 and Hampden Avenue, about a 15 minute drive from downtown Denver, and a 1 mile walk or drive to the Southmoor light rail stop.  You can walk to Whole Foods Tamarac in about 10 minutes.  I am on the edge of the Denver Tech Center too.  Despite the proximity to lots of great stuff, this area is old with naturally wooded green spaces.  It's possible to see owls while walking to one of the largest movie theater screens in our state in the same evening.  It's the best mixture of old and new.  It's a great launching point for all kinds of adventures. I have recently realized that we have two of the best places to get a deli sandwich in the country within walking distance.  Hit me up if you love a big, delicious sandwich.
transit: There is ample, safe street parking one city block from my front door, and I can arrange a garage spot connected to my house with advance notice.  You are one mile, easily walkable, to the Southmoor light rail station.  If you are flying in and do not have a car, take the AT bus to Nine Mile Station and then Uber or Lyft from there for a cheap and fast experience.  If you have any questions about getting around let me know, I have the answers.  An UberX direct from the airport costs about $40.

Maximum 3 renters. No smoking, no pets. Summer Air Conditioning usage: limit cooling to 76 degrees during day and 74 at night.  Open the windows and screened doors at night for even cooler temps.  This is a cost issue, cooler temperatures are available upon request for an extra fee. Garage door must be closed at all times when not in garage, be careful to make sure it closes every time you arrive and leave.  This is for your safety and security as well as the security of my belongings in the garage. neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Denver and the Lower Highlands (LoHi) neighborhood. Take an Uber, rent a BCycle, or just stroll down Tejon to the 16th St Mall.
transit: The town-home is located at 3342 Tejon St. in the Lower Highlands (LoHi) neighborhood. The major cross streets are 34th and Tejon. Walking Left out the front door, it is an easy walk down Tejon St. into Denver, through Riverfront Park, across the Platte River, to the 16th St. Walking Mall and Union Station. Driving Take I-25 to 20th St., Exit 212C.  Turn right off exit ramp onto 20th St Immediately turn right onto Osage St Turn left to stay on Osage St Turn left onto W 33rd Ave Turn right onto Tejon St Bus Stop Bus #44 stops at Tejon St & W 34th Ave Take Bus 44 towards Airport - 40th PnR for 7 stops (6 min) to 15th St & Wynkoop St Head northeast up Wynkoop two blocks to Union Station B-Cycle There is a B-Cycle (bike sharing) station two blocks down Tejon St at 17th. st., just past 32nd Ave.

name: Awesome location in boho cottage in The Highlands!
neighborhood_overview: Copy and pasted from an article written in 2014 and doesn't cover even half there is to do now. The neighborhood has changed so much  :)    This small neighborhood—a mere 1.1-mile square cut-out on a map—is brimming with some of Denver’s most interesting nooks and crannies.  Main Drag: The length of 32nd Avenue is stacked with local eateries, boutiques, and specialty shops as well as Tennyson Street from 38th to 42nd.  Stroll: Conquer 32nd Avenue’s brick-and-mortars on foot, starting at Irving Street and heading west. Each boutique and artisan shop on this stretch offers something unique to relish, whether you’re on the hunt for last-minute gifts or ingredients for dinner (more on that below). Start your window-shopping by perusing West Side Book’s eclectic collection of new and used tomes (they even have a banned books section). Then wander into the Perfect Petal, part lauded floral shop, part boutique, and one-stop shop for envy-worthy gifts. When you need a break, stop by Highlands
transit: You can park on the street very easily. There is a bus route within walking distance and uber and lyfts are easy to book all the time.

name: 3-bdrm, pot-friendly! Best (Green Mile) location!
neighborhood_overview: The Green Mile along S. Broadway is the go-to neighborhood if you're over 21 years old and coming to Denver to participate in legal marijuana.
transit: You definitely don't need a car here (there's lots of public transportation right outside the door and a car rental place down the street in case you want to take some day trips), but if you do bring a car, there's off-street parking.  Lots of dispensaries are within easy walking distance, as are lots of restaurants (including all the fast food places and even the ganja cafe that prepares pot-infused meals). There's even a park and a 9-hole golf course a few blocks away!
house_rules: Cannabis smoking is fine indoors. Cigarette, cigar or any other tobacco smoking is absolutely NOT allowed inside. A $150 will be charged if there is any tobacco-related smoking inside the apartment. Pets are not allowed. $250 will be charged if there is any evidence that a pet has been in the apartment.

name: Denver's Urban Oasis + Hot Tub
neighborhood_overview: Jefferson Park is a fantastic neighborhood -- a safe one, with lots of history as well as brand new development. Within just a few blocks you'll find excellent dining, including Sarto's, Sassafras, Briar Commons, Jefferson Park Pub, and Sexy Pizza. It's a short walk to Broncos games at Sports Authority Field. Great Denver attractions like the Downtown Aquarium, Children's Museum, and Jefferson and Confluence Parks are also easily reached on foot. There's a major grocery store (with super cheap gas station) just two blocks away, and a major rental car agency just one block away. Super easy access to I-25 and I-70, too! Further afoot, a longer walk or fun bike ride gets you into downtown Denver, LoHi, the Highlands, West Highlands, or the CU Denver/Metro State campus.
transit: Getting around town during your stay will be easy. Both UBER and LYFT cars are always nearby. Easily walk to bus lines #28 and #31. Within three blocks you'll find a Denver B-Cycle bike station. Union Station, with access to light rail trains, is very close. And if you have a car, parking is easy, close, and free. Visiting the mountains? They're close by - about 20 minutes. The nearest major ski resorts, Echo Mountain and Winter Park, are 52 minutes and 90 minutes from my place, respectively.
house_rules: And now for the policies of the house: -Absolutely no smoking or drugs -There is a $500 fee for violation of the above rule -No pets -No candles -Please consider nearby neighbors after 11PM -Do not put knives in dishwasher - hand wash only -Do not flush anything down a toilet besides toilet paper -Alert me immediately of any maintenance concerns -Alert me immediately should anything become broken or damaged -Do not share door or alarm codes with others.  -My house is not safely prepped for little children -Do not place any items (luggage, food, drink, etc.) on the pinball game -Lost parking pass incurs as $75 fee Upon departure, taking out the trash and starting wash on dishes and used towels is appreciated.  Please, treat my home with kindness, as if it were your own. Thank you very much!

name: Brand new studio in Capitol Hill
neighborhood_overview: Capital Hill is an amazing neighborhood!  We hardly ever drive due to the fact that we have so many walkable options combined with an amazing public transportation system.  We have several restaurants, bars, dispensaries, grocery stores, and music venues within blocks of our home.
transit: Free parking is available on the street. Spots are readily available before 5:30 or 6 on weeknights but can become more difficult to find once people get home from work. On weekends parking is more widely available and there's also the option to park in the school lot directly across the street. Ubers and Lyfts are never more than a few minutes away so we recommend that on weeknights. There's no need to rent a car if you plan to stick around the city! Easy 15 minute walk to Civic Center Station, then jump on the free 16th street mall shuttle to get anywhere downtown for free! RTD bus stop 1 block away.
house_rules: All guests must be over 21. No smoking of tobacco on any part of the property.   Please be courteous about cleanliness and noise control. Please prevent tracking rain or snow on the carpet by keeping shoes on the provided mat. No pets.

name: Charming carriage house
neighborhood_overview: This stay is perfect for the individual or couple in the city for business, interviews, or to visit the area. Denver is a growing, thriving city, and our area is popular with young families, longtime residents, and friendly, creative professionals.  We are located in a quiet part of central Denver, less than one block from beautiful Alamo Placita Park.  To the south: The Cherry Creek bike path and Speer Boulevard (one of Denver’s main thoroughfares) are one block away. Lovely Washington Park is an easy, 2-mile bike ride in this direction, not far from hipster-friendly S. Broadway. To the north: Lots of cute shops, coffee spots, and restaurants within 2-4 blocks; the Denver Botanic Gardens and Cheeseman Park are a longer (but very pretty) 1.5 miles away. To the east: Full-sized supermarket (Safeway) is a five-minute, 2-block walk; the popular shops of Cherry Creek are also 1.5 miles in this direction. To the west: The state capitol, as well as the bars and nightlife of Capitol Hill and
transit: There are lots of cool things to do within an easy bike ride, and bikes are easy to rent using Denver’s B-Cycle stations. Parking is easy in our neighborhood but can be a little tricky in Capitol Hill and downtown, depending on the time of day. Denver has a decent public transportation system, called RTD; the RTD website gives schedules and fares for buses and light rail lines. There's also Lyft and Uber, of course.
house_rules: While we want guests to feel absolutely at home we also ask: 1. Please, no smoking anywhere on the property, inside or out. This includes both tobacco and marijuana. 2. Maintain a peaceful environment (no parties, loud music, etc.). 3. No pets or animals. 4. Be kind and respectful toward our neighbors.  Feel free to say hi! 5. Leave the apartment tidy (though we'll take care of the linens).

name: Modern Home in the Art District
neighborhood_overview: Located in Denver's Art District and the trendy Baker neighborhood just South of downtown. Every first Friday of the month this neighborhood transforms into the most happening place in town for the art walk on Santa Fe featuring food trucks, entertainment, and of course art. Two blocks away from the most authentic Mexican restaurant in town - El Taco de Mexico. Other recommendations just a few blocks away on Santa Fe are Swifts for breakfast, Arada for Ethiopian Cuisine, iSushi for Japanese, Interstate Kitchen for comfort food, and Renegade Brewing for Colorado Craft Beer. Just a bit further are endless options downtown and on Broadway.
transit: Free street parking available right outside the front door (please read signs for monthly street sweeping to avoid ticket) or off-street parking in the back. Bus station right around the corner. Two blocks to restaurants, bars and shops on Santa Fe. 15 minute walk to the 10th and Osage light rail station to take you anywhere in Denver, including the airport. 15 minute walk to restaurants, bars and shops on Broadway. 30 minute walk to the convention center downtown and 16th street mall. Easy access to I-25. Car2Go, Lyft and Uber are also great options for getting around.
house_rules: Check-in: 3pm | Check-out: 11am. No pets. No smoking of any kind inside. Smoking 420 is OK outside on the patio. Because the house needs to be cleaned between 11am-3pm, I cannot accommodate early checkin or late checkouts. However you can drop off your bags as early as 11:30am prior to checkin. Be respectful, considerate and kind.

name: Spacious 2 BR in Gorgeous Park Hill
neighborhood_overview: Right off the beautiful 17th Avenue Parkway, South Park Hill strikes the perfect balance: a gorgeous tree lined neighborhood that's only blocks from the bars and restaurants of East Colfax, and just 3 miles from downtown. Soak up everything Denver has to offer, knowing you have a little oasis to come back to when you're ready to call it a day.
transit: South Park Hill is supremely walkable, with restaurants, bars, and music venues only 5-15 minutes away on foot.  The Museum of Nature and Science and the Denver Zoo are also only about a 15 and 20 minute walk respectively.  If you're renting a car, there's a designated space for you at the house, and most neighborhoods have either street or easy-to-find metered parking.  Lyft and Uber are great options if you want to explore other parts of town without having to worry about your car. You can use these links for ride credits if you're a 1st-time user:  (URL HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN) Getting around by bus is also a breeze; the Colfax stop is a short 5 minute walk and can shoot you downtown in about 20 minutes for only $3.
house_rules: NO SHOES IN THE CARPETED BASEMENT Please remove your shoes once you enter the property. There is a boot tray to the left of the entryway. A carpet cleaning fee may be assessed if shoes are worn downstairs. NO PARTIES  This is not a party house. You're of course welcome (and encouraged!) to enjoy yourselves, but please be mindful of the neighbors later in the evening and remember that there is a full-time resident living in the unit above. Thank you!   NO SMOKING No smoking in the house whatsoever. The security deposit *will* be assessed if you smoke inside. ***If you smoke outside, please don't throw butts on the patio or in the alley; dispose of them in an outside trashcan.

name: Lg Light Bsmnt in charming home in W Highlands
neighborhood_overview: My house in the Ghost Historic District is just 2 blocks away from the center of West Highlands where there are numerous bars, restaurants, local shops and book stores. Access to more than a hundred miles of bike paths is maybe 3/4 miles away. Terrific area for running, biking and roller blading.
transit: There's a bus stop that goes to LoHi, another hip newer neighborhood with many restaurants and bars and then goes within walking distance of the Auraria campus, LODO and the rest of downtown. Downtown is maybe 2 miles away - an easy drive or bike ride. I25, Speer and Federal are all within a mile or less. I70 is about 2 miles away. Easy access to Auraria and Regis campuses.  If you don't have a Lyft app, I can give you one for places and times that are less convenient for public transportation. We are on the west side of downtown, so mountains and skiing are easy to get to. However, you really need to have a car to get to the high mountains. There's an Enterprise Rental Car about a half mile away that provides easy access to a car. Boulder and Golden are easily accessible by bus.
house_rules: My general attitude is - do unto others. ...I would ask you to use coasters to protect furniture and clean up after yourselves in parts of the house other than your bedroom. And to just be considerate of others. No fires in the house. And, no guns anywhere on the property! You may smoke whatever you like outside -please use ashtrays and empty them as needed. Guests must have my permission before inviting others to my home. It is never appropriate to bring a person home at night whom you've just met. Hotels are better places for such. Sorry to be so harsh but I can't get any more parking passes for 2 years so I will charge you $150 if you do not return the pass.  Thank you! Enjoy!

name: Castle Iris: 2 BR  *Private Balcony and Fireplace*
neighborhood_overview: Walk to the corner coffee shop for treats and local ambiance with indoor/outdoor seating.  Take a walk 4 blocks to City Park for a stroll around a gorgeous lake or large playground with a castle theme.  You might even see or hear elephants over the wall at the zoo.  Often I can hear the birds, monkeys and many other surprises.  Sometimes you can spot a bald eagle in the trees!  The most amazing breakfast spot (Syrup) is across from the park.  There is plenty of free & convenient street parking in front of my home.  This neighborhood has so much to offer. Prime location walking distance: City Park, Denver Zoo, several restaurants on 17th street. Denver Art and Culture scene of RiNo. Museum of Nature & Science. Very short Lyft ride: Downtown Denver/ Lamier Street/Union Station for restaurants.  There are plenty of bars sprinkled throughout. RiNo is the latest trendy area a few minutes away with Denver Central Market, art galleries, and craft breweries.
transit: Airport (DIA) to this location.  Ride Apps like Lyft and Uber offer pickup and drop-off transportation service for passengers at Denver International Airport. Ride App Pickup Location - Level 5, Island 5:  Passengers who have requested rides through the Lyft and Uber apps should follow signs for ground transportation then exit the terminal through doors 506-510 (west side) and 507-511 (east side) on Level 5 near baggage claim and proceed to Island 5 to meet your driver.  Wait to request your ride until after you’ve claimed your luggage at baggage claim or have arrived on Level 5.
house_rules: - All smoking/vaping is outside only:  Front patio, Balcony (with door closed) and Backyard are permitted.   -Street parking is available and usually convenient.  Please be aware of posted restrictions for street sweeping days. -No more than 4 adults overnight.

name: Upscale Remodeled Home Close to Everything!
neighborhood_overview: Sloan's Lake and Jefferson Park are two cozy neighborhoods on the north side of Denver, and this home is snug in between them. Enjoy the 100 year old homes and quiet tree-lined streets. And our home is just a 1 mile walk to Denver's largest lake: Sloan's Lake.  Try Sexy Pizza for a good slice, walk to Little Machine Brewing for some of the best tasting beer in town, or just enjoy a coffee at 2914 Coffee. And if you want a fancier meal, try Sarto's a delicious Italian eatery just a block away. If you're in the mood for brunch, walk over to Sassafras--trust me, it's incredible!
transit: There are several great places within walking distance. You can also bike to places that are a bit further away. Or, take the bus or light rail to your destination. Uber or Lyft are also great options, are often only a $5-10 to get downtown. And if you drove, you'll have access to the driveway during your stay.
house_rules: *No smoking inside - also don't discard your butts in the house trash cans, please. *No parties, no outside visitors, no overnight guests without previous approval from your host. *No loud music after 10p for the sake of our neighbors. *Use kitchen freely but please clean the kitchen after you use it, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight. *Guest can use washer and dryer *Check out on the day established by the reservation (If the reservation is December 3rd to December 10th, December 10th is the check out day.) *Please help us conserve energy by turning off lights, small appliances, lamps, etc. when not being used.  *Also, please remember to lock the doors on your way out using the Friday Smart Lock app. *If there is an issue with the room or bedroom, please let us know immediately. We work best with guests who are good communicators. *Enjoy your stay!

name: Sunny+Charming 1920s Sunnyside home
neighborhood_overview: Just 2.5 miles from downtown Denver, our friendly Sunnyside neighborhood offers the peace and quiet of a rural suburb with easy access to Denver and popular neighborhoods like LoHi, Tennyson, and the Highlands. There are also several parks (great for a quick jog) and many delicious restaurants and cute boutiques within walking distance from our place (we rarely drive anywhere but to the mountains and to work)!   BONUS: I-70 is just .25 miles from our home making it easy for quick road trips into the mountains and very easy to navigate to/from the airport! PARKING: Good news! If you rented a car, parking wont be a problem. There are always open spaces right in front of our house.
transit: Walk, bike, bus, grab a cab or an Uber, or rent a car and park with ease.  Anything is possible in our neighborhood! TIP: If it is just too cold for us to head out on foot, we usually take an Uber.        They are always minutes away and typically very affordable.
house_rules: Please respect our space and treat it as if it were your own home!  Please also respect our neighbors and keep noise at a minimum after 10:00. Please do not smoke inside. Please no additional guests. And please, no raging parties. Please DO enjoy our city, our mountains and our space and have FUN!

name: Private yet close to everything!
neighborhood_overview: We are centrally located in Denver in the South City Park neighborhood.  A residential street close to everything.  We are a 1/2 block from City Park, home to the Denver Zoo & The Museum of Nature and Science & Ferrill Lake.  We are 2 blocks from Colfax (I 40), where there is shopping, restaurants of all ethnicities & famed entertainment venues such as The Bluebird Theater, The Ogden Theater & The Fillmore.
transit: We are on the major bus lines.  Want to head downtown?  The 15 runs every 15 minutes (24/7) to take you Civic Center Park, Lodo (lower downtown) or the brand new Union Station.  We are next to one of Denver's omnipresent bike paths & less than a block from one of Denver's Rent-A-Bike kiosks.  There is Cars2go, Uber, Lyft, Yellow Cab, Metro Cab & Airport Shuttle.
house_rules: Please be respectful, of the space, the yard & the neighbors.   Pets are awesome!  In fact we have kitties, you may see them roaming around, they are Pickles (gray & white) and Ramen & Dill twin baby calicos, not outside as much as Pickles.   We love all animals, if you like to travel with your pet(s) (or need to) feel free to book our space. The City of Denver is very dog friendly (except to Pitbulls, not allowed inside city limits) so feel free to travel with your doggie love, kittie love, we even had a rat love, but please respect our property & CURB YOUR DOG.  I know lots of people who travel w/what they need but bowls & trays are provided as well.   Please, no incessant barking please.  Don't get me wrong, dogs bark especially when people come and go but guests whose dogs do not like to be left alone or are needy may want to look elsewhere, plan on taking their dog with them, there are lots of dog friendly bars and such or you can hire my dog crazed daughter as dog sitter/checker/

name: King Bd+Full Bath between Downtown and RedRocks!
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very accessible. Our home is 8 blocks from the W train and 2 from 6th avenue, perfect for travelers seeking easy access to both downtown and the mountains. Nearby 6th avenue will take you downtown in 10 minutes or less, to the foothills in 20 minutes and to Summit County in about an hour. Going to a game? You can take an taxi, ubur, lyft or car2go to Mile High Stadium or Coors Field for a fraction of what most people pay to park. We live very close to South Federal which has the best and most diverse and affordable restaurants in the city. New neighborhood brewpubs are opening faster than we can try them.   Hogshead, Seedstock, Wits End, Strange, Chain Reaction, Colorado Cider Company, Little Machine, Trve... to name just a few, are all within in minutes of our house. Barnum park, right down the street, has an awesome outdoor pool and gorgeous view of the Denver skyline. As our neighborhood is primarily residential there are not a variety of shops and restaurants wi
transit: Our home is centrally located on the west side of Denver between the city and the foothills. Our neighborhood is primarily residential and there are not a variety of shops and restaurants within short walking distance. Our location is perfect for travelers with a car who want to divide their time between our city and mountains. But not ideal for guests looking for walking distance night life. However, for those who prefer to avoid the hassles of traffic and parking while on vacation, we are a $10 or less Lyft or Ubur (text me for promo codes if you're new to either) ride from anywhere in Metro Denver. We live 8 blocks from the light rail that runs from the foothills to downtown Denver and to the airport as well. We are also 2 blocks from 6th avenue which will take you downtown in 5-10 minutes, to Red Rocks in 20 minutes and to Summit County in about an hour.  It is easy to find a nearby Car2Go, we are close to several bus lines and have plenty of free street parking.  Again, our neighb
house_rules: We like all guests to be verified thru Airbnb. If you are  booking on behalf of a friend or partner we prefer that you either have a joint profile or at least provide the full name of the person(s) you are traveling with/booking for. That said, we are not uptight in the least but are not late night partiers. Also, not super early risers. Our guests should feel free to keep whatever hours they please, so long as they are reasonably quiet coming and going in the late night or very early morning. We are perfectly fine with marijuana being legal and understand that many visitors to Denver are here to enjoy it. However, for liability reasons and out of respect for our neighbours and other guests we ask that you not partake on the property. I also recently kicked a longtime tobacco habit and therefore ask no cigarette smokers either.*****In regards to the consumption of Cannabis products. We are all adults, we are not your parents, and what happens at Red Rocks is none of our bussiness. That

name: 2BED/BATH Modern Urban Oasis - RiNo
neighborhood_overview: River North (RiNo) is currently the hippest area in Denver, and is home to some of the coolest restaurants, coffee shops, yoga, and live-music venues in the city. 2 minute drive to The Source, Denver's trendsetting sophisticated restaurant and market. Less than 10 minute bike ride or super quick Uber to Coors Field, Union Station, Pepsi Center. 10 minute Uber to Broncos Stadium (Sports Authority Field at Mile High). Quick access to I-70 for the mountains or I-25 to Boulder. Great place to stay if your working downtown.
transit: Working downtown? 15-20 minute walk to downtown, 16th Street Mall, Larimer Square.  Walking distance to Coors Field, B-Cycle station, and RTD stop. Great restaurants, coffee, galleries, bars all within walking distance. Uber easily accessible.

name: POT-FRIENDLY! SPACIOUS 2-BEDROOM
neighborhood_overview: Pleasant Neighbourhood
transit: Free street parking!
house_rules: Pot smoking is totally allowed inside the apartment. However, indoors we do NOT allow guests to smoke cigarettes, cigars, tobacco, blunts, or any rolling papers or wraps that contain tobacco. Joints made with non-tobacco rolling papers may be smoked indoors. If this rule is broken, there will be a charge of $150.00. Cigarette and tobacco smoking is permitted outside the apartment. Proper removal of cigarette butts is required. Keys are in a lock box for your convenience. You will need to return the keys to the lock box on your day of departure. Please note that there is a $175 charge for any lost or missing keys. If you lock yourself out, there's a $75 charge. Pets are not allowed. $250 will be charged if there is any evidence that a pet has been in the apartment. Early check-in and/or late check-out are allowed, when available, and if requested at least 24 hours in advance. There is a fee that is determined at the time of the request.

name: Modern 2 bedroom in Congress Park
neighborhood_overview: The Congress Park/Bluebird district is home to many  bars and restaurants.  The Bluebird theater is across the street and has many concerts.  The location is convenient to everything Denver has to offer.   City Park, the Denver Zoo, Nature and Science Museum are 2 to 3 blocks away.  Downtown, Cherry creek, the Pepsi Center and Invesco field are all within 10 minutes
transit: The main bus line (#15) downtown and to other areas of the city picks up 1/2 block from the condo.   Much of the city is accessible by bike from this location as well.
house_rules: No Smoking!

name: Platte Park at Wellshire Heights
neighborhood_overview: I love the central location of my home. I am exactly a mile from two light rail stations, 1.4 miles from the University of Denver, and if you work downtown or in the DTC area, it's relatively easy to commute with minimal traffic backups.
transit: The light rail is one mile away and there is always Uber and Lyft.
house_rules: - Shoes off at the door. - Please lock the front door when you leave and when you're home at night. - Please put all used dishes in the dishwasher after use. - Please cover your food with a paper towel before putting it into the microwave. - Please clean up after yourselves. - Please use the correct receptacle for trash and recycling, respectively. Parking: Absolutely (100%) make sure that you try to park in front of my house. There is enough space for three cars in front of my house. Please do your best to park in front of my house. If you have to park in front of someone else’s house, please try NOT park in front of the house to the right of mine. If you have friends down, please let them know to park up the street or across the street and pay attention to other peoples driveways. Thanks!
